segment.source: In browse mode in web browsers, the edit field (e and shift+e) and form field (f and shift+f) single letter navigation commands can now be used to move to read-only edit fields. (#4164)
segment.target: In browse mode in web browsers, the edit field (e and shift+e) and form field (f and shift+f) single letter navigation commands can now be used to move to read-only edit fields. (#4164)

segment.source: In NVDA's Document Formatting settings, "Announce formatting changes after the cursor" has been renamed to "Report formatting changes after the cursor", as it affects braille as well as speech. (#6336)
segment.target: In NVDA's Document Formatting settings, "Announce formatting changes after the cursor" has been renamed to "Report formatting changes after the cursor", as it affects braille as well as speech. (#6336)

segment.source: Adjusted the appearance of the NVDA "Welcome dialog". (#6350)
segment.target: Adjusted the appearance of the NVDA "Welcome dialog". (#6350)

segment.source: NVDA dialog boxes now have their "ok" and "cancel" buttons aligned to the right of the dialog. (#6333)
segment.target: NVDA dialog boxes now have their "ok" and "cancel" buttons aligned to the right of the dialog. (#6333)

segment.source: Spin Controls are now used for numeric input fields such as the "Capital pitch change percentage" setting in the Voice Settings dialog. You can enter the desired value or use the up and down arrow keys to adjust the value. (#6099)
segment.target: Spin Controls are now used for numeric input fields such as the "Capital pitch change percentage" setting in the Voice Settings dialog. You can enter the desired value or use the up and down arrow keys to adjust the value. (#6099)

segment.source: The way IFrames (documents embedded within documents) are reported has been made more consistent across web browsers. IFrames are now reported as "frame" in Firefox. (#6047)
segment.target: The way IFrames (documents embedded within documents) are reported has been made more consistent across web browsers. IFrames are now reported as "frame" in Firefox. (#6047)

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: Fixed a rare error when exiting NVDA while the speech viewer is open. (#5050)
segment.target: Fixed a rare error when exiting NVDA while the speech viewer is open. (#5050)

segment.source: Image maps now render as expected in browse mode in Mozilla Firefox. (#6051)
segment.target: Image maps now render as expected in browse mode in Mozilla Firefox. (#6051)

segment.source: While in the dictionary dialog, pressing the enter key now saves any changes you have made and closes the dialog. Previously, pressing enter did nothing. (#6206)
segment.target: While in the dictionary dialog, pressing the enter key now saves any changes you have made and closes the dialog. Previously, pressing enter did nothing. (#6206)

segment.source: Messages are now displayed in braille when changing input modes for an input method (native input/alphanumeric, full shaped/half shaped, etc.). (#5892, #5893)
segment.target: Messages are now displayed in braille when changing input modes for an input method (native input/alphanumeric, full shaped/half shaped, etc.). (#5892, #5893)

segment.source: When disabling and then immediately re-enabling an add-on or vice versa, the add-on status now correctly reverts to what it was previously. (#6299)
segment.target: When disabling and then immediately re-enabling an add-on or vice versa, the add-on status now correctly reverts to what it was previously. (#6299)

segment.source: When using Microsoft Word, page number fields in headers can now be read. (#6004)
segment.target: When using Microsoft Word, page number fields in headers can now be read. (#6004)

segment.source: The mouse can now be used to move focus between the symbol list and the edit fields in the symbol pronunciation dialog. (#6312)
segment.target: The mouse can now be used to move focus between the symbol list and the edit fields in the symbol pronunciation dialog. (#6312)

segment.source: In browse mode in Microsoft Word, Fixed an issue that stops the elements list from appearing when a document contains an invalid hyperlink. (#5886)
segment.target: In browse mode in Microsoft Word, Fixed an issue that stops the elements list from appearing when a document contains an invalid hyperlink. (#5886)

segment.source: After being closed via the task bar or the alt+F4 shortcut, the speech viewer check box in the NVDA menu will now reflect the actual visibility of the window. (#6340)
segment.target: After being closed via the task bar or the alt+F4 shortcut, the speech viewer check box in the NVDA menu will now reflect the actual visibility of the window. (#6340)

segment.source: The reload plugins command no longer causes problems for triggered configuration profiles, new documents in web browsers and screen review. (#2892, #5380)
segment.target: The reload plugins command no longer causes problems for triggered configuration profiles, new documents in web browsers and screen review. (#2892, #5380)

segment.source: In the list of languages in NVDA's General Settings dialog, languages such as Aragonese are now displayed correctly on Windows 10. (#6259)
segment.target: In the list of languages in NVDA's General Settings dialog, languages such as Aragonese are now displayed correctly on Windows 10. (#6259)

segment.source: Emulated system keyboard keys (e.g. a button on a braille display which emulates pressing the tab key) are now presented in the configured NVDA language in input help and the Input Gestures dialog. Previously, they were always presented in English. (#6212)
segment.target: Emulated system keyboard keys (e.g. a button on a braille display which emulates pressing the tab key) are now presented in the configured NVDA language in input help and the Input Gestures dialog. Previously, they were always presented in English. (#6212)

segment.source: Changing the NVDA language (from the General Settings dialog) now has no effect until NVDA is restarted. (#4561)
segment.target: Changing the NVDA language (from the General Settings dialog) now has no effect until NVDA is restarted. (#4561)

segment.source: It is no longer possible to leave the Pattern field blank for a new speech dictionary entry. (#6412)
segment.target: It is no longer possible to leave the Pattern field blank for a new speech dictionary entry. (#6412)

segment.source: Fixed a rare issue when scanning for serial ports on some systems which made some braille display drivers unusable. (#6462)
segment.target: Fixed a rare issue when scanning for serial ports on some systems which made some braille display drivers unusable. (#6462)

segment.source: In Microsoft Word, Numbered bullets in table cells are now read when moving by cell. (#6446)
segment.target: In Microsoft Word, Numbered bullets in table cells are now read when moving by cell. (#6446)

segment.source: It is now possible to assign gestures to commands for the Handy Tech braille display driver in the NVDA Input Gestures dialog. (#6461)
segment.target: It is now possible to assign gestures to commands for the Handy Tech braille display driver in the NVDA Input Gestures dialog. (#6461)

segment.source: In Microsoft Excel, pressing enter or numpadEnter when navigating a spreadsheet now correctly reports navigation to the next row. (#6500)
segment.target: In Microsoft Excel, pressing enter or numpadEnter when navigating a spreadsheet now correctly reports navigation to the next row. (#6500)

segment.source: iTunes no longer intermittently freezes forever when using browse mode for the iTunes Store, Apple Music, etc. (#6502)
segment.target: iTunes no longer intermittently freezes forever when using browse mode for the iTunes Store, Apple Music, etc. (#6502)

segment.source: Fixed crashes in 64 bit Mozilla and Chrome-based applications. (#6497)
segment.target: Fixed crashes in 64 bit Mozilla and Chrome-based applications. (#6497)

segment.source: In Firefox with multi-process enabled, browse mode and editable text fields now function correctly. (#6380)
segment.target: In Firefox with multi-process enabled, browse mode and editable text fields now function correctly. (#6380)

segment.source: Changes for Developers
segment.target: Promene za programere (engleski)

segment.source: It is now possible to provide app modules for executables containing a dot (.) in their names. Dots are replaced with underscores (_). (#5323)
segment.target: It is now possible to provide app modules for executables containing a dot (.) in their names. Dots are replaced with underscores (_). (#5323)

segment.source: The new gui.guiHelper module includes utilities to simplify the creation of wxPython GUIs, including automatic management of spacing. This facilitates better visual appearance and consistency, as well as easing creation of new GUIs for blind developers. (#6287)
segment.target: The new gui.guiHelper module includes utilities to simplify the creation of wxPython GUIs, including automatic management of spacing. This facilitates better visual appearance and consistency, as well as easing creation of new GUIs for blind developers. (#6287)

segment.source: Highlights of this release include the ability to disable individual add-ons; support for form fields in Microsoft Excel; significant improvements to reporting of colors; fixes and improvements related to several braille displays; and fixes and improvements to support for Microsoft Word.
segment.target: Highlights of this release include the ability to disable individual add-ons; support for form fields in Microsoft Excel; significant improvements to reporting of colors; fixes and improvements related to several braille displays; and fixes and improvements to support for Microsoft Word.

segment.source: New Features
segment.target: New Features

segment.source: Browse mode can now be used to read PDF documents in Microsoft Edge in the Windows 10 Anniversary Update. (#5740)
segment.target: Browse mode can now be used to read PDF documents in Microsoft Edge in the Windows 10 Anniversary Update. (#5740)

segment.source: Strikethrough and double-strikethrough are now reported if appropriate in Microsoft Word. (#5800)
segment.target: Strikethrough and double-strikethrough are now reported if appropriate in Microsoft Word. (#5800)

segment.source: In Microsoft Word, the title of a table is now reported if one has been provided. If there is a description, it can be accessed using the open long description command (NVDA+d) in browse mode. (#5943)
segment.target: In Microsoft Word, the title of a table is now reported if one has been provided. If there is a description, it can be accessed using the open long description command (NVDA+d) in browse mode. (#5943)

segment.source: In Microsoft Word, NVDA now reports position information when moving paragraphs (alt+shift+downArrow and alt+shift+upArrow). (#5945)
segment.target: In Microsoft Word, NVDA now reports position information when moving paragraphs (alt+shift+downArrow and alt+shift+upArrow). (#5945)

segment.source: In Microsoft Word, line spacing is now reported via NVDA's report formatting command, when changing it with various Microsoft word shortcut keys, and when moving to text with different line spacing if Report Line Spacing is turned on in NVDA's Document Formatting Settings. (#2961)
segment.target: In Microsoft Word, line spacing is now reported via NVDA's report formatting command, when changing it with various Microsoft word shortcut keys, and when moving to text with different line spacing if Report Line Spacing is turned on in NVDA's Document Formatting Settings. (#2961)

segment.source: In Internet Explorer, HTML5 structural elements are now recognised. (#5591)
segment.target: In Internet Explorer, HTML5 structural elements are now recognised. (#5591)

segment.source: Reporting of comments (such as in Microsoft Word) can now be disabled via a Report Comments checkbox in NVDA's Document Formatting settings dialog. (#5108)
segment.target: Reporting of comments (such as in Microsoft Word) can now be disabled via a Report Comments checkbox in NVDA's Document Formatting settings dialog. (#5108)

segment.source: It is now possible to disable individual add-ons in the Add-ons Manager. (#3090)
segment.target: It is now possible to disable individual add-ons in the Add-ons Manager. (#3090)

segment.source: Additional key assignments have been added for ALVA BC640/680 series braille displays. (#5206)
segment.target: Additional key assignments have been added for ALVA BC640/680 series braille displays. (#5206)

segment.source: There is now a command to move the braille display to the current focus. Currently, only the ALVA BC640/680 series has a key assigned to this command, but it can be assigned manually for other displays in the Input Gestures dialog if desired. (#5250)
segment.target: There is now a command to move the braille display to the current focus. Currently, only the ALVA BC640/680 series has a key assigned to this command, but it can be assigned manually for other displays in the Input Gestures dialog if desired. (#5250)

segment.source: In Microsoft Excel, you can now interact with form fields. You move to form fields using the Elements List or single letter navigation in browse mode. (#4953)
segment.target: In Microsoft Excel, you can now interact with form fields. You move to form fields using the Elements List or single letter navigation in browse mode. (#4953)

segment.source: You can now assign an input gesture to toggle simple review mode using the Input Gestures dialog. (#6173)
segment.target: You can now assign an input gesture to toggle simple review mode using the Input Gestures dialog. (#6173)

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: NVDA now reports colors using a basic well-understood set of 9 color hues and 3 shades, with brightness and paleness variations. This is rather than using more subjective and less understood color names. (#6029)
segment.target: NVDA now reports colors using a basic well-understood set of 9 color hues and 3 shades, with brightness and paleness variations. This is rather than using more subjective and less understood color names. (#6029)

segment.source: The existing NVDA+F9 then NVDA+F10 behavior has been modified to select text on the first press of F10. When F10 is pressed twice (in quick succession) the text is copied to the clipboard. (#4636)
segment.target: The existing NVDA+F9 then NVDA+F10 behavior has been modified to select text on the first press of F10. When F10 is pressed twice (in quick succession) the text is copied to the clipboard. (#4636)

segment.source: Updated eSpeak NG to version Master 11b1a7b (22 June 2016). (#6037)
segment.target: Updated eSpeak NG to version Master 11b1a7b (22 June 2016). (#6037)

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: In browse mode in Microsoft Word, copying to the clipboard now preserves formatting. (#5956)
segment.target: In browse mode in Microsoft Word, copying to the clipboard now preserves formatting. (#5956)

segment.source: In Microsoft Word, NVDA now reports appropriately when using Word's own table navigation commands (alt+home, alt+end, alt+pageUp and alt+pageDown) and table selection commands (shift added to the navigation commands). (#5961)
segment.target: In Microsoft Word, NVDA now reports appropriately when using Word's own table navigation commands (alt+home, alt+end, alt+pageUp and alt+pageDown) and table selection commands (shift added to the navigation commands). (#5961)

segment.source: In Microsoft Word dialog boxes, NVDA's object navigation has been greatly improved. (#6036)
segment.target: In Microsoft Word dialog boxes, NVDA's object navigation has been greatly improved. (#6036)

segment.source: In some applications such as Visual Studio 2015, shortcut keys (e.g. control+c for Copy) are now reported as expected. (#6021)
segment.target: In some applications such as Visual Studio 2015, shortcut keys (e.g. control+c for Copy) are now reported as expected. (#6021)

segment.source: Fixed a rare issue when scanning for serial ports on some systems which made some braille display drivers unusable. (#6015)
segment.target: Fixed a rare issue when scanning for serial ports on some systems which made some braille display drivers unusable. (#6015)

segment.source: Reporting colors in Microsoft Word is now more accurate as changes in Microsoft Office Themes are now taken into account. (#5997)
segment.target: Reporting colors in Microsoft Word is now more accurate as changes in Microsoft Office Themes are now taken into account. (#5997)

segment.source: Browse mode for Microsoft Edge and support for Start Menu search suggestions is again available on Windows 10 builds after April 2016. (#5955)
segment.target: Browse mode for Microsoft Edge and support for Start Menu search suggestions is again available on Windows 10 builds after April 2016. (#5955)

segment.source: In Microsoft Word, automatic table header reading works better when dealing with merged cells. (#5926)
segment.target: In Microsoft Word, automatic table header reading works better when dealing with merged cells. (#5926)

segment.source: In the Windows 10 Mail app, NVDA no longer fails to read the content of messages. (#5635)
segment.target: In the Windows 10 Mail app, NVDA no longer fails to read the content of messages. (#5635)

segment.source: When speak command keys is on, lock keys such as caps lock are no longer announced twice. (#5490)
segment.target: When speak command keys is on, lock keys such as caps lock are no longer announced twice. (#5490)

segment.source: Windows User Account Control dialogs are again read correctly in the Windows 10 Anniversary update. (#5942)
segment.target: Windows User Account Control dialogs are again read correctly in the Windows 10 Anniversary update. (#5942)

segment.source: In the Web Conference Plugin (such as used on out-of-sight.net) NVDA no longer beeps and speaks progress bar updates related to microphone input. (#5888)
segment.target: In the Web Conference Plugin (such as used on out-of-sight.net) NVDA no longer beeps and speaks progress bar updates related to microphone input. (#5888)

segment.source: Performing a Find Next or Find Previous command in Browse Mode will now correctly do a case sensitive search if the original Find was case sensitive. (#5522)
segment.target: Performing a Find Next or Find Previous command in Browse Mode will now correctly do a case sensitive search if the original Find was case sensitive. (#5522)

segment.source: When editing dictionary entries, feedback is now given for invalid regular expressions. NVDA no longer crashes if a dictionary file contains an invalid regular expression. (#4834)
segment.target: When editing dictionary entries, feedback is now given for invalid regular expressions. NVDA no longer crashes if a dictionary file contains an invalid regular expression. (#4834)

segment.source: If NVDA is unable to communicate with a braille display (e.g. because it has been disconnected), it will automatically disable use of the display. (#1555)
segment.target: If NVDA is unable to communicate with a braille display (e.g. because it has been disconnected), it will automatically disable use of the display. (#1555)

segment.source: Slightly improved performance of filtering in the Browse Mode Elements List in some cases. (#6126)
segment.target: Slightly improved performance of filtering in the Browse Mode Elements List in some cases. (#6126)

segment.source: In Microsoft Excel, the background pattern names reported by NVDA now match those used by Excel. (#6092)
segment.target: In Microsoft Excel, the background pattern names reported by NVDA now match those used by Excel. (#6092)

segment.source: Improved support for the Windows 10 logon screen, including announcement of alerts and activating of the password field with touch. (#6010)
segment.target: Improved support for the Windows 10 logon screen, including announcement of alerts and activating of the password field with touch. (#6010)

segment.source: NVDA now correctly detects the secondary routing buttons on ALVA BC640/680 series braille displays. (#5206)
segment.target: NVDA now correctly detects the secondary routing buttons on ALVA BC640/680 series braille displays. (#5206)

segment.source: NVDA can again report Windows Toast notifications in recent builds of Windows 10. (#6096)
segment.target: NVDA can again report Windows Toast notifications in recent builds of Windows 10. (#6096)

segment.source: NVDA no longer occasionally stops recognising key presses on Baum compatible and HumanWare Brailliant B braille displays. (#6035)
segment.target: NVDA no longer occasionally stops recognising key presses on Baum compatible and HumanWare Brailliant B braille displays. (#6035)

segment.source: If reporting of line numbers is enabled in NVDA's Document Formatting preferences, line numbers are now shown on a braille display. (#5941)
segment.target: If reporting of line numbers is enabled in NVDA's Document Formatting preferences, line numbers are now shown on a braille display. (#5941)

segment.source: When speech mode is off, reporting objects (such as pressing NVDA+tab to report the focus) now appears in the Speech Viewer as expected. (#6049)
segment.target: When speech mode is off, reporting objects (such as pressing NVDA+tab to report the focus) now appears in the Speech Viewer as expected. (#6049)

segment.source: In the Outlook 2016 message list, associated draft information is no longer reported. (#6219)
segment.target: In the Outlook 2016 message list, associated draft information is no longer reported. (#6219)

segment.source: In Google Chrome and Chrome-based browsers in a language other than English, browse mode no longer fails to work in many documents. (#6249)
segment.target: In Google Chrome and Chrome-based browsers in a language other than English, browse mode no longer fails to work in many documents. (#6249)

segment.source: Changes for Developers
segment.target: Promene za programere (engleski)

segment.source: Logging information directly from a property no longer results in the property being called recursively over and over again. (#6122)
segment.target: Logging information directly from a property no longer results in the property being called recursively over and over again. (#6122)

segment.source: This release fixes crashes in Microsoft Word:
segment.target: This release fixes crashes in Microsoft Word:

segment.source: NVDA no longer causes Microsoft Word to crash immediately after it starts in Windows XP. (#6033)
segment.target: NVDA no longer causes Microsoft Word to crash immediately after it starts in Windows XP. (#6033)

segment.source: Removed reporting of grammar errors, as this causes crashes in Microsoft Word. (#5954, #5877)
segment.target: Removed reporting of grammar errors, as this causes crashes in Microsoft Word. (#5954, #5877)

segment.source: Highlights of this release include the ability to indicate spelling errors while typing; support for reporting grammar errors in Microsoft Word; and improvements and fixes to Microsoft Office support.
segment.target: Highlights of this release include the ability to indicate spelling errors while typing; support for reporting grammar errors in Microsoft Word; and improvements and fixes to Microsoft Office support.

segment.source: New Features
segment.target: New Features

segment.source: In browse mode in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, using first letter navigation to move by annotation (a and shift+a) now moves to inserted and deleted text. (#5691)
segment.target: In browse mode in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, using first letter navigation to move by annotation (a and shift+a) now moves to inserted and deleted text. (#5691)

segment.source: In Microsoft Excel, NVDA now reports the level of a group of cells, as well as whether it is collapsed or expanded. (#5690)
segment.target: In Microsoft Excel, NVDA now reports the level of a group of cells, as well as whether it is collapsed or expanded. (#5690)

segment.source: Pressing the Report text formatting command (NVDA+f) twice presents the information in browse mode so it can be reviewed. (#4908)
segment.target: Pressing the Report text formatting command (NVDA+f) twice presents the information in browse mode so it can be reviewed. (#4908)

segment.source: In Microsoft Excel 2010 and later, cell shading and gradient fill is now reported. Automatic reporting is controlled by the Report colors option in NVDA's Document Formatting preferences. (#3683)
segment.target: In Microsoft Excel 2010 and later, cell shading and gradient fill is now reported. Automatic reporting is controlled by the Report colors option in NVDA's Document Formatting preferences. (#3683)

segment.source: New braille translation table: Koine Greek. (#5393)
segment.target: New braille translation table: Koine Greek. (#5393)

segment.source: In the Log Viewer, you can now save the log using the shortcut key control+s. (#4532)
segment.target: In the Log Viewer, you can now save the log using the shortcut key control+s. (#4532)

segment.source: If reporting of spelling errors is enabled and supported in the focused control, NVDA will play a sound to alert you of a spelling error made while typing. This can be disabled using the new "Play sound for spelling errors while typing" option in NVDA's Keyboard Settings dialog. (#2024)
segment.target: If reporting of spelling errors is enabled and supported in the focused control, NVDA will play a sound to alert you of a spelling error made while typing. This can be disabled using the new "Play sound for spelling errors while typing" option in NVDA's Keyboard Settings dialog. (#2024)

segment.source: Grammar errors are now reported in Microsoft Word. This can be disabled using the new "Report grammar errors" option in NVDA's Document Formatting preferences dialog. (#5877)
segment.target: Grammar errors are now reported in Microsoft Word. This can be disabled using the new "Report grammar errors" option in NVDA's Document Formatting preferences dialog. (#5877)

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: In browse mode and editable text fields, NVDA now treats numpadEnter the same as the main enter key. (#5385)
segment.target: In browse mode and editable text fields, NVDA now treats numpadEnter the same as the main enter key. (#5385)

segment.source: NVDA has switched to the eSpeak NG speech synthesizer. (#5651)
segment.target: NVDA has switched to the eSpeak NG speech synthesizer. (#5651)

segment.source: In Microsoft Excel, NVDA no longer ignores a column header for a cell when there is a blank row between the cell and the header. (#5396)
segment.target: In Microsoft Excel, NVDA no longer ignores a column header for a cell when there is a blank row between the cell and the header. (#5396)

segment.source: In Microsoft Excel, coordinates are now announced before headers to eliminate ambiguity between headers and content. (#5396)
segment.target: In Microsoft Excel, coordinates are now announced before headers to eliminate ambiguity between headers and content. (#5396)

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: In browse mode, when attempting to use single letter navigation to move to an element which isn't supported for the document, NVDA reports that this isn't supported rather than reporting that there is no element in that direction. (#5691)
segment.target: In browse mode, when attempting to use single letter navigation to move to an element which isn't supported for the document, NVDA reports that this isn't supported rather than reporting that there is no element in that direction. (#5691)

segment.source: When listing sheets in the Elements List in Microsoft Excel, sheets containing only charts are now included. (#5698)
segment.target: When listing sheets in the Elements List in Microsoft Excel, sheets containing only charts are now included. (#5698)

segment.source: NVDA no longer reports extraneous information when switching windows in a Java application with multiple windows such as IntelliJ or Android Studio. (#5732)
segment.target: NVDA no longer reports extraneous information when switching windows in a Java application with multiple windows such as IntelliJ or Android Studio. (#5732)

segment.source: In Scintilla based editors such as Notepad++, braille is now updated correctly when moving the cursor using a braille display. (#5678)
segment.target: In Scintilla based editors such as Notepad++, braille is now updated correctly when moving the cursor using a braille display. (#5678)

segment.source: NVDA no longer sometimes crashes when enabling braille output. (#4457)
segment.target: NVDA no longer sometimes crashes when enabling braille output. (#4457)

segment.source: In Microsoft Word, paragraph indentation is now always reported in the measurement unit chosen by the user (e.g. centimeters or inches). (#5804)
segment.target: In Microsoft Word, paragraph indentation is now always reported in the measurement unit chosen by the user (e.g. centimeters or inches). (#5804)

segment.source: When using a braille display, many NVDA messages that were previously only spoken are now brailled as well. (#5557)
segment.target: When using a braille display, many NVDA messages that were previously only spoken are now brailled as well. (#5557)

segment.source: In accessible Java applications, the level of tree view items is now reported. (#5766)
segment.target: In accessible Java applications, the level of tree view items is now reported. (#5766)

segment.source: Fixed crashes in Adobe Flash in Mozilla Firefox in some cases. (#5367)
segment.target: Fixed crashes in Adobe Flash in Mozilla Firefox in some cases. (#5367)

segment.source: In Google Chrome and Chrome-based browsers, documents within dialogs or applications can now be read in browse mode. (#5818)
segment.target: In Google Chrome and Chrome-based browsers, documents within dialogs or applications can now be read in browse mode. (#5818)

segment.source: In Google Chrome and Chrome-based browsers, you can now force NVDA to switch to browse mode in web dialogs or applications. (#5818)
segment.target: In Google Chrome and Chrome-based browsers, you can now force NVDA to switch to browse mode in web dialogs or applications. (#5818)

segment.source: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, moving focus to certain controls (specifically, where aria-activedescendant is used) no longer incorrectly switches to browse mode. This occurred, for example, when moving to suggestions in address fields when composing a message in Gmail. (#5676)
segment.target: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, moving focus to certain controls (specifically, where aria-activedescendant is used) no longer incorrectly switches to browse mode. This occurred, for example, when moving to suggestions in address fields when composing a message in Gmail. (#5676)

segment.source: In Microsoft Word, NVDA no longer freezes in large tables when reporting of table row/column headers is enabled. (#5878)
segment.target: In Microsoft Word, NVDA no longer freezes in large tables when reporting of table row/column headers is enabled. (#5878)

segment.source: In Microsoft word, NVDA no longer incorrectly reports text with an outline level (but not a built-in heading style) as a heading. (#5186)
segment.target: In Microsoft word, NVDA no longer incorrectly reports text with an outline level (but not a built-in heading style) as a heading. (#5186)

segment.source: In browse mode in Microsoft Word, the Move past end/to start of container commands (comma and shift+comma) now work for tables. (#5883)
segment.target: In browse mode in Microsoft Word, the Move past end/to start of container commands (comma and shift+comma) now work for tables. (#5883)

segment.source: Changes for Developers
segment.target: Promene za programere (engleski)

segment.source: NVDA's C++ components are now built with Microsoft Visual Studio 2015. (#5592)
segment.target: NVDA's C++ components are now built with Microsoft Visual Studio 2015. (#5592)

segment.source: You can now present a text or HTML message to the user in browse mode using ui.browseableMessage. (#4908)
segment.target: You can now present a text or HTML message to the user in browse mode using ui.browseableMessage. (#4908)

segment.source: In the User Guide, when a <!-- KC:setting command is used for a setting which has a common key for all layouts, the key may now be placed after a full-width colon (：) as well as the regular colon (:). (#5739) -->
segment.target: In the User Guide, when a <!-- KC:setting command is used for a setting which has a common key for all layouts, the key may now be placed after a full-width colon (：) as well as the regular colon (:). (#5739) -->

segment.source: Highlights of this release include the ability to optionally lower the volume of other sounds; improvements to braille output and braille display support; several significant fixes to Microsoft Office support; and fixes to browse mode in iTunes.
segment.target: Highlights of this release include the ability to optionally lower the volume of other sounds; improvements to braille output and braille display support; several significant fixes to Microsoft Office support; and fixes to browse mode in iTunes.

segment.source: New Features
segment.target: New Features

segment.source: New braille translation tables: Polish 8 dot computer braille, Mongolian. (#5537, #5574)
segment.target: New braille translation tables: Polish 8 dot computer braille, Mongolian. (#5537, #5574)

segment.source: You can turn off the braille cursor and change its shape using the new Show cursor and Cursor shape options in the Braille Settings dialog. (#5198)
segment.target: You can turn off the braille cursor and change its shape using the new Show cursor and Cursor shape options in the Braille Settings dialog. (#5198)

segment.source: NVDA can now connect to a HIMS Smart Beetle braille display via Bluetooth. (#5607)
segment.target: NVDA can now connect to a HIMS Smart Beetle braille display via Bluetooth. (#5607)

segment.source: NVDA can optionally lower the volume of other sounds when installed on Windows 8 and later. This can be configured using the Audio ducking mode option in the NVDA Synthesizer dialog or by pressing NVDA+shift+d. (#3830, #5575)
segment.target: NVDA can optionally lower the volume of other sounds when installed on Windows 8 and later. This can be configured using the Audio ducking mode option in the NVDA Synthesizer dialog or by pressing NVDA+shift+d. (#3830, #5575)

segment.source: Support for the APH Refreshabraille in HID mode and the Baum VarioUltra and Pronto! when connected via USB. (#5609)
segment.target: Support for the APH Refreshabraille in HID mode and the Baum VarioUltra and Pronto! when connected via USB. (#5609)

segment.source: Support for HumanWare Brailliant BI/B braille displays when the protocol is set to OpenBraille. (#5612)
segment.target: Support for HumanWare Brailliant BI/B braille displays when the protocol is set to OpenBraille. (#5612)

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: Reporting of emphasis is now disabled by default. (#4920)
segment.target: Reporting of emphasis is now disabled by default. (#4920)

segment.source: In the Elements List dialog in Microsoft Excel, the shortcut for Formulas has been changed to alt+r so that it is different to the shortcut for the Filter field. (#5527)
segment.target: In the Elements List dialog in Microsoft Excel, the shortcut for Formulas has been changed to alt+r so that it is different to the shortcut for the Filter field. (#5527)

segment.source: Updated liblouis braille translator to 2.6.5. (#5574)
segment.target: Updated liblouis braille translator to 2.6.5. (#5574)

segment.source: The word "text" is no longer reported when moving the focus or review cursor to text objects. (#5452)
segment.target: The word "text" is no longer reported when moving the focus or review cursor to text objects. (#5452)

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: In iTunes 12, browse mode now updates correctly when a new page loads in the iTunes Store. (#5191)
segment.target: In iTunes 12, browse mode now updates correctly when a new page loads in the iTunes Store. (#5191)

segment.source: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, moving to specific heading levels with single letter navigation now behaves as expected when the level of a heading is overridden for accessibility purposes (specifically, when aria-level overrides the level of an h tag). (#5434)
segment.target: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, moving to specific heading levels with single letter navigation now behaves as expected when the level of a heading is overridden for accessibility purposes (specifically, when aria-level overrides the level of an h tag). (#5434)

segment.source: In Spotify, focus no longer frequently lands on "unknown" objects. (#5439)
segment.target: In Spotify, focus no longer frequently lands on "unknown" objects. (#5439)

segment.source: Focus is now restored correctly when returning to Spotify from another application. (#5439)
segment.target: Focus is now restored correctly when returning to Spotify from another application. (#5439)

segment.source: When toggling between browse mode and focus mode, the mode is reported in braille as well as speech. (#5239)
segment.target: When toggling between browse mode and focus mode, the mode is reported in braille as well as speech. (#5239)

segment.source: The Start buttn on the Taskbar is no longer reported as a list and/or as selected in some versions of Windows. (#5178)
segment.target: The Start buttn on the Taskbar is no longer reported as a list and/or as selected in some versions of Windows. (#5178)

segment.source: Messages such as "inserted" are no longer reported when composing messages in Microsoft Outlook. (#5486)
segment.target: Messages such as "inserted" are no longer reported when composing messages in Microsoft Outlook. (#5486)

segment.source: When using a braille display and text is selected on the current line (e.g. when searching in a text editor for text which occurs on the same line), the braille display will be scrolled if appropriate. (#5410)
segment.target: When using a braille display and text is selected on the current line (e.g. when searching in a text editor for text which occurs on the same line), the braille display will be scrolled if appropriate. (#5410)

segment.source: NVDA no longer silently exits when closing a Windows command console with alt+f4 in Windows 10. (#5343)
segment.target: NVDA no longer silently exits when closing a Windows command console with alt+f4 in Windows 10. (#5343)

segment.source: In the Elements List in browse mode, when you change the type of element, the Filter by field is now cleared. (#5511)
segment.target: In the Elements List in browse mode, when you change the type of element, the Filter by field is now cleared. (#5511)

segment.source: In editable text in Mozilla applications, moving the mouse again reads the appropriate line, word, etc. as expected instead of the entire content. (#5535)
segment.target: In editable text in Mozilla applications, moving the mouse again reads the appropriate line, word, etc. as expected instead of the entire content. (#5535)

segment.source: When moving the mouse in editable text in Mozilla applications, reading no longer stops at elements such as links within the word or line being read. (#2160, #5535)
segment.target: When moving the mouse in editable text in Mozilla applications, reading no longer stops at elements such as links within the word or line being read. (#2160, #5535)

segment.source: In Internet Explorer, the shoprite.com website can now be read in browse mode instead of reporting as blank. (Specifically, malformed lang attributes are now handled gracefully.) (#5569)
segment.target: In Internet Explorer, the shoprite.com website can now be read in browse mode instead of reporting as blank. (Specifically, malformed lang attributes are now handled gracefully.) (#5569)

segment.source: In Microsoft Word, tracked changes such as "inserted" are no longer reported when track changes markup is not displayed. (#5566)
segment.target: In Microsoft Word, tracked changes such as "inserted" are no longer reported when track changes markup is not displayed. (#5566)

segment.source: When a toggle button is focused, NVDA now reports when it is changed from pressed to not pressed. (#5441)
segment.target: When a toggle button is focused, NVDA now reports when it is changed from pressed to not pressed. (#5441)

segment.source: Reporting of mouse shape changes again works as expected. (#5595)
segment.target: Reporting of mouse shape changes again works as expected. (#5595)

segment.source: When speaking line indentation, non-breaking spaces are now treated as normal spaces. Previously, this could cause announcements such as "space space space" instead of "3 space". (#5610)
segment.target: When speaking line indentation, non-breaking spaces are now treated as normal spaces. Previously, this could cause announcements such as "space space space" instead of "3 space". (#5610)

segment.source: When closing a modern Microsoft input method candidate list, focus is correctly restored to either the input composition or the underlying document. (#4145)
segment.target: When closing a modern Microsoft input method candidate list, focus is correctly restored to either the input composition or the underlying document. (#4145)

segment.source: In Microsoft Office 2013 and later, when the ribbon is set to show only tabs, items in the ribbon are again reported as expected when a tab is activated. (#5504)
segment.target: In Microsoft Office 2013 and later, when the ribbon is set to show only tabs, items in the ribbon are again reported as expected when a tab is activated. (#5504)

segment.source: Fixes and improvements to touch screen gesture detection and binding. (#5652)
segment.target: Fixes and improvements to touch screen gesture detection and binding. (#5652)

segment.source: Touch screen hovers are no longer reported in input help. (#5652)
segment.target: Touch screen hovers are no longer reported in input help. (#5652)

segment.source: NVDA no longer fails to list comments in the Elements List for Microsoft Excel if a comment is on a merged cell. (#5704)
segment.target: NVDA no longer fails to list comments in the Elements List for Microsoft Excel if a comment is on a merged cell. (#5704)

segment.source: In a very rare case, NVDA no longer fails to read sheet content in Microsoft Excel with reporting of row and column headers enabled. (#5705)
segment.target: In a very rare case, NVDA no longer fails to read sheet content in Microsoft Excel with reporting of row and column headers enabled. (#5705)

segment.source: In Google Chrome, navigating within an Input composition when entering east Asian characters now works as expected. (#4080)
segment.target: In Google Chrome, navigating within an Input composition when entering east Asian characters now works as expected. (#4080)

segment.source: When searching Apple Music in iTunes, browse mode for the search results document is now updated as expected. (#5659)
segment.target: When searching Apple Music in iTunes, browse mode for the search results document is now updated as expected. (#5659)

segment.source: In Microsoft Excel, pressing shift+f11 to create a new sheet now reports your new position instead of reporting nothing. (#5689)
segment.target: In Microsoft Excel, pressing shift+f11 to create a new sheet now reports your new position instead of reporting nothing. (#5689)

segment.source: Fixed problems with braille display output when entering Korean characters. (#5640)
segment.target: Fixed problems with braille display output when entering Korean characters. (#5640)

segment.source: Changes for Developers
segment.target: Promene za programere (engleski)

segment.source: The new audioDucking.AudioDucker class allows code which outputs audio to indicate when background audio should be ducked. (#3830)
segment.target: The new audioDucking.AudioDucker class allows code which outputs audio to indicate when background audio should be ducked. (#3830)

segment.source: nvwave.WavePlayer's constructor now has a wantDucking keyword argument which specifies whether background audio should be ducked while audio is playing. (#3830)
segment.target: nvwave.WavePlayer's constructor now has a wantDucking keyword argument which specifies whether background audio should be ducked while audio is playing. (#3830)

segment.source: When this is enabled (which is the default), it is essential that WavePlayer.idle be called when appropriate.
segment.target: When this is enabled (which is the default), it is essential that WavePlayer.idle be called when appropriate.

segment.source: Enhanced I/O for braille displays: (#5609)
segment.target: Enhanced I/O for braille displays: (#5609)

segment.source: Thread-safe braille display drivers can declare themselves as such using the BrailleDisplayDriver.isThreadSafe attribute. A driver must be thread-safe to benefit from the following features.
segment.target: Thread-safe braille display drivers can declare themselves as such using the BrailleDisplayDriver.isThreadSafe attribute. A driver must be thread-safe to benefit from the following features.

segment.source: Data is written to thread-safe braille display drivers in the background, thus improving performance.
segment.target: Data is written to thread-safe braille display drivers in the background, thus improving performance.

segment.source: hwIo.Serial extends pyserial to call a callable when data is received instead of drivers having to poll.
segment.target: hwIo.Serial extends pyserial to call a callable when data is received instead of drivers having to poll.

segment.source: hwIo.Hid provides support for braille displays communicating via USB HID.
segment.target: hwIo.Hid provides support for braille displays communicating via USB HID.

segment.source: hwPortUtils and hwIo can optionally provide detailed debug logging, including devices found and all data sent and received.
segment.target: hwPortUtils and hwIo can optionally provide detailed debug logging, including devices found and all data sent and received.

segment.source: There are several new properties accessible from touch screen gestures: (#5652)
segment.target: There are several new properties accessible from touch screen gestures: (#5652)

segment.source: MultitouchTracker objects now contain a childTrackers property which contains the MultiTouchTrackers the tracker was composed of. For example, 2 finger double tap has child trackers for two 2-finger taps. The 2-finger taps themselves have child trackers for two taps.
segment.target: MultitouchTracker objects now contain a childTrackers property which contains the MultiTouchTrackers the tracker was composed of. For example, 2 finger double tap has child trackers for two 2-finger taps. The 2-finger taps themselves have child trackers for two taps.

segment.source: MultiTouchTracker objects now also contain a rawSingleTouchTracker property if the tracker was the result of one single finger doing a tap, flick or hover. The SingleTouchTracker allows access to the underlying ID assigned to the finger by the operating system and whether or not the finger is still in contact at the current time.
segment.target: MultiTouchTracker objects now also contain a rawSingleTouchTracker property if the tracker was the result of one single finger doing a tap, flick or hover. The SingleTouchTracker allows access to the underlying ID assigned to the finger by the operating system and whether or not the finger is still in contact at the current time.

segment.source: TouchInputGestures now have x and y properties, removing the need to access the tracker for trivial cases.
segment.target: TouchInputGestures now have x and y properties, removing the need to access the tracker for trivial cases.

segment.source: TouchInputGesturs now contain a preheldTracker property, which is a MultitouchTracker object representing the other fingers held while this action was being performed.
segment.target: TouchInputGesturs now contain a preheldTracker property, which is a MultitouchTracker object representing the other fingers held while this action was being performed.

segment.source: Two new touch screen gestures can be emitted: (#5652)
segment.target: Two new touch screen gestures can be emitted: (#5652)

segment.source: Plural tap and holds (e.g. double tap and hold)
segment.target: Plural tap and holds (e.g. double tap and hold)

segment.source: A generalized identifier with finger count removed for holds (e.g. hold+hover for 1finger_hold+hover).
segment.target: A generalized identifier with finger count removed for holds (e.g. hold+hover for 1finger_hold+hover).

segment.source: Highlights of this release include performance improvements in Windows 10; inclusion in the Ease of Access Center in Windows 8 and later; enhancements for Microsoft Excel, including listing and renaming of sheets and access to locked cells in protected sheets; and support for editing of rich text in Mozilla Firefox, Google Chrome and Mozilla Thunderbird.
segment.target: Highlights of this release include performance improvements in Windows 10; inclusion in the Ease of Access Center in Windows 8 and later; enhancements for Microsoft Excel, including listing and renaming of sheets and access to locked cells in protected sheets; and support for editing of rich text in Mozilla Firefox, Google Chrome and Mozilla Thunderbird.

segment.source: New Features
segment.target: New Features

segment.source: NVDA now appears in the Ease of Access Center in Windows 8 and later. (#308)
segment.target: NVDA now appears in the Ease of Access Center in Windows 8 and later. (#308)

segment.source: When moving around cells in Excel, formatting changes are now automatically reported if the appropriate options are turned on in NVDA's Document Formatting Settings dialog. (#4878)
segment.target: When moving around cells in Excel, formatting changes are now automatically reported if the appropriate options are turned on in NVDA's Document Formatting Settings dialog. (#4878)

segment.source: A Report Emphasis option has been added to NVDA's Document formatting settings dialog. On by default, this option allows NVDA to automatically report the existence of emphasised text in documents. So far, this is only supported for em and strong tags in Browse Mode for Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls. (#4920)
segment.target: A Report Emphasis option has been added to NVDA's Document formatting settings dialog. On by default, this option allows NVDA to automatically report the existence of emphasised text in documents. So far, this is only supported for em and strong tags in Browse Mode for Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls. (#4920)

segment.source: The existence of inserted and deleted text is now reported in Browse Mode for Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls if NVDA's Report Editor Revisions option is enabled. (#4920)
segment.target: The existence of inserted and deleted text is now reported in Browse Mode for Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls if NVDA's Report Editor Revisions option is enabled. (#4920)

segment.source: When viewing track changes in NVDA's Elements List for Microsoft Word, more information such as what formatting properties were changed is now displayed. (#4920)
segment.target: When viewing track changes in NVDA's Elements List for Microsoft Word, more information such as what formatting properties were changed is now displayed. (#4920)

segment.source: Microsoft Excel: listing and renaming of sheets is now possible from NVDA's Elements List (NVDA+f7). (#4630, #4414)
segment.target: Microsoft Excel: listing and renaming of sheets is now possible from NVDA's Elements List (NVDA+f7). (#4630, #4414)

segment.source: It is now possible to configure whether actual symbols are sent to speech synthesizers (e.g. to cause a pause or change in inflection) in the Symbol Pronunciation dialog. (#5234)
segment.target: It is now possible to configure whether actual symbols are sent to speech synthesizers (e.g. to cause a pause or change in inflection) in the Symbol Pronunciation dialog. (#5234)

segment.source: In Microsoft Excel, NVDA now reports any input messages set by the sheet author on cells. (#5051)
segment.target: In Microsoft Excel, NVDA now reports any input messages set by the sheet author on cells. (#5051)

segment.source: Support for the Baum Pronto! V4 and VarioUltra braille displays when connected via Bluetooth. (#3717)
segment.target: Support for the Baum Pronto! V4 and VarioUltra braille displays when connected via Bluetooth. (#3717)

segment.source: Support for editing of rich text in Mozilla applications such as Google Docs with braille support enabled in Mozilla Firefox and HTML composition in Mozilla Thunderbird. (#1668)
segment.target: Support for editing of rich text in Mozilla applications such as Google Docs with braille support enabled in Mozilla Firefox and HTML composition in Mozilla Thunderbird. (#1668)

segment.source: Support for editing of rich text in Google Chrome and Chrome-based browsers such as Google Docs with braille support enabled. (#2634)
segment.target: Support for editing of rich text in Google Chrome and Chrome-based browsers such as Google Docs with braille support enabled. (#2634)

segment.source: This requires Chrome version 47 or later.
segment.target: This requires Chrome version 47 or later.

segment.source: In browse mode in Microsoft Excel, you can navigate to locked cells in protected sheets. (#4952)
segment.target: In browse mode in Microsoft Excel, you can navigate to locked cells in protected sheets. (#4952)

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: The Report Editor Revisions option in NVDA's Document formatting settings dialog is now turned on by default. (#4920)
segment.target: The Report Editor Revisions option in NVDA's Document formatting settings dialog is now turned on by default. (#4920)

segment.source: When moving by character in Microsoft Word with NVDA's Report Editor Revisions option enabled, less information is now reported for track changes, which makes navigation more efficient. To view the extra information, use the Elements List. (#4920)
segment.target: When moving by character in Microsoft Word with NVDA's Report Editor Revisions option enabled, less information is now reported for track changes, which makes navigation more efficient. To view the extra information, use the Elements List. (#4920)

segment.source: Updated liblouis braille translator to 2.6.4. (#5341)
segment.target: Updated liblouis braille translator to 2.6.4. (#5341)

segment.source: Several symbols (including basic mathematical symbols) have been moved to level some so that they are spoken by default. (#3799)
segment.target: Several symbols (including basic mathematical symbols) have been moved to level some so that they are spoken by default. (#3799)

segment.source: If the synthesizer supports it, speech should now pause for parentheses and the en dash (–). (#3799)
segment.target: If the synthesizer supports it, speech should now pause for parentheses and the en dash (–). (#3799)

segment.source: When selecting text, the text is reported before the indication of selection instead of after. (#1707)
segment.target: When selecting text, the text is reported before the indication of selection instead of after. (#1707)

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: Major performance improvements when navigating the Outlook 2010/2013 message list. (#5268)
segment.target: Major performance improvements when navigating the Outlook 2010/2013 message list. (#5268)

segment.source: In a chart in Microsoft Excel, navigating with certain keys (such as changing sheets with control+pageUp and control+pageDown) now works correctly. (#5336)
segment.target: In a chart in Microsoft Excel, navigating with certain keys (such as changing sheets with control+pageUp and control+pageDown) now works correctly. (#5336)

segment.source: Fixed the visual appearance of the buttons in the warning dialog which is displayed when you attempt to downgrade NVDA. (#5325)
segment.target: Fixed the visual appearance of the buttons in the warning dialog which is displayed when you attempt to downgrade NVDA. (#5325)

segment.source: In Windows 8 and later, NVDA now starts a lot earlier when configured to start after logging on to Windows. (#308)
segment.target: In Windows 8 and later, NVDA now starts a lot earlier when configured to start after logging on to Windows. (#308)

segment.source: If you enabled this using a previous version of NVDA, you will need to disable it and enable it again in order for the change to take effect. Follow this procedure:
segment.target: If you enabled this using a previous version of NVDA, you will need to disable it and enable it again in order for the change to take effect. Follow this procedure:

segment.source: Open the General Settings dialog.
segment.target: Open the General Settings dialog.

segment.source: Uncheck the Automatically start NVDA after I log on to Windows checkbox.
segment.target: Uncheck the Automatically start NVDA after I log on to Windows checkbox.

segment.source: Press the OK button.
segment.target: Press the OK button.

segment.source: Open the General Settings dialog again.
segment.target: Open the General Settings dialog again.

segment.source: Check the Automatically start NVDA after I log on to Windows checkbox.
segment.target: Check the Automatically start NVDA after I log on to Windows checkbox.

segment.source: Press the OK button.
segment.target: Press the OK button.

segment.source: Performance enhancements for UI Automation including File Explorer and Task Viewer. (#5293)
segment.target: Performance enhancements for UI Automation including File Explorer and Task Viewer. (#5293)

segment.source: NVDA now correctly switches to focus mode when tabbing to read-only ARIA grid controls in Browse Mode for Mozilla Firefox and other Gecko-based controls. (#5118)
segment.target: NVDA now correctly switches to focus mode when tabbing to read-only ARIA grid controls in Browse Mode for Mozilla Firefox and other Gecko-based controls. (#5118)

segment.source: NVDA now correctly reports "no previous" instead of "no next" when there are no more objects when flicking left on a touch screen.
segment.target: NVDA now correctly reports "no previous" instead of "no next" when there are no more objects when flicking left on a touch screen.

segment.source: Fixed problems when typing multiple words into the filter field in the Input Gestures dialog. (#5426)
segment.target: Fixed problems when typing multiple words into the filter field in the Input Gestures dialog. (#5426)

segment.source: NVDA no longer freezes in some cases when reconnecting to a HumanWare Brailliant BI/B series display via USB. (#5406)
segment.target: NVDA no longer freezes in some cases when reconnecting to a HumanWare Brailliant BI/B series display via USB. (#5406)

segment.source: In languages with conjunct characters, character descriptions now work as expected for upper case English characters. (#5375)
segment.target: In languages with conjunct characters, character descriptions now work as expected for upper case English characters. (#5375)

segment.source: NVDA should no longer occasionally freeze when bringing up the Start Menu in Windows 10. (#5417)
segment.target: NVDA should no longer occasionally freeze when bringing up the Start Menu in Windows 10. (#5417)

segment.source: In Skype for Desktop, notifications which are displayed before a previous notification disappears are now reported. (#4841)
segment.target: In Skype for Desktop, notifications which are displayed before a previous notification disappears are now reported. (#4841)

segment.source: Notifications are now reported correctly in Skype for Desktop 7.12 and later. (#5405)
segment.target: Notifications are now reported correctly in Skype for Desktop 7.12 and later. (#5405)

segment.source: NVDA now correctly reports the focus when dismissing a context menu in some applications such as Jart. (#5302)
segment.target: NVDA now correctly reports the focus when dismissing a context menu in some applications such as Jart. (#5302)

segment.source: In Windows 7 and later, Color is again reported in certain applications such as Wordpad. (#5352)
segment.target: In Windows 7 and later, Color is again reported in certain applications such as Wordpad. (#5352)

segment.source: When editing in Microsoft PowerPoint, pressing enter now reports automatically entered text such as a bullet or number. (#5360)
segment.target: When editing in Microsoft PowerPoint, pressing enter now reports automatically entered text such as a bullet or number. (#5360)

segment.source: Highlights of this release include initial support for Windows 10; the ability to disable single letter navigation in browse mode (useful for some web apps); improvements in Internet Explorer; and fixes for garbled text when typing in certain applications with braille enabled.
segment.target: Highlights of this release include initial support for Windows 10; the ability to disable single letter navigation in browse mode (useful for some web apps); improvements in Internet Explorer; and fixes for garbled text when typing in certain applications with braille enabled.

segment.source: New Features
segment.target: New Features

segment.source: The existence of spelling errors is announced in editable fields for Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls. (#4174)
segment.target: The existence of spelling errors is announced in editable fields for Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls. (#4174)

segment.source: Many more Unicode math symbols are now spoken when they appear in text. (#3805)
segment.target: Many more Unicode math symbols are now spoken when they appear in text. (#3805)

segment.source: Search suggestions in the Windows 10 start screen are automatically reported. (#5049)
segment.target: Search suggestions in the Windows 10 start screen are automatically reported. (#5049)

segment.source: Support for the EcoBraille 20, EcoBraille 40, EcoBraille 80 and EcoBraille Plus braille displays. (#4078)
segment.target: Support for the EcoBraille 20, EcoBraille 40, EcoBraille 80 and EcoBraille Plus braille displays. (#4078)

segment.source: In browse mode, you can now toggle single letter navigation on and off by pressing NVDA+shift+space. When off, single letter keys are passed to the application, which is useful for some web applications such as Gmail, Twitter and Facebook. (#3203)
segment.target: In browse mode, you can now toggle single letter navigation on and off by pressing NVDA+shift+space. When off, single letter keys are passed to the application, which is useful for some web applications such as Gmail, Twitter and Facebook. (#3203)

segment.source: New braille translation tables: Finnish 6 dot, Irish grade 1, Irish grade 2, Korean grade 1 (2006), Korean grade 2 (2006). (#5137, #5074, #5097)
segment.target: New braille translation tables: Finnish 6 dot, Irish grade 1, Irish grade 2, Korean grade 1 (2006), Korean grade 2 (2006). (#5137, #5074, #5097)

segment.source: The QWERTY keyboard on the Papenmeier BRAILLEX Live Plus braille display is now supported. (#5181)
segment.target: The QWERTY keyboard on the Papenmeier BRAILLEX Live Plus braille display is now supported. (#5181)

segment.source: Experimental support for the Microsoft Edge web browser and browsing engine in Windows 10. (#5212)
segment.target: Experimental support for the Microsoft Edge web browser and browsing engine in Windows 10. (#5212)

segment.source: New language: Kannada.
segment.target: New language: Kannada.

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: Updated liblouis braille translator to 2.6.3. (#5137)
segment.target: Updated liblouis braille translator to 2.6.3. (#5137)

segment.source: When attempting to install an earlier version of NVDA than is currently installed, you will now be warned that this is not recommended and that NVDA should be completely uninstalled before proceeding. (#5037)
segment.target: When attempting to install an earlier version of NVDA than is currently installed, you will now be warned that this is not recommended and that NVDA should be completely uninstalled before proceeding. (#5037)

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: In browse mode for Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, quick navigation by form field no longer incorrectly includes presentational list items. (#4204)
segment.target: In browse mode for Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, quick navigation by form field no longer incorrectly includes presentational list items. (#4204)

segment.source: In Firefox, NVDA no longer inappropriately reports the content of an ARIA tab panel when focus moves inside it. (#4638)
segment.target: In Firefox, NVDA no longer inappropriately reports the content of an ARIA tab panel when focus moves inside it. (#4638)

segment.source: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, tabbing into sections, articles or dialogs no longer inappropriately reports all content in the container. (#5021, #5025)
segment.target: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, tabbing into sections, articles or dialogs no longer inappropriately reports all content in the container. (#5021, #5025)

segment.source: When using Baum/HumanWare/APH braille displays with a braille keyboard, braille input no longer stops functioning after pressing another type of key on the display. (#3541)
segment.target: When using Baum/HumanWare/APH braille displays with a braille keyboard, braille input no longer stops functioning after pressing another type of key on the display. (#3541)

segment.source: In Windows 10, extraneous information is no longer reported when pressing alt+tab or alt+shift+tab to switch between applications. (#5116)
segment.target: In Windows 10, extraneous information is no longer reported when pressing alt+tab or alt+shift+tab to switch between applications. (#5116)

segment.source: Typed text is no longer garbled when using certain applications such as Microsoft Outlook with a braille display. (#2953)
segment.target: Typed text is no longer garbled when using certain applications such as Microsoft Outlook with a braille display. (#2953)

segment.source: In browse mode in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, the correct content is now reported when an element appears or changes and is immediately focused. (#5040)
segment.target: In browse mode in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, the correct content is now reported when an element appears or changes and is immediately focused. (#5040)

segment.source: In browse mode in Microsoft Word, single letter navigation now updates the braille display and the review cursor as expected. (#4968)
segment.target: In browse mode in Microsoft Word, single letter navigation now updates the braille display and the review cursor as expected. (#4968)

segment.source: In braille, extraneous spaces are no longer displayed between or after indicators for controls and formatting. (#5043)
segment.target: In braille, extraneous spaces are no longer displayed between or after indicators for controls and formatting. (#5043)

segment.source: When an application is responding slowly and you switch away from that application, NVDA is now much more responsive in other applications in most cases. (#3831)
segment.target: When an application is responding slowly and you switch away from that application, NVDA is now much more responsive in other applications in most cases. (#3831)

segment.source: Windows 10 Toast notifications are now reported as expected. (#5136)
segment.target: Windows 10 Toast notifications are now reported as expected. (#5136)

segment.source: The value is now reported as it changes in certain (UI Automation) combo boxes where this was not working previously.
segment.target: The value is now reported as it changes in certain (UI Automation) combo boxes where this was not working previously.

segment.source: In browse mode in web browsers, tabbing now behaves as expected after tabbing to a frame document. (#5227)
segment.target: In browse mode in web browsers, tabbing now behaves as expected after tabbing to a frame document. (#5227)

segment.source: The Windows 10 lock screen can now be dismissed using a touch screen. (#5220)
segment.target: The Windows 10 lock screen can now be dismissed using a touch screen. (#5220)

segment.source: In Windows 7 and later, text is no longer garbled when typing in certain applications such as Wordpad and Skype with a braille display. (#4291)
segment.target: In Windows 7 and later, text is no longer garbled when typing in certain applications such as Wordpad and Skype with a braille display. (#4291)

segment.source: On the Windows 10 lock screen, it is no longer possible to read the clipboard, access running applications with the review cursor, change NVDA configuration, etc. (#5269)
segment.target: On the Windows 10 lock screen, it is no longer possible to read the clipboard, access running applications with the review cursor, change NVDA configuration, etc. (#5269)

segment.source: Changes for Developers
segment.target: Promene za programere (engleski)

segment.source: You can now inject raw input from a system keyboard that is not handled natively by Windows (e.g. a QWERTY keyboard on a braille display) using the new keyboardHandler.injectRawKeyboardInput function. (#4576)
segment.target: You can now inject raw input from a system keyboard that is not handled natively by Windows (e.g. a QWERTY keyboard on a braille display) using the new keyboardHandler.injectRawKeyboardInput function. (#4576)

segment.source: eventHandler.requestEvents has been added to request particular events that are blocked by default; e.g. show events from a specific control or certain events even when in the background. (#3831)
segment.target: eventHandler.requestEvents has been added to request particular events that are blocked by default; e.g. show events from a specific control or certain events even when in the background. (#3831)

segment.source: Rather than a single i18nName attribute, synthDriverHandler.SynthSetting now has separate displayNameWithAccelerator and displayName attributes to avoid reporting of the accelerator in the synth settings ring in some languages.
segment.target: Rather than a single i18nName attribute, synthDriverHandler.SynthSetting now has separate displayNameWithAccelerator and displayName attributes to avoid reporting of the accelerator in the synth settings ring in some languages.

segment.source: For backwards compatibility, in the constructor, displayName is optional and will be derived from displayNameWithAccelerator if not provided. However, if you intend to have an accelerator for a setting, both should be provided.
segment.target: For backwards compatibility, in the constructor, displayName is optional and will be derived from displayNameWithAccelerator if not provided. However, if you intend to have an accelerator for a setting, both should be provided.

segment.source: The i18nName attribute is deprecated and may be removed in a future release.
segment.target: The i18nName attribute is deprecated and may be removed in a future release.

segment.source: Highlights of this release include the ability to read charts in Microsoft Excel and support for reading and interactive navigation of mathematical content.
segment.target: Highlights of this release include the ability to read charts in Microsoft Excel and support for reading and interactive navigation of mathematical content.

segment.source: New Features
segment.target: New Features

segment.source: Moving forward and backward by sentence in Microsoft Word and Outlook is now possible with alt+downArrow and alt+upArrow respectively. (#3288)
segment.target: Moving forward and backward by sentence in Microsoft Word and Outlook is now possible with alt+downArrow and alt+upArrow respectively. (#3288)

segment.source: New braille translation tables for several Indian languages. (#4778)
segment.target: New braille translation tables for several Indian languages. (#4778)

segment.source: In Microsoft Excel, NVDA now reports when a cell has overflowing or cropped content. (#3040)
segment.target: In Microsoft Excel, NVDA now reports when a cell has overflowing or cropped content. (#3040)

segment.source: In Microsoft Excel, you can now use the Elements List (NVDA+f7) to allow listing of charts, comments and formulas. (#1987)
segment.target: In Microsoft Excel, you can now use the Elements List (NVDA+f7) to allow listing of charts, comments and formulas. (#1987)

segment.source: Support for reading charts in Microsoft Excel. To use this, select the chart using the Elements List (NVDA+f7) and then use the arrow keys to move between the data points. (#1987)
segment.target: Support for reading charts in Microsoft Excel. To use this, select the chart using the Elements List (NVDA+f7) and then use the arrow keys to move between the data points. (#1987)

segment.source: Using MathPlayer 4 from Design Science, NVDA can now read and interactively navigate mathematical content in web browsers and in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint. See the "Reading Mathematical Content" section in the User Guide for details. (#4673)
segment.target: Using MathPlayer 4 from Design Science, NVDA can now read and interactively navigate mathematical content in web browsers and in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint. See the "Reading Mathematical Content" section in the User Guide for details. (#4673)

segment.source: It is now possible to assign input gestures (keyboard commands, touch gestures, etc.) for all NVDA preferences dialogs and document formatting options using the Input Gestures dialog. (#4898)
segment.target: It is now possible to assign input gestures (keyboard commands, touch gestures, etc.) for all NVDA preferences dialogs and document formatting options using the Input Gestures dialog. (#4898)

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: In NVDA's Document Formatting dialog, the keyboard shortcuts for Report lists, Report links, Report line numbers and Report font name have been changed. (#4650)
segment.target: In NVDA's Document Formatting dialog, the keyboard shortcuts for Report lists, Report links, Report line numbers and Report font name have been changed. (#4650)

segment.source: In NVDA's Mouse Settings dialog, keyboard shortcuts have been added for play audio coordinates when mouse moves and brightness controls audio coordinates volume. (#4916)
segment.target: In NVDA's Mouse Settings dialog, keyboard shortcuts have been added for play audio coordinates when mouse moves and brightness controls audio coordinates volume. (#4916)

segment.source: Significantly improved reporting of color names. (#4984)
segment.target: Significantly improved reporting of color names. (#4984)

segment.source: Updated liblouis braille translator to 2.6.2. (#4777)
segment.target: Updated liblouis braille translator to 2.6.2. (#4777)

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: Character descriptions are now handled correctly for conjunct characters in certain Indian languages. (#4582)
segment.target: Character descriptions are now handled correctly for conjunct characters in certain Indian languages. (#4582)

segment.source: If the "Trust voice's language when processing characters and symbols" option is enabled, the Punctuation/Symbol pronunciation dialog now correctly uses the voice language. Also, the language for which pronunciation is being edited is shown in the dialog's title. (#4930)
segment.target: If the "Trust voice's language when processing characters and symbols" option is enabled, the Punctuation/Symbol pronunciation dialog now correctly uses the voice language. Also, the language for which pronunciation is being edited is shown in the dialog's title. (#4930)

segment.source: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, typed characters are no longer inappropriately announced in editable combo boxes such as the Google search field on the Google home page. (#4976)
segment.target: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, typed characters are no longer inappropriately announced in editable combo boxes such as the Google search field on the Google home page. (#4976)

segment.source: When selecting colors in Microsoft Office applications, color names are now reported. (#3045)
segment.target: When selecting colors in Microsoft Office applications, color names are now reported. (#3045)

segment.source: Danish braille output now works again. (#4986)
segment.target: Danish braille output now works again. (#4986)

segment.source: PageUp/pageDown can again be used to change slides within a PowerPoint slide show. (#4850)
segment.target: PageUp/pageDown can again be used to change slides within a PowerPoint slide show. (#4850)

segment.source: In Skype for Desktop 7.2 and later, typing notifications are now reported and problems immediately after moving focus out of a conversation have been fixed. (#4972)
segment.target: In Skype for Desktop 7.2 and later, typing notifications are now reported and problems immediately after moving focus out of a conversation have been fixed. (#4972)

segment.source: Fixed problems when typing certain punctuation/symbols such as brackets into the filter field in the Input Gestures dialog. (#5060)
segment.target: Fixed problems when typing certain punctuation/symbols such as brackets into the filter field in the Input Gestures dialog. (#5060)

segment.source: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, pressing g or shift+g to navigate to graphics now includes elements marked as images for accessibility purposes (i.e. ARIA role img). (#5062)
segment.target: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, pressing g or shift+g to navigate to graphics now includes elements marked as images for accessibility purposes (i.e. ARIA role img). (#5062)

segment.source: Changes for Developers
segment.target: Promene za programere (engleski)

segment.source: brailleInput.handler.sendChars(mychar) will no longer filter out a character if it is equal to the previous character by ensuring that the key sent is correctly released. (#4139)
segment.target: brailleInput.handler.sendChars(mychar) will no longer filter out a character if it is equal to the previous character by ensuring that the key sent is correctly released. (#4139)

segment.source: Scripts for changing touch modes will now honor new labeles added to touchHandler.touchModeLabels. (#4699)
segment.target: Scripts for changing touch modes will now honor new labeles added to touchHandler.touchModeLabels. (#4699)

segment.source: Add-ons can provide their own math presentation implementations. See the mathPres package for details. (#4509)
segment.target: Add-ons can provide their own math presentation implementations. See the mathPres package for details. (#4509)

segment.source: Speech commands have been implemented to insert a break between words and to change the pitch, volume and rate. See BreakCommand, PitchCommand, VolumeCommand and RateCommand in the speech module. (#4674)
