segment.target: Speech commands have been implemented to insert a break between words and to change the pitch, volume and rate. See BreakCommand, PitchCommand, VolumeCommand and RateCommand in the speech module. (#4674)

segment.source: There is also speech.PhonemeCommand to insert specific pronunciation, but the current implementations only support a very limited number of phonemes.
segment.target: There is also speech.PhonemeCommand to insert specific pronunciation, but the current implementations only support a very limited number of phonemes.

segment.source: Highlights of this release include browse mode for documents in Microsoft Word and Outlook; major enhancements to support for Skype for Desktop; and significant fixes for Microsoft Internet Explorer.
segment.target: Highlights of this release include browse mode for documents in Microsoft Word and Outlook; major enhancements to support for Skype for Desktop; and significant fixes for Microsoft Internet Explorer.

segment.source: New Features
segment.target: New Features

segment.source: You can now add new symbols in the Symbol Pronunciation dialog. (#4354)
segment.target: You can now add new symbols in the Symbol Pronunciation dialog. (#4354)

segment.source: In the Input Gestures dialog, you can use the new "Filter by" field to show only gestures containing specific words. (#4458)
segment.target: In the Input Gestures dialog, you can use the new "Filter by" field to show only gestures containing specific words. (#4458)

segment.source: NVDA now automatically reports new text in mintty. (#4588)
segment.target: NVDA now automatically reports new text in mintty. (#4588)

segment.source: In the browse mode Find dialog, there is now an option to perform a case sensitive search. (#4584)
segment.target: In the browse mode Find dialog, there is now an option to perform a case sensitive search. (#4584)

segment.source: Quick navigation (pressing h to move by heading, etc.) and Elements List (NVDA+f7) are now available in Microsoft Word documents by turning on browse mode with NVDA+space. (#2975)
segment.target: Quick navigation (pressing h to move by heading, etc.) and Elements List (NVDA+f7) are now available in Microsoft Word documents by turning on browse mode with NVDA+space. (#2975)

segment.source: Reading HTML messages in Microsoft Outlook 2007 and later has been majorly improved as Browse mode is automatically enabled for these messages. If browse mode is not enabled in some rare situations, you can force it on with NVDA+space. (#2975)
segment.target: Reading HTML messages in Microsoft Outlook 2007 and later has been majorly improved as Browse mode is automatically enabled for these messages. If browse mode is not enabled in some rare situations, you can force it on with NVDA+space. (#2975)

segment.source: Table column headers in Microsoft word are automatically reported for tables where a header row has been explicitly specified by the author via Microsoft word's table properties. (#4510)
segment.target: Table column headers in Microsoft word are automatically reported for tables where a header row has been explicitly specified by the author via Microsoft word's table properties. (#4510)

segment.source: However, For tables where rows have been merged, this will not work automatically. In this situation, you can still set column headers manually in NVDA with NVDA+shift+c.
segment.target: However, For tables where rows have been merged, this will not work automatically. In this situation, you can still set column headers manually in NVDA with NVDA+shift+c.

segment.source: In Skype for Desktop, notifications are now reported. (#4741)
segment.target: In Skype for Desktop, notifications are now reported. (#4741)

segment.source: In Skype for Desktop, you can now report and review recent messages using NVDA+control+1 through NVDA+control+0; e.g. NVDA+control+1 for the most recent message and NVDA+control+0 for the tenth most recent. (#3210)
segment.target: In Skype for Desktop, you can now report and review recent messages using NVDA+control+1 through NVDA+control+0; e.g. NVDA+control+1 for the most recent message and NVDA+control+0 for the tenth most recent. (#3210)

segment.source: In a conversation in Skype for Desktop, NVDA now reports when a contact is typing. (#3506)
segment.target: In a conversation in Skype for Desktop, NVDA now reports when a contact is typing. (#3506)

segment.source: NVDA can now be installed silently via the command line without starting the installed copy after installation. To do this, use the --install-silent option. (#4206)
segment.target: NVDA can now be installed silently via the command line without starting the installed copy after installation. To do this, use the --install-silent option. (#4206)

segment.source: Support for the Papenmeier BRAILLEX Live 20, BRAILLEX Live and BRAILLEX Live Plus braille displays. (#4614)
segment.target: Support for the Papenmeier BRAILLEX Live 20, BRAILLEX Live and BRAILLEX Live Plus braille displays. (#4614)

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: In NVDA's Document Formatting settings dialog, the option to report spelling errors now has a shortcut key (alt+r). (#793)
segment.target: In NVDA's Document Formatting settings dialog, the option to report spelling errors now has a shortcut key (alt+r). (#793)

segment.source: NVDA will now use the synthesizer/voice's language for character and symbol processing (including punctuation/symbol names), regardless of whether automatic language switching is turned on. To turn off this feature so that NVDA again uses its interface language, uncheck the new option in Voice settings called Trust Voice's language when processing characters and symbols. (#4210)
segment.target: NVDA will now use the synthesizer/voice's language for character and symbol processing (including punctuation/symbol names), regardless of whether automatic language switching is turned on. To turn off this feature so that NVDA again uses its interface language, uncheck the new option in Voice settings called Trust Voice's language when processing characters and symbols. (#4210)

segment.source: Support for the Newfon synthesizer has been removed. Newfon is now available as an NVDA add-on. (#3184)
segment.target: Support for the Newfon synthesizer has been removed. Newfon is now available as an NVDA add-on. (#3184)

segment.source: Skype for Desktop 7 or later is now required for use with NVDA; earlier versions are not supported. (#4218)
segment.target: Skype for Desktop 7 or later is now required for use with NVDA; earlier versions are not supported. (#4218)

segment.source: Downloading of NVDA updates is now more secure. (Specifically, the update information is retrieved via https and the hash of the file is verified after it is downloaded.) (#4716)
segment.target: Downloading of NVDA updates is now more secure. (Specifically, the update information is retrieved via https and the hash of the file is verified after it is downloaded.) (#4716)

segment.source: eSpeak has been upgraded to version 1.48.04 (#4325)
segment.target: eSpeak has been upgraded to version 1.48.04 (#4325)

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: In Microsoft Excel, merged row and column header cells are now handled correctly. For example, if A1 and B1 are merged, then B2 will now have A1 and B1 reported as its column header rather than nothing at all. (#4617)
segment.target: In Microsoft Excel, merged row and column header cells are now handled correctly. For example, if A1 and B1 are merged, then B2 will now have A1 and B1 reported as its column header rather than nothing at all. (#4617)

segment.source: When editing the content of a text box in Microsoft PowerPoint 2003, NVDA will correctly report the content of each line. Previously, in each paragraph, lines would increasingly be off by one character. (#4619)
segment.target: When editing the content of a text box in Microsoft PowerPoint 2003, NVDA will correctly report the content of each line. Previously, in each paragraph, lines would increasingly be off by one character. (#4619)

segment.source: All of NVDA's dialogs are now centred on the screen, improving visual presentation and usability. (#3148)
segment.target: All of NVDA's dialogs are now centred on the screen, improving visual presentation and usability. (#3148)

segment.source: In Skype for desktop, when entering an introductory message to add a contact, entering and moving through the text now works correctly. (#3661)
segment.target: In Skype for desktop, when entering an introductory message to add a contact, entering and moving through the text now works correctly. (#3661)

segment.source: When focus moves to a new item in tree views in the Eclipse IDE, if the previously focused item is a check box, it is no longer incorrectly announced. (#4586)
segment.target: When focus moves to a new item in tree views in the Eclipse IDE, if the previously focused item is a check box, it is no longer incorrectly announced. (#4586)

segment.source: In the Microsoft Word spell check dialog, the next error will be automatically reported when the last one has been changed or ignored using respective shortcut keys. (#1938)
segment.target: In the Microsoft Word spell check dialog, the next error will be automatically reported when the last one has been changed or ignored using respective shortcut keys. (#1938)

segment.source: Text can again be read correctly in places such as Tera Term Pro's terminal window and documents in Balabolka. (#4229)
segment.target: Text can again be read correctly in places such as Tera Term Pro's terminal window and documents in Balabolka. (#4229)

segment.source: Focus now correctly returns to the document being edited When finishing input composition of text in Korean and other east Asian languages while editing within a frame in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML documents. (#4045)
segment.target: Focus now correctly returns to the document being edited When finishing input composition of text in Korean and other east Asian languages while editing within a frame in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML documents. (#4045)

segment.source: In the Input Gestures dialog, when selecting a keyboard layout for a keyboard gesture being added, pressing escape now closes the menu as expected instead of closing the dialog. (#3617)
segment.target: In the Input Gestures dialog, when selecting a keyboard layout for a keyboard gesture being added, pressing escape now closes the menu as expected instead of closing the dialog. (#3617)

segment.source: When removing an add-on, the add-on directory is now correctly deleted after restarting NVDA. Previously, you had to restart twice. (#3461)
segment.target: When removing an add-on, the add-on directory is now correctly deleted after restarting NVDA. Previously, you had to restart twice. (#3461)

segment.source: Major problems have been fixed when using Skype for Desktop 7. (#4218)
segment.target: Major problems have been fixed when using Skype for Desktop 7. (#4218)

segment.source: When you send a message in Skype for Desktop, it is no longer read twice. (#3616)
segment.target: When you send a message in Skype for Desktop, it is no longer read twice. (#3616)

segment.source: In Skype for Desktop, NVDA should no longer occasionally spuriously read a large flood of messages (perhaps even an entire conversation). (#4644)
segment.target: In Skype for Desktop, NVDA should no longer occasionally spuriously read a large flood of messages (perhaps even an entire conversation). (#4644)

segment.source: fixed a problem where NVDA's Report date/time command did not honor the regional settings specified by the user in some cases. (#2987)
segment.target: fixed a problem where NVDA's Report date/time command did not honor the regional settings specified by the user in some cases. (#2987)

segment.source: In browse mode, nonsensical text (sometimes spanning several lines) is no longer presented for certain graphics such as found on Google Groups. (Specifically, this occurred with base64 encoded images.) (#4793)
segment.target: In browse mode, nonsensical text (sometimes spanning several lines) is no longer presented for certain graphics such as found on Google Groups. (Specifically, this occurred with base64 encoded images.) (#4793)

segment.source: NVDA should no longer freeze after a few seconds when moving focus away from a Windows Store app as it becomes suspended. (#4572)
segment.target: NVDA should no longer freeze after a few seconds when moving focus away from a Windows Store app as it becomes suspended. (#4572)

segment.source: The aria-atomic attribute on live regions in Mozilla Firefox is now honored even when the atomic element itself changes. Previously, it only affected descendant elements. (#4794)
segment.target: The aria-atomic attribute on live regions in Mozilla Firefox is now honored even when the atomic element itself changes. Previously, it only affected descendant elements. (#4794)

segment.source: Browse mode will reflect updates, and live regions will be announced, for browse mode documents within ARIA applications embedded in a document in Internet Explorer or other MSHTML controls. (#4798)
segment.target: Browse mode will reflect updates, and live regions will be announced, for browse mode documents within ARIA applications embedded in a document in Internet Explorer or other MSHTML controls. (#4798)

segment.source: When text is changed or added in live regions in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls where the author has specified that text is relevant, only the changed or added text is announced, rather than all of the text in the containing element. (#4800)
segment.target: When text is changed or added in live regions in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls where the author has specified that text is relevant, only the changed or added text is announced, rather than all of the text in the containing element. (#4800)

segment.source: Content indicated by the aria-labelledby attribute on elements in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls correctly replaces the original content where it is appropriate to do so. (#4575)
segment.target: Content indicated by the aria-labelledby attribute on elements in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls correctly replaces the original content where it is appropriate to do so. (#4575)

segment.source: When checking spelling in Microsoft Outlook 2013, the misspelled word is now announced. (#4848)
segment.target: When checking spelling in Microsoft Outlook 2013, the misspelled word is now announced. (#4848)

segment.source: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, content inside elements hidden with visibility:hidden is no longer inappropriately presented in browse mode. (#4839, #3776)
segment.target: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, content inside elements hidden with visibility:hidden is no longer inappropriately presented in browse mode. (#4839, #3776)

segment.source: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, the title attribute on form controls no longer inappropriately takes preference over other label associations. (#4491)
segment.target: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, the title attribute on form controls no longer inappropriately takes preference over other label associations. (#4491)

segment.source: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, NVDA no longer ignores focusing of elements due to the aria-activedescendant attribute. (#4667)
segment.target: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, NVDA no longer ignores focusing of elements due to the aria-activedescendant attribute. (#4667)

segment.source: Changes for Developers
segment.target: Promene za programere (engleski)

segment.source: Updated wxPython to 3.0.2.0. (#3763)
segment.target: Updated wxPython to 3.0.2.0. (#3763)

segment.source: Updated Python to 2.7.9. (#4715)
segment.target: Updated Python to 2.7.9. (#4715)

segment.source: NVDA no longer crashes when restarting after removing or updating an add-on which imports speechDictHandler in its installTasks module. (#4496)
segment.target: NVDA no longer crashes when restarting after removing or updating an add-on which imports speechDictHandler in its installTasks module. (#4496)

segment.source: New Features
segment.target: New Features

segment.source: New languages: Colombian Spanish, Punjabi.
segment.target: New languages: Colombian Spanish, Punjabi.

segment.source: It is now possible to restart NVDA or restart NVDA with add-ons disabled from NVDA's exit dialog. (#4057)
segment.target: It is now possible to restart NVDA or restart NVDA with add-ons disabled from NVDA's exit dialog. (#4057)

segment.source: NVDA can also be started with add-ons disabled by using the --disable-addons command line option.
segment.target: NVDA can also be started with add-ons disabled by using the --disable-addons command line option.

segment.source: In speech dictionaries, it is now possible to specify that a pattern should only match if it is a whole word; i.e. it does not occur as part of a larger word. (#1704)
segment.target: In speech dictionaries, it is now possible to specify that a pattern should only match if it is a whole word; i.e. it does not occur as part of a larger word. (#1704)

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: If an object you have moved to with object navigation is inside a browse mode document, but the object you were on previously was not, the review mode is automatically set to document. Previously, this only happened if the navigator object was moved due to the focus changing. (#4369)
segment.target: If an object you have moved to with object navigation is inside a browse mode document, but the object you were on previously was not, the review mode is automatically set to document. Previously, this only happened if the navigator object was moved due to the focus changing. (#4369)

segment.source: The Braille display and Synthesizer lists in the respective settings dialogs are now alphabetically sorted except for No braille/No speech, which are now at the bottom. (#2724)
segment.target: The Braille display and Synthesizer lists in the respective settings dialogs are now alphabetically sorted except for No braille/No speech, which are now at the bottom. (#2724)

segment.source: Updated liblouis braille translator to 2.6.0. (#4434, #3835)
segment.target: Updated liblouis braille translator to 2.6.0. (#4434, #3835)

segment.source: In browse mode, pressing e and shift+e to navigate to edit fields now includes editable combo boxes. This includes the search box in the latest version of Google Search. (#4436)
segment.target: In browse mode, pressing e and shift+e to navigate to edit fields now includes editable combo boxes. This includes the search box in the latest version of Google Search. (#4436)

segment.source: Clicking the NVDA icon in the Notification Area with the left mouse button now opens the NVDA menu instead of doing nothing. (#4459)
segment.target: Clicking the NVDA icon in the Notification Area with the left mouse button now opens the NVDA menu instead of doing nothing. (#4459)

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: When moving focus back to a browse mode document (e.g. alt+tabbing to an already opened web page), the review cursor is properly positioned at the virtual caret, rather than the focused control (e.g. a nearby link). (#4369)
segment.target: When moving focus back to a browse mode document (e.g. alt+tabbing to an already opened web page), the review cursor is properly positioned at the virtual caret, rather than the focused control (e.g. a nearby link). (#4369)

segment.source: In PowerPoint slide shows, the review cursor correctly follows the virtual caret. (#4370)
segment.target: In PowerPoint slide shows, the review cursor correctly follows the virtual caret. (#4370)

segment.source: In Mozilla Firefox and other Gecko-based browsers, new content within a live region will be announced even if the new content has a usable ARIA live type different to the parent live region; e.g. when content marked as assertive is added to a live region marked as polite. (#4169)
segment.target: In Mozilla Firefox and other Gecko-based browsers, new content within a live region will be announced even if the new content has a usable ARIA live type different to the parent live region; e.g. when content marked as assertive is added to a live region marked as polite. (#4169)

segment.source: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, some cases where a document is contained within another document no longer prevent the user from accessing some of the content (specifically, framesets inside framesets). (#4418)
segment.target: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, some cases where a document is contained within another document no longer prevent the user from accessing some of the content (specifically, framesets inside framesets). (#4418)

segment.source: NVDA no longer crashes when attempting to use a Handy Tech braille display in some cases. (#3709)
segment.target: NVDA no longer crashes when attempting to use a Handy Tech braille display in some cases. (#3709)

segment.source: In Windows Vista, a spurious "Entry Point Not Found" dialog is no longer displayed in several cases such as when starting NVDA from the Desktop shortcut or via the shortcut key. (#4235)
segment.target: In Windows Vista, a spurious "Entry Point Not Found" dialog is no longer displayed in several cases such as when starting NVDA from the Desktop shortcut or via the shortcut key. (#4235)

segment.source: Serious problems with editable text controls in dialogs in recent versions of Eclipse have been fixed. (#3872)
segment.target: Serious problems with editable text controls in dialogs in recent versions of Eclipse have been fixed. (#3872)

segment.source: In Outlook 2010, moving the caret now works as expected in the location field of appointments and meeting requests. (#4126)
segment.target: In Outlook 2010, moving the caret now works as expected in the location field of appointments and meeting requests. (#4126)

segment.source: Inside a live region, content which is marked as not being live (e.g. aria-live="off") is now correctly ignored. (#4405)
segment.target: Inside a live region, content which is marked as not being live (e.g. aria-live="off") is now correctly ignored. (#4405)

segment.source: When reporting the text of a status bar that has a name, the name is now correctly separated from the first word of the status bar text. (#4430)
segment.target: When reporting the text of a status bar that has a name, the name is now correctly separated from the first word of the status bar text. (#4430)

segment.source: In password entry fields with speaking of typed words enabled, multiple asterisks are no longer pointlessly reported when beginning new words. (#4402)
segment.target: In password entry fields with speaking of typed words enabled, multiple asterisks are no longer pointlessly reported when beginning new words. (#4402)

segment.source: In the Microsoft Outlook message list, items are no longer pointlessly announced as Data Items. (#4439)
segment.target: In the Microsoft Outlook message list, items are no longer pointlessly announced as Data Items. (#4439)

segment.source: When selecting text in the code editing control in the Eclipse IDE, the entire selection is no longer announced every time the selection changes. (#2314)
segment.target: When selecting text in the code editing control in the Eclipse IDE, the entire selection is no longer announced every time the selection changes. (#2314)

segment.source: Various versions of Eclipse, such as Spring Tool Suite and the version included in the Android Developer Tools bundle, are now recognised as Eclipse and handled appropriately. (#4360, #4454)
segment.target: Various versions of Eclipse, such as Spring Tool Suite and the version included in the Android Developer Tools bundle, are now recognised as Eclipse and handled appropriately. (#4360, #4454)

segment.source: Mouse tracking and touch exploration in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls (including many Windows 8 applications) is now much more accurate on high DPI displays or when document zoom is changed. (#3494)
segment.target: Mouse tracking and touch exploration in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls (including many Windows 8 applications) is now much more accurate on high DPI displays or when document zoom is changed. (#3494)

segment.source: Mouse tracking and touch exploration in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls will now announce the label of more buttons. (#4173)
segment.target: Mouse tracking and touch exploration in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls will now announce the label of more buttons. (#4173)

segment.source: When using a Papenmeier BRAILLEX braille display with BrxCom, keys on the display now work as expected. (#4614)
segment.target: When using a Papenmeier BRAILLEX braille display with BrxCom, keys on the display now work as expected. (#4614)

segment.source: Changes for Developers
segment.target: Promene za programere (engleski)

segment.source: For executables which host many different apps (e.g. javaw.exe), code can now be provided to load specific app modules for each app instead of loading the same app module for all hosted apps. (#4360)
segment.target: For executables which host many different apps (e.g. javaw.exe), code can now be provided to load specific app modules for each app instead of loading the same app module for all hosted apps. (#4360)

segment.source: See the code documentation for appModuleHandler.AppModule for details.
segment.target: See the code documentation for appModuleHandler.AppModule for details.

segment.source: Support for javaw.exe is implemented.
segment.target: Support for javaw.exe is implemented.

segment.source: New Features
segment.target: New Features

segment.source: The sounds played when NVDA starts and exits can be disabled via a new option in the General Settings dialog. (#834)
segment.target: The sounds played when NVDA starts and exits can be disabled via a new option in the General Settings dialog. (#834)

segment.source: Help for add-ons can be accessed from the Add-ons Manager for add-ons which support this. (#2694)
segment.target: Help for add-ons can be accessed from the Add-ons Manager for add-ons which support this. (#2694)

segment.source: Support for the Calendar in Microsoft Outlook 2007 and above (#2943) including:
segment.target: Support for the Calendar in Microsoft Outlook 2007 and above (#2943) including:

segment.source: Announcement of the current time when moving around with the arrow keys.
segment.target: Announcement of the current time when moving around with the arrow keys.

segment.source: Indication if the selected time is within any appointments.
segment.target: Indication if the selected time is within any appointments.

segment.source: announcement of the selected appointment when pressing tab.
segment.target: announcement of the selected appointment when pressing tab.

segment.source: Smart filtering of the date so as to only announce the date if the new selected time or appointment is on a different day to the last.
segment.target: Smart filtering of the date so as to only announce the date if the new selected time or appointment is on a different day to the last.

segment.source: Enhanced support for the Inbox and other message lists in Microsoft Outlook 2010 and above (#3834) including:
segment.target: Enhanced support for the Inbox and other message lists in Microsoft Outlook 2010 and above (#3834) including:

segment.source: The ability to silence column headers (from, subject, etc.) by turning off the Report Table row and column headers option in Document Formatting settings.
segment.target: The ability to silence column headers (from, subject, etc.) by turning off the Report Table row and column headers option in Document Formatting settings.

segment.source: The ability to use table navigation commands (control + alt + arrows) to move through the individual columns.
segment.target: The ability to use table navigation commands (control + alt + arrows) to move through the individual columns.

segment.source: Microsoft word: If an inline image has no alternative text set, NVDA will instead report the title of the image if the author has provided one. (#4193)
segment.target: Microsoft word: If an inline image has no alternative text set, NVDA will instead report the title of the image if the author has provided one. (#4193)

segment.source: Microsoft Word: NVDA can now report paragraph indenting with the report formatting command (NVDA+f). It can also be reported automatically when the new Report Paragraph indenting option is enabled in Document Formatting settings. (#4165)
segment.target: Microsoft Word: NVDA can now report paragraph indenting with the report formatting command (NVDA+f). It can also be reported automatically when the new Report Paragraph indenting option is enabled in Document Formatting settings. (#4165)

segment.source: Report automatically inserted text such as a new bullet, number or tab indent when pressing enter in editable documents and text fields. (#4185)
segment.target: Report automatically inserted text such as a new bullet, number or tab indent when pressing enter in editable documents and text fields. (#4185)

segment.source: Microsoft word: Pressing NVDA+alt+c will report the text of a comment if the cursor is within one. (#3528)
segment.target: Microsoft word: Pressing NVDA+alt+c will report the text of a comment if the cursor is within one. (#3528)

segment.source: Improved support for automatic column and row header reading in Microsoft Excel (#3568) including:
segment.target: Improved support for automatic column and row header reading in Microsoft Excel (#3568) including:

segment.source: Support of Excel defined name ranges to identify header cells (compatible with Jaws screen reader) .
segment.target: Support of Excel defined name ranges to identify header cells (compatible with Jaws screen reader) .

segment.source: The set column header (NVDA+shift+c) and set row header (NVDA+shift+r) commands now store the settings in the worksheet so that they are available the next time the sheet is opened, and will be available to other screen readers that support the defined name range scheme.
segment.target: The set column header (NVDA+shift+c) and set row header (NVDA+shift+r) commands now store the settings in the worksheet so that they are available the next time the sheet is opened, and will be available to other screen readers that support the defined name range scheme.

segment.source: These commands can also now be used multiple times per sheet to set different headers for different regions.
segment.target: These commands can also now be used multiple times per sheet to set different headers for different regions.

segment.source: Support for automatic column and row header reading in Microsoft Word (#3110) including:
segment.target: Support for automatic column and row header reading in Microsoft Word (#3110) including:

segment.source: Support of Microsoft Word bookmarks to identify header cells (compatible with Jaws screen reader).
segment.target: Support of Microsoft Word bookmarks to identify header cells (compatible with Jaws screen reader).

segment.source: - set column header (NVDA+shift+c) and set row header (NVDA+shift+r) commands while on the first header cell in a table allow you to tell NVDA that these headers should be reported automatically. Settings are stored in the document so that they are available the next time the document is opened, and will be available to other screen readers that support the bookmark scheme.
segment.target: - set column header (NVDA+shift+c) and set row header (NVDA+shift+r) commands while on the first header cell in a table allow you to tell NVDA that these headers should be reported automatically. Settings are stored in the document so that they are available the next time the document is opened, and will be available to other screen readers that support the bookmark scheme.

segment.source: Microsoft Word: Report the distance from the left edge of the page when the tab key is pressed. (#1353)
segment.target: Microsoft Word: Report the distance from the left edge of the page when the tab key is pressed. (#1353)

segment.source: Microsoft Word: provide feedback in speech and braille for most available formatting shortcut keys (bold, italic, underline, alignment, outline level, superscript, subscript and font size). (#1353)
segment.target: Microsoft Word: provide feedback in speech and braille for most available formatting shortcut keys (bold, italic, underline, alignment, outline level, superscript, subscript and font size). (#1353)

segment.source: Microsoft Excel: If the selected cell contains comments, they can be now reported by pressing NVDA+alt+c. (#2920)
segment.target: Microsoft Excel: If the selected cell contains comments, they can be now reported by pressing NVDA+alt+c. (#2920)

segment.source: Microsoft Excel: Provide an NVDA-specific dialog to edit the comments on the currently selected cell when pressing Excel's shift+f2 command to enter comment editing mode. (#2920)
segment.target: Microsoft Excel: Provide an NVDA-specific dialog to edit the comments on the currently selected cell when pressing Excel's shift+f2 command to enter comment editing mode. (#2920)

segment.source: Microsoft Excel: speech and braille feedback for many more selection movement shortcuts (#4211) including:
segment.target: Microsoft Excel: speech and braille feedback for many more selection movement shortcuts (#4211) including:

segment.source: Vertical page movement (pageUp and pageDown);
segment.target: Vertical page movement (pageUp and pageDown);

segment.source: Horizontal page movement (alt+pageUp and alt+pageDown);
segment.target: Horizontal page movement (alt+pageUp and alt+pageDown);

segment.source: Extend selection (the above keys with Shift added); and
segment.target: Extend selection (the above keys with Shift added); and

segment.source: Selecting the current region (control+shift+8).
segment.target: Selecting the current region (control+shift+8).

segment.source: Microsoft Excel: The vertical and horizontal alignment for cells can now be reported with the report formatting command (NVDA+f). It can also be reported automatically if the Report alignment option in Document Formatting settings is enabled. (#4212)
segment.target: Microsoft Excel: The vertical and horizontal alignment for cells can now be reported with the report formatting command (NVDA+f). It can also be reported automatically if the Report alignment option in Document Formatting settings is enabled. (#4212)

segment.source: Microsoft Excel: The style of a cell can now be reported with the report formatting command (NVDA+f). It can also be reported automatically if the Report Style option in Document formatting settings is enabled. (#4213)
segment.target: Microsoft Excel: The style of a cell can now be reported with the report formatting command (NVDA+f). It can also be reported automatically if the Report Style option in Document formatting settings is enabled. (#4213)

segment.source: Microsoft PowerPoint: when moving shapes around a slide with the arrow keys, the shape's current location is now reported (#4214) including:
segment.target: Microsoft PowerPoint: when moving shapes around a slide with the arrow keys, the shape's current location is now reported (#4214) including:

segment.source: The distance between the shape and each of the slide edges is reported.
segment.target: The distance between the shape and each of the slide edges is reported.

segment.source: If the shape covers or is covered by another shape, then the distance overlapped and the overlapped shape are reported.
segment.target: If the shape covers or is covered by another shape, then the distance overlapped and the overlapped shape are reported.

segment.source: To report this information at any time without moving a shape, press the report location command (NVDA+delete).
segment.target: To report this information at any time without moving a shape, press the report location command (NVDA+delete).

segment.source: When selecting a shape, if it is covered by another shape, NVDA will report that it is obscured.
segment.target: When selecting a shape, if it is covered by another shape, NVDA will report that it is obscured.

segment.source: The report location command (NVDA+delete) is more context specific in some situations. (#4219)
segment.target: The report location command (NVDA+delete) is more context specific in some situations. (#4219)

segment.source: In standard edit fields and browse mode, the cursor position as a percentage through the content and its screen coordinates are reported.
segment.target: In standard edit fields and browse mode, the cursor position as a percentage through the content and its screen coordinates are reported.

segment.source: On shapes in PowerPoint Presentations, position of the shape relative to the slide and other shapes is reported.
segment.target: On shapes in PowerPoint Presentations, position of the shape relative to the slide and other shapes is reported.

segment.source: Pressing this command twice will produce the previous behaviour of reporting the location information for the entire control.
segment.target: Pressing this command twice will produce the previous behaviour of reporting the location information for the entire control.

segment.source: New language: Catalan.
segment.target: New language: Catalan.

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: Updated liblouis braille translator to 2.5.4. (#4103)
segment.target: Updated liblouis braille translator to 2.5.4. (#4103)

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: In Google Chrome and Chrome-based browsers, certain chunks of text (such as those with emphasis) are no longer repeated when reporting the text of an alert or dialog. (#4066)
segment.target: In Google Chrome and Chrome-based browsers, certain chunks of text (such as those with emphasis) are no longer repeated when reporting the text of an alert or dialog. (#4066)

segment.source: In browse mode in Mozilla applications, pressing enter on a button, etc. no longer fails to activate it (or activates the wrong control) in certain cases such as the buttons at the top of Facebook. (#4106)
segment.target: In browse mode in Mozilla applications, pressing enter on a button, etc. no longer fails to activate it (or activates the wrong control) in certain cases such as the buttons at the top of Facebook. (#4106)

segment.source: Useless information is no longer announced when tabbing in iTunes. (#4128)
segment.target: Useless information is no longer announced when tabbing in iTunes. (#4128)

segment.source: In certain lists in iTunes such as the Music list, moving to the next item using object navigation now works correctly. (#4129)
segment.target: In certain lists in iTunes such as the Music list, moving to the next item using object navigation now works correctly. (#4129)

segment.source: HTML elements considered headings because of WAI ARIA markup are now included in the Browse mode Elements list and quick navigation for Internet Explorer documents. (#4140)
segment.target: HTML elements considered headings because of WAI ARIA markup are now included in the Browse mode Elements list and quick navigation for Internet Explorer documents. (#4140)

segment.source: Following same-page links in recent versions of Internet Explorer now correctly moves to and reports the destination position in browse mode documents. (#4134)
segment.target: Following same-page links in recent versions of Internet Explorer now correctly moves to and reports the destination position in browse mode documents. (#4134)

segment.source: Microsoft Outlook 2010 and above: Overall access to secure dialogs such as the New profiles and mail setup dialogs has been improved. (#4090, #4091, #4095)
segment.target: Microsoft Outlook 2010 and above: Overall access to secure dialogs such as the New profiles and mail setup dialogs has been improved. (#4090, #4091, #4095)

segment.source: Microsoft Outlook: Useless verbosity has been decreased in command toolbars when navigating through certain dialogs. (#4096, #3407)
segment.target: Microsoft Outlook: Useless verbosity has been decreased in command toolbars when navigating through certain dialogs. (#4096, #3407)

segment.source: Microsoft word: Tabbing to a blank cell in a table no longer incorrectly announces exiting the table. (#4151)
segment.target: Microsoft word: Tabbing to a blank cell in a table no longer incorrectly announces exiting the table. (#4151)

segment.source: Microsoft Word: The first character past the end of a table (including a new blank line) is no longer incorrectly considered to be inside the table. (#4152)
segment.target: Microsoft Word: The first character past the end of a table (including a new blank line) is no longer incorrectly considered to be inside the table. (#4152)

segment.source: Microsoft Word 2010 spell check dialog: The actual misspelled word is reported rather than inappropriately reporting just the first bold word. (#3431)
segment.target: Microsoft Word 2010 spell check dialog: The actual misspelled word is reported rather than inappropriately reporting just the first bold word. (#3431)

segment.source: In browse mode in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, tabbing or using single letter navigation to move to form fields again reports the label in many cases where it didn't (specifically, where HTML label elements are used). (#4170)
segment.target: In browse mode in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, tabbing or using single letter navigation to move to form fields again reports the label in many cases where it didn't (specifically, where HTML label elements are used). (#4170)

segment.source: Microsoft Word: Reporting the existence and placement of comments is more accurate. (#3528)
segment.target: Microsoft Word: Reporting the existence and placement of comments is more accurate. (#3528)

segment.source: Navigation of certain dialogs in MS Office products such as Word, Excel and Outlook has been improved by no longer reporting particular control container toolbars which are not useful to the user. (#4198)
segment.target: Navigation of certain dialogs in MS Office products such as Word, Excel and Outlook has been improved by no longer reporting particular control container toolbars which are not useful to the user. (#4198)

segment.source: Task panes such as clipboard manager or File recovery no longer accidentilly seem to gain focus when opening an application such as Microsoft Word or Excel, which was sometimes causing the user to have to switch away from and back to the application to use the document or spreadsheet. (#4199)
segment.target: Task panes such as clipboard manager or File recovery no longer accidentilly seem to gain focus when opening an application such as Microsoft Word or Excel, which was sometimes causing the user to have to switch away from and back to the application to use the document or spreadsheet. (#4199)

segment.source: NVDA no longer fails to run on recent Windows Operating Systems if the user's Windows language is set to Serbian (Latin). (#4203)
segment.target: NVDA no longer fails to run on recent Windows Operating Systems if the user's Windows language is set to Serbian (Latin). (#4203)

segment.source: Pressing numlock while in input help mode now correctly toggles numlock, rather than causing the keyboard and the Operating System to become out of sync in regards to the state of this key. (#4226)
segment.target: Pressing numlock while in input help mode now correctly toggles numlock, rather than causing the keyboard and the Operating System to become out of sync in regards to the state of this key. (#4226)

segment.source: In Google Chrome, the title of the document is again reported when switching tabs. In NVDA 2014.2, this did not occur in some cases. (#4222)
segment.target: In Google Chrome, the title of the document is again reported when switching tabs. In NVDA 2014.2, this did not occur in some cases. (#4222)

segment.source: In Google Chrome and Chrome-based browsers, the URL of the document is no longer reported when reporting the document. (#4223)
segment.target: In Google Chrome and Chrome-based browsers, the URL of the document is no longer reported when reporting the document. (#4223)

segment.source: When running say all with the No speech synthesizer selected (useful for automated testing), say all will now complete instead of stopping after the first few lines. (#4225)
segment.target: When running say all with the No speech synthesizer selected (useful for automated testing), say all will now complete instead of stopping after the first few lines. (#4225)

segment.source: Microsoft Outlook's Signature dialog: The Signature editing field is now accessible, allowing for full cursor tracking and format detection. (#3833)
segment.target: Microsoft Outlook's Signature dialog: The Signature editing field is now accessible, allowing for full cursor tracking and format detection. (#3833)

segment.source: Microsoft Word: When reading the last line of a table cell, the entire table cell is no longer read. (#3421)
segment.target: Microsoft Word: When reading the last line of a table cell, the entire table cell is no longer read. (#3421)

segment.source: Microsoft Word: When reading the first or last line of a table of contents, the entire table of contents is no longer read. (#3421)
segment.target: Microsoft Word: When reading the first or last line of a table of contents, the entire table of contents is no longer read. (#3421)

segment.source: When speaking typed words and in some other cases, words are no longer incorrectly broken at marks such as vowel signs and virama in Indic languages. (#4254)
segment.target: When speaking typed words and in some other cases, words are no longer incorrectly broken at marks such as vowel signs and virama in Indic languages. (#4254)

segment.source: Numeric editable text fields in GoldWave are now handled correctly. (#670)
segment.target: Numeric editable text fields in GoldWave are now handled correctly. (#670)

segment.source: Microsoft Word: when moving by paragraph with control+downArrow / control+upArrow, it is no longer necessary to press them twice if moving through bulleted or numbered lists. (#3290)
segment.target: Microsoft Word: when moving by paragraph with control+downArrow / control+upArrow, it is no longer necessary to press them twice if moving through bulleted or numbered lists. (#3290)

segment.source: Changes for Developers
segment.target: Promene za programere (engleski)

segment.source: NVDA now has unified support for add-on documentation. See the Add-on Documentation section of the Developer Guide for details. (#2694)
segment.target: NVDA now has unified support for add-on documentation. See the Add-on Documentation section of the Developer Guide for details. (#2694)

segment.source: When providing gesture bindings on a ScriptableObject via __gestures, it is now possible to provide the None keyword as the script. This unbinds the gesture in any base classes. (#4240)
segment.target: When providing gesture bindings on a ScriptableObject via __gestures, it is now possible to provide the None keyword as the script. This unbinds the gesture in any base classes. (#4240)

segment.source: It is now possible to change the shortcut key used to start NVDA for locales where the normal shortcut causes problems. (#2209)
segment.target: It is now possible to change the shortcut key used to start NVDA for locales where the normal shortcut causes problems. (#2209)

segment.source: This is done via gettext.
segment.target: This is done via gettext.

segment.source: Note that the text for the Create desktop shortcut option in the Install NVDA dialog, as well as the shortcut key in the User Guide, must also be updated.
segment.target: Note that the text for the Create desktop shortcut option in the Install NVDA dialog, as well as the shortcut key in the User Guide, must also be updated.

segment.source: New Features
segment.target: New Features

segment.source: Announcement of text selection is now possible in some custom edit fields where display information is used. (#770)
segment.target: Announcement of text selection is now possible in some custom edit fields where display information is used. (#770)

segment.source: In accessible Java applications, position information is now announced for radio buttons and other controls that expose group information. (#3754)
segment.target: In accessible Java applications, position information is now announced for radio buttons and other controls that expose group information. (#3754)

segment.source: In accessible Java applications, keyboard shortcuts are now announced for controls that have them. (#3881)
segment.target: In accessible Java applications, keyboard shortcuts are now announced for controls that have them. (#3881)

segment.source: In browse mode, labels on landmarks are now reported. They are also included in the Elements List dialog. (#1195)
segment.target: In browse mode, labels on landmarks are now reported. They are also included in the Elements List dialog. (#1195)

segment.source: In browse mode, labelled regions are now treated as landmarks. (#3741)
segment.target: In browse mode, labelled regions are now treated as landmarks. (#3741)

segment.source: In Internet Explorer documents and applications, Live Regions (part of the W3c ARIA standard) are now supported, thus allowing web authors to mark particular content to be automatically spoken as it changes. (#1846)
segment.target: In Internet Explorer documents and applications, Live Regions (part of the W3c ARIA standard) are now supported, thus allowing web authors to mark particular content to be automatically spoken as it changes. (#1846)

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: When exiting a dialog or application within a browse mode document, the browse mode document's name and type is no longer announced. (#4069)
segment.target: When exiting a dialog or application within a browse mode document, the browse mode document's name and type is no longer announced. (#4069)

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: The standard Windows System menu is no longer accidentally silenced in Java applications. (#3882)
segment.target: The standard Windows System menu is no longer accidentally silenced in Java applications. (#3882)

segment.source: When copying text from screen review, line breaks are no longer ignored. (#3900)
segment.target: When copying text from screen review, line breaks are no longer ignored. (#3900)

segment.source: Pointless whitespace objects are no longer reported in some applications when the focus changes or when using object navigation with simple review enabled. (#3839)
segment.target: Pointless whitespace objects are no longer reported in some applications when the focus changes or when using object navigation with simple review enabled. (#3839)

segment.source: Message boxes and other dialogs produced by NVDA again cause previous speech to be canceled before announcing the dialog.
segment.target: Message boxes and other dialogs produced by NVDA again cause previous speech to be canceled before announcing the dialog.

segment.source: In browse mode, the labels of controls such as links and buttons are now rendered correctly where the label has been overridden by the author for accessibility purposes (specifically, using aria-label or aria-labelledby). (#1354)
segment.target: In browse mode, the labels of controls such as links and buttons are now rendered correctly where the label has been overridden by the author for accessibility purposes (specifically, using aria-label or aria-labelledby). (#1354)

segment.source: In Browse mode in Internet Explorer, text contained within an element marked as presentational (ARIA role="presentation") is no longer inappropriately ignored. (#4031)
segment.target: In Browse mode in Internet Explorer, text contained within an element marked as presentational (ARIA role="presentation") is no longer inappropriately ignored. (#4031)

segment.source: It is now again possible to type Vietnamese text using the Unikey software. To do this, uncheck the new Handle keys from other applications checkbox in NVDA's Keyboard settings dialog. (#4043)
segment.target: It is now again possible to type Vietnamese text using the Unikey software. To do this, uncheck the new Handle keys from other applications checkbox in NVDA's Keyboard settings dialog. (#4043)

segment.source: In browse mode, radio and check menu items are reported as controls instead of just clickable text. (#4092)
segment.target: In browse mode, radio and check menu items are reported as controls instead of just clickable text. (#4092)

segment.source: NVDA no longer incorrectly switches from focus mode to browse mode when a radio or check menu item is focused. (#4092)
segment.target: NVDA no longer incorrectly switches from focus mode to browse mode when a radio or check menu item is focused. (#4092)

segment.source: In Microsoft PowerPoint with speaking of typed words enabled, characters erased with backspace are no longer announced as part of the typed word. (#3231)
segment.target: In Microsoft PowerPoint with speaking of typed words enabled, characters erased with backspace are no longer announced as part of the typed word. (#3231)

segment.source: In Microsoft Office 2010 Options dialogs, the labels of combo boxes are reported correctly. (#4056)
segment.target: In Microsoft Office 2010 Options dialogs, the labels of combo boxes are reported correctly. (#4056)

segment.source: In browse mode in Mozilla applications, using quick navigation commands to move to the next or previous button or form field now includes toggle buttons as expected. (#4098)
segment.target: In browse mode in Mozilla applications, using quick navigation commands to move to the next or previous button or form field now includes toggle buttons as expected. (#4098)

segment.source: The content of alerts in Mozilla applications is no longer reported twice. (#3481)
segment.target: The content of alerts in Mozilla applications is no longer reported twice. (#3481)

segment.source: In browse mode, containers and landmarks are no longer inappropriately repeated while navigating within them at the same time as page content is changing (e.g. navigating the Facebook and Twitter websites). (#2199)
segment.target: In browse mode, containers and landmarks are no longer inappropriately repeated while navigating within them at the same time as page content is changing (e.g. navigating the Facebook and Twitter websites). (#2199)

segment.source: NVDA recovers in more cases when switching away from applications that stop responding. (#3825)
segment.target: NVDA recovers in more cases when switching away from applications that stop responding. (#3825)

segment.source: The caret (insertion point) again correctly updates when doing a sayAll command while in editable text drawn directly to the screen. (#4125)
segment.target: The caret (insertion point) again correctly updates when doing a sayAll command while in editable text drawn directly to the screen. (#4125)

segment.source: New Features
segment.target: New Features

segment.source: Support for Microsoft PowerPoint 2013. Note that protected view is not supported. (#3578)
segment.target: Support for Microsoft PowerPoint 2013. Note that protected view is not supported. (#3578)

segment.source: In Microsoft word and Excel, NVDA can now read the selected symbol when choosing symbols using the Insert Symbols dialog. (#3538)
segment.target: In Microsoft word and Excel, NVDA can now read the selected symbol when choosing symbols using the Insert Symbols dialog. (#3538)

segment.source: It is now possible to choose if content in documents should be identified as clickable via a new option in the Document Formatting settings dialog. This option is on by default in accordance with the previous behavior. (#3556)
segment.target: It is now possible to choose if content in documents should be identified as clickable via a new option in the Document Formatting settings dialog. This option is on by default in accordance with the previous behavior. (#3556)

segment.source: Support for braille displays connected via Bluetooth on a computer running the Widcomm Bluetooth Software. (#2418)
segment.target: Support for braille displays connected via Bluetooth on a computer running the Widcomm Bluetooth Software. (#2418)

segment.source: When editing text in PowerPoint, hyperlinks are now reported. (#3416)
segment.target: When editing text in PowerPoint, hyperlinks are now reported. (#3416)

segment.source: When in ARIA applications or dialogs on the web, it is now possible to force NVDA to switch to browse mode with NVDA+space allowing document-style navigation of the application or dialog. (#2023)
segment.target: When in ARIA applications or dialogs on the web, it is now possible to force NVDA to switch to browse mode with NVDA+space allowing document-style navigation of the application or dialog. (#2023)

segment.source: In Outlook Express / Windows Mail / Windows Live Mail, NVDA now reports if a message has an attachment or is flagged. (#1594)
segment.target: In Outlook Express / Windows Mail / Windows Live Mail, NVDA now reports if a message has an attachment or is flagged. (#1594)

segment.source: When navigating tables in accessible Java applications, row and column coordinates are now reported, including column and row headers if they exist. (#3756)
segment.target: When navigating tables in accessible Java applications, row and column coordinates are now reported, including column and row headers if they exist. (#3756)

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: For Papenmeier braille displays, the move to flat review/focus command has been removed. Users can assign their own keys using the Input Gestures dialog. (#3652)
segment.target: For Papenmeier braille displays, the move to flat review/focus command has been removed. Users can assign their own keys using the Input Gestures dialog. (#3652)

segment.source: NVDA now relies on the Microsoft VC runtime version 11, which means it can no longer be run on Operating systems older than Windows XP Service Pack 2 or Windows Server 2003 Service Pack 1.
segment.target: NVDA now relies on the Microsoft VC runtime version 11, which means it can no longer be run on Operating systems older than Windows XP Service Pack 2 or Windows Server 2003 Service Pack 1.

segment.source: Punctuation level Some will now speak star (*) and plus (+) characters. (#3614)
segment.target: Punctuation level Some will now speak star (*) and plus (+) characters. (#3614)

segment.source: Upgraded eSpeak to version 1.48.04 which includes many language fixes and fixes several crashes. (#3842, #3739, #3860)
segment.target: Upgraded eSpeak to version 1.48.04 which includes many language fixes and fixes several crashes. (#3842, #3739, #3860)

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: When moving around or selecting cells in Microsoft Excel, NVDA should no longer inappropriately announce the old cell rather than the new cell when Microsoft Excel is slow to move the selection. (#3558)
segment.target: When moving around or selecting cells in Microsoft Excel, NVDA should no longer inappropriately announce the old cell rather than the new cell when Microsoft Excel is slow to move the selection. (#3558)

segment.source: NVDA properly handles opening a dropdown list for a cell in Microsoft Excel via the context menu. (#3586)
segment.target: NVDA properly handles opening a dropdown list for a cell in Microsoft Excel via the context menu. (#3586)

segment.source: New page content in iTunes 11 store pages is now shown properly in browse mode when following a link in the store or when opening the store initially. (#3625)
segment.target: New page content in iTunes 11 store pages is now shown properly in browse mode when following a link in the store or when opening the store initially. (#3625)

segment.source: Buttons for previewing songs in the iTunes 11 store now show their label in browse mode. (#3638)
segment.target: Buttons for previewing songs in the iTunes 11 store now show their label in browse mode. (#3638)

segment.source: In browse mode in Google Chrome, the labels of check boxes and radio buttons are now rendered correctly. (#1562)
segment.target: In browse mode in Google Chrome, the labels of check boxes and radio buttons are now rendered correctly. (#1562)

segment.source: In Instantbird, NVDA no longer reports useless information every time you move to a contact in the Contacts list. (#2667)
segment.target: In Instantbird, NVDA no longer reports useless information every time you move to a contact in the Contacts list. (#2667)

segment.source: In browse mode in Adobe Reader, the correct text is now rendered for buttons, etc. where the label has been overridden using a tooltip or other means. (#3640)
segment.target: In browse mode in Adobe Reader, the correct text is now rendered for buttons, etc. where the label has been overridden using a tooltip or other means. (#3640)

segment.source: In browse mode in Adobe Reader, extraneous graphics containing the text "mc-ref" will no longer be rendered. (#3645)
segment.target: In browse mode in Adobe Reader, extraneous graphics containing the text "mc-ref" will no longer be rendered. (#3645)

segment.source: NVDA no longer reports all cells in Microsoft Excel as underlined in their formatting information. (#3669)
segment.target: NVDA no longer reports all cells in Microsoft Excel as underlined in their formatting information. (#3669)

segment.source: No longer show meaningless characters in browse mode documents such as those found in the Unicode private usage range. In some cases these were stopping more useful labels from being shown. (#2963)
segment.target: No longer show meaningless characters in browse mode documents such as those found in the Unicode private usage range. In some cases these were stopping more useful labels from being shown. (#2963)

segment.source: Input composition for entering east-asian characters no longer fails in PuTTY. (#3432)
segment.target: Input composition for entering east-asian characters no longer fails in PuTTY. (#3432)

segment.source: Navigating in a document after a canceled say all no longer results in NVDA sometimes incorrectly announcing that you have left a field (such as a table) lower in the document that the say all never actually spoke. (#3688)
segment.target: Navigating in a document after a canceled say all no longer results in NVDA sometimes incorrectly announcing that you have left a field (such as a table) lower in the document that the say all never actually spoke. (#3688)

segment.source: When using browse mode quick navigation commands while in say all with skim reading enabled, NVDA more accurately announces the new field; e.g. it now says a heading is a heading, rather than just its text. (#3689)
segment.target: When using browse mode quick navigation commands while in say all with skim reading enabled, NVDA more accurately announces the new field; e.g. it now says a heading is a heading, rather than just its text. (#3689)

segment.source: The jump to end or start of container quick navigation commands now honor the skim reading during say all setting; i.e. they will no longer cancel the current say all. (#3675)
segment.target: The jump to end or start of container quick navigation commands now honor the skim reading during say all setting; i.e. they will no longer cancel the current say all. (#3675)

segment.source: Touch gesture names listed in NVDA's Input Gestures dialog are now friendly and localized. (#3624)
segment.target: Touch gesture names listed in NVDA's Input Gestures dialog are now friendly and localized. (#3624)

segment.source: NVDA no longer causes certain programs to crash when moving the mouse over their rich edit (TRichEdit) controls. Programs include Jarte 5.1 and BRfácil. (#3693, #3603, #3581)
segment.target: NVDA no longer causes certain programs to crash when moving the mouse over their rich edit (TRichEdit) controls. Programs include Jarte 5.1 and BRfácil. (#3693, #3603, #3581)

segment.source: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, containers such as tables marked as presentation by ARIA are no longer reported to the user. (#3713)
segment.target: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, containers such as tables marked as presentation by ARIA are no longer reported to the user. (#3713)

segment.source: in Microsoft Word, NVDA no longer inappropriately repeats table row and column information for a cell on a braille display multiple times. (#3702)
segment.target: in Microsoft Word, NVDA no longer inappropriately repeats table row and column information for a cell on a braille display multiple times. (#3702)

segment.source: In languages which use a space as a digit group/thousands separator such as French and German, numbers from separate chunks of text are no longer pronounced as a single number. This was particularly problematic for table cells containing numbers. (#3698)
segment.target: In languages which use a space as a digit group/thousands separator such as French and German, numbers from separate chunks of text are no longer pronounced as a single number. This was particularly problematic for table cells containing numbers. (#3698)

segment.source: Braille no longer sometimes fails to update when the system caret is moved in Microsoft Word 2013. (#3784)
segment.target: Braille no longer sometimes fails to update when the system caret is moved in Microsoft Word 2013. (#3784)

segment.source: When positioned on the first character of a heading in Microsoft Word, the text communicating it is a heading (including the level) no longer disappears off a braille display. (#3701)
segment.target: When positioned on the first character of a heading in Microsoft Word, the text communicating it is a heading (including the level) no longer disappears off a braille display. (#3701)

segment.source: When a configuration profile is triggered for an application and that application is exited, NVDA no longer sometimes fails to deactivate the profile. (#3732)
segment.target: When a configuration profile is triggered for an application and that application is exited, NVDA no longer sometimes fails to deactivate the profile. (#3732)

segment.source: When entering Asian input into a control within NVDA itself (e.g. the browse mode Find dialog), "NVDA" is no longer incorrectly reported in place of the candidate. (#3726)
segment.target: When entering Asian input into a control within NVDA itself (e.g. the browse mode Find dialog), "NVDA" is no longer incorrectly reported in place of the candidate. (#3726)

segment.source: The tabs in the Outlook 2013 options dialog are now reported. (#3826)
segment.target: The tabs in the Outlook 2013 options dialog are now reported. (#3826)

segment.source: Improved support for ARIA live regions in Firefox and other Mozilla Gecko applications:
segment.target: Improved support for ARIA live regions in Firefox and other Mozilla Gecko applications:

segment.source: Support for aria-atomic updates and filtering of aria-busy updates. (#2640)
segment.target: Support for aria-atomic updates and filtering of aria-busy updates. (#2640)

segment.source: Alternative text (such as alt attribute or aria-label) is included if there is no other useful text. (#3329)
segment.target: Alternative text (such as alt attribute or aria-label) is included if there is no other useful text. (#3329)

segment.source: Live region updates are no longer silenced if they occur at the same time as the focus moves. (#3777)
segment.target: Live region updates are no longer silenced if they occur at the same time as the focus moves. (#3777)

segment.source: Certain presentation elements in Firefox and other Mozilla Gecko applications are no longer inappropriately shown in browse mode (specifically, when the element is marked with aria-presentation but it is also focusable). (#3781)
segment.target: Certain presentation elements in Firefox and other Mozilla Gecko applications are no longer inappropriately shown in browse mode (specifically, when the element is marked with aria-presentation but it is also focusable). (#3781)

segment.source: A performance improvement when navigating a document in Microsoft Word with spelling errors enabled. (#3785)
segment.target: A performance improvement when navigating a document in Microsoft Word with spelling errors enabled. (#3785)

segment.source: Several fixes to the support for accessible Java applications:
segment.target: Several fixes to the support for accessible Java applications:

segment.source: The initially focused control in a frame or dialog no longer fails to be reported when the frame or dialog comes to the foreground. (#3753)
segment.target: The initially focused control in a frame or dialog no longer fails to be reported when the frame or dialog comes to the foreground. (#3753)

segment.source: Unuseful position information is no longer announced for radio buttons (e.g. 1 of 1). (#3754)
segment.target: Unuseful position information is no longer announced for radio buttons (e.g. 1 of 1). (#3754)

segment.source: Better reporting of JComboBox controls (html no longer reported, better reporting of expanded and collapsed states). (#3755)
segment.target: Better reporting of JComboBox controls (html no longer reported, better reporting of expanded and collapsed states). (#3755)

segment.source: When reporting the text of dialogs, some text that was previously missing is now included. (#3757)
segment.target: When reporting the text of dialogs, some text that was previously missing is now included. (#3757)

segment.source: Changes to the name, value or description of the focused control is now reported more accurately. (#3770)
segment.target: Changes to the name, value or description of the focused control is now reported more accurately. (#3770)

segment.source: Fix a crash in NVDA seen in Windows 8 when focusing on certain RichEdit controls containing large amounts of text (e.g. NVDA's log viewer, windbg). (#3867)
segment.target: Fix a crash in NVDA seen in Windows 8 when focusing on certain RichEdit controls containing large amounts of text (e.g. NVDA's log viewer, windbg). (#3867)

segment.source: On systems with a high DPI display setting (which occurs by default for many modern screens), NVDA no longer routes the mouse to the wrong location in some applications. (#3758, #3703)
segment.target: On systems with a high DPI display setting (which occurs by default for many modern screens), NVDA no longer routes the mouse to the wrong location in some applications. (#3758, #3703)

segment.source: Fixed an occasional problem when browsing the web where NVDA would stop working correctly until restarted, even though it didn't crash or freeze. (#3804)
segment.target: Fixed an occasional problem when browsing the web where NVDA would stop working correctly until restarted, even though it didn't crash or freeze. (#3804)

segment.source: A Papenmeier braille display can now be used even if a Papenmeier display has never been connected via USB. (#3712)
segment.target: A Papenmeier braille display can now be used even if a Papenmeier display has never been connected via USB. (#3712)

segment.source: NVDA no longer freezes when the Papenmeier BRAILLEX older models braille display is selected without a display connected.
segment.target: NVDA no longer freezes when the Papenmeier BRAILLEX older models braille display is selected without a display connected.

segment.source: Changes for Developers
segment.target: Promene za programere (engleski)

segment.source: AppModules now contain productName and productVersion properties. This info is also now included in Developer Info (NVDA+f1). (#1625)
segment.target: AppModules now contain productName and productVersion properties. This info is also now included in Developer Info (NVDA+f1). (#1625)

segment.source: In the Python Console, you can now press the tab key to complete the current identifier. (#433)
segment.target: In the Python Console, you can now press the tab key to complete the current identifier. (#433)

segment.source: If there are multiple possibilities, you can press tab a second time to choose from a list.
segment.target: If there are multiple possibilities, you can press tab a second time to choose from a list.

segment.source: New Features
segment.target: New Features

segment.source: Form fields are now reported in Microsoft word documents. (#2295)
segment.target: Form fields are now reported in Microsoft word documents. (#2295)

segment.source: NVDA can now announce revision information in Microsoft Word when Track Changes is enabled. Note that Report editor revisions in NVDA's document settings dialog (off by default) must be enabled also for them to be announced. (#1670)
segment.target: NVDA can now announce revision information in Microsoft Word when Track Changes is enabled. Note that Report editor revisions in NVDA's document settings dialog (off by default) must be enabled also for them to be announced. (#1670)

segment.source: Dropdown lists in Microsoft Excel 2003 through 2010 are now announced when opened and navigated around. (#3382)
segment.target: Dropdown lists in Microsoft Excel 2003 through 2010 are now announced when opened and navigated around. (#3382)

segment.source: a new 'Allow Skim Reading in Say All' option in the Keyboard settings dialog allows navigating through a document with browse mode quick navigation and line / paragraph movement commands, while remaining in say all. This option is off by default. (#2766)
segment.target: a new 'Allow Skim Reading in Say All' option in the Keyboard settings dialog allows navigating through a document with browse mode quick navigation and line / paragraph movement commands, while remaining in say all. This option is off by default. (#2766)

segment.source: There is now an Input Gestures dialog to allow simpler customization of the input gestures (such as keys on the keyboard) for NVDA commands. (#1532)
segment.target: There is now an Input Gestures dialog to allow simpler customization of the input gestures (such as keys on the keyboard) for NVDA commands. (#1532)

segment.source: You can now have different settings for different situations using configuration profiles. Profiles can be activated manually or automatically (e.g. for a particular application). (#87, #667, #1913)
segment.target: You can now have different settings for different situations using configuration profiles. Profiles can be activated manually or automatically (e.g. for a particular application). (#87, #667, #1913)

segment.source: In Microsoft Excel, cells that are links are now announced as links. (#3042)
segment.target: In Microsoft Excel, cells that are links are now announced as links. (#3042)

segment.source: In Microsoft Excel, the existence of comments on a cell is now reported to the user. (#2921)
segment.target: In Microsoft Excel, the existence of comments on a cell is now reported to the user. (#2921)

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: Zend Studio now functions the same as Eclipse. (#3420)
segment.target: Zend Studio now functions the same as Eclipse. (#3420)

segment.source: The changed state of certain checkboxes in the Microsoft Outlook 2010 message rules dialog are now reported automatically. (#3063)
segment.target: The changed state of certain checkboxes in the Microsoft Outlook 2010 message rules dialog are now reported automatically. (#3063)

segment.source: NVDA will now report the pinned state for pinned controls such as tabs in Mozilla Firefox. (#3372)
segment.target: NVDA will now report the pinned state for pinned controls such as tabs in Mozilla Firefox. (#3372)

segment.source: It is now possible to bind scripts to keyboard gestures containing Alt and/or Windows keys as modifiers. Previously, if this was done, performing the script would cause the Start Menu or menu bar to be activated. (#3472)
segment.target: It is now possible to bind scripts to keyboard gestures containing Alt and/or Windows keys as modifiers. Previously, if this was done, performing the script would cause the Start Menu or menu bar to be activated. (#3472)

segment.source: Selecting text in browse mode documents (e.g. using control+shift+end) no longer causes the keyboard layout to be switched on systems with multiple keyboard layouts installed. (#3472)
segment.target: Selecting text in browse mode documents (e.g. using control+shift+end) no longer causes the keyboard layout to be switched on systems with multiple keyboard layouts installed. (#3472)

segment.source: Internet Explorer should no longer crash or become unusable when closing NVDA. (#3397)
segment.target: Internet Explorer should no longer crash or become unusable when closing NVDA. (#3397)

segment.source: Physical movement and other events on some newer computers are no longer treated as inappropriate key presses. Previously, this silenced speech and sometimes triggered NVDA commands. (#3468)
segment.target: Physical movement and other events on some newer computers are no longer treated as inappropriate key presses. Previously, this silenced speech and sometimes triggered NVDA commands. (#3468)

segment.source: NVDA now behaves as expected in Poedit 1.5.7. Users using earlier versions will need to update. (#3485)
segment.target: NVDA now behaves as expected in Poedit 1.5.7. Users using earlier versions will need to update. (#3485)

segment.source: NVDA can now read protected documents in Microsoft Word 2010, no longer causing Microsoft Word to crash. (#1686)
segment.target: NVDA can now read protected documents in Microsoft Word 2010, no longer causing Microsoft Word to crash. (#1686)

segment.source: If an unknown command line switch is given when launching the NVDA distribution package, it no longer causes an endless loop of error message dialogs. (#3463)
segment.target: If an unknown command line switch is given when launching the NVDA distribution package, it no longer causes an endless loop of error message dialogs. (#3463)

segment.source: NVDA no longer fails to report alt text of graphics and objects in Microsoft Word if the alt text contains quotes or other non-standard characters. (#3579)
segment.target: NVDA no longer fails to report alt text of graphics and objects in Microsoft Word if the alt text contains quotes or other non-standard characters. (#3579)

segment.source: The number of items for certain horizontal lists in Browse mode is now correct. Previously it may have been double the actual amount. (#2151)
segment.target: The number of items for certain horizontal lists in Browse mode is now correct. Previously it may have been double the actual amount. (#2151)

segment.source: When pressing control+a in a Microsoft Excel worksheet, the updated selection will now be reported. (#3043)
segment.target: When pressing control+a in a Microsoft Excel worksheet, the updated selection will now be reported. (#3043)

segment.source: NVDA can now correctly read XHTML documents in Microsoft Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls. (#3542)
