segment.target: NVDA can now correctly read XHTML documents in Microsoft Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls. (#3542)

segment.source: Keyboard settings dialog: if no key has been chosen to be used as the NVDA key, an error is presented to the user when dismissing the dialog. At least one key must be chosen for proper usage of NVDA. (#2871)
segment.target: Keyboard settings dialog: if no key has been chosen to be used as the NVDA key, an error is presented to the user when dismissing the dialog. At least one key must be chosen for proper usage of NVDA. (#2871)

segment.source: In Microsoft Excel, NVDA now announces merged cells differently to multiple selected cells. (#3567)
segment.target: In Microsoft Excel, NVDA now announces merged cells differently to multiple selected cells. (#3567)

segment.source: The browse mode cursor is no longer positioned incorrectly when leaving a dialog or application inside the document. (#3145)
segment.target: The browse mode cursor is no longer positioned incorrectly when leaving a dialog or application inside the document. (#3145)

segment.source: Fixed an issue where the HumanWare Brailliant BI/B series braille display driver wasn't presented as an option in the Braille Settings dialog on some systems, even though such a display was connected via USB.
segment.target: Fixed an issue where the HumanWare Brailliant BI/B series braille display driver wasn't presented as an option in the Braille Settings dialog on some systems, even though such a display was connected via USB.

segment.source: NVDA no longer fails to switch to screen review when the navigator object has no actual screen location. In this case the review cursor is now placed at the top of the screen. (#3454)
segment.target: NVDA no longer fails to switch to screen review when the navigator object has no actual screen location. In this case the review cursor is now placed at the top of the screen. (#3454)

segment.source: Fixed an issue which caused the Freedom Scientific braille display driver to fail when the port was set to USB in some circumstances. (#3509, #3662)
segment.target: Fixed an issue which caused the Freedom Scientific braille display driver to fail when the port was set to USB in some circumstances. (#3509, #3662)

segment.source: Fixed an issue where keys on Freedom Scientific braille displays weren't detected in some circumstances. (#3401, #3662)
segment.target: Fixed an issue where keys on Freedom Scientific braille displays weren't detected in some circumstances. (#3401, #3662)

segment.source: Changes for Developers
segment.target: Promene za programere (engleski)

segment.source: You can specify the category to be displayed to the user for scripts using the scriptCategory attribute on ScriptableObject classes and the category attribute on script methods. See the documentation for baseObject.ScriptableObject for more details. (#1532)
segment.target: You can specify the category to be displayed to the user for scripts using the scriptCategory attribute on ScriptableObject classes and the category attribute on script methods. See the documentation for baseObject.ScriptableObject for more details. (#1532)

segment.source: config.save is deprecated and may be removed in a future release. Use config.conf.save instead. (#667)
segment.target: config.save is deprecated and may be removed in a future release. Use config.conf.save instead. (#667)

segment.source: config.validateConfig is deprecated and may be removed in a future release. Add-ons which need this should provide their own implementation. (#667, #3632)
segment.target: config.validateConfig is deprecated and may be removed in a future release. Add-ons which need this should provide their own implementation. (#667, #3632)

segment.source: New Features
segment.target: New Features

segment.source: Support for the Chromium Embedded Framework, which is a web browser control used in several applications. (#3108)
segment.target: Support for the Chromium Embedded Framework, which is a web browser control used in several applications. (#3108)

segment.source: New eSpeak voice variant: Iven3.
segment.target: New eSpeak voice variant: Iven3.

segment.source: In Skype, new chat messages are reported automatically while the conversation is focused. (#2298)
segment.target: In Skype, new chat messages are reported automatically while the conversation is focused. (#2298)

segment.source: Support for Tween, including reporting of tab names and less verbosity when reading tweets.
segment.target: Support for Tween, including reporting of tab names and less verbosity when reading tweets.

segment.source: You can now disable displaying of NVDA messages on a braille display by setting the message timeout to 0 in the Braille Settings dialog. (#2482)
segment.target: You can now disable displaying of NVDA messages on a braille display by setting the message timeout to 0 in the Braille Settings dialog. (#2482)

segment.source: In the Add-ons Manager, there is now a Get Add-ons button to open the NVDA Add-ons web site where you can browse and download available add-ons. (#3209)
segment.target: In the Add-ons Manager, there is now a Get Add-ons button to open the NVDA Add-ons web site where you can browse and download available add-ons. (#3209)

segment.source: In the NVDA Welcome dialog which always appears the first time you run NVDA, you can now specify whether NVDA starts automatically after you log on to Windows. (#2234)
segment.target: In the NVDA Welcome dialog which always appears the first time you run NVDA, you can now specify whether NVDA starts automatically after you log on to Windows. (#2234)

segment.source: Sleep mode is automatically enabled when using Dolphin Cicero. (#2055)
segment.target: Sleep mode is automatically enabled when using Dolphin Cicero. (#2055)

segment.source: The Windows x64 version of Miranda IM/Miranda NG is now supported. (#3296)
segment.target: The Windows x64 version of Miranda IM/Miranda NG is now supported. (#3296)

segment.source: Search suggestions in the Windows 8.1 Start Screen are automatically reported. (#3322)
segment.target: Search suggestions in the Windows 8.1 Start Screen are automatically reported. (#3322)

segment.source: Support for navigating and editing spreadsheets in Microsoft Excel 2013. (#3360)
segment.target: Support for navigating and editing spreadsheets in Microsoft Excel 2013. (#3360)

segment.source: The Freedom Scientific Focus 14 Blue and Focus 80 Blue braille displays, as well as the Focus 40 Blue in certain configurations that weren't supported previously, are now supported when connected via Bluetooth. (#3307)
segment.target: The Freedom Scientific Focus 14 Blue and Focus 80 Blue braille displays, as well as the Focus 40 Blue in certain configurations that weren't supported previously, are now supported when connected via Bluetooth. (#3307)

segment.source: Auto complete suggestions are now reported in Outlook 2010. (#2816)
segment.target: Auto complete suggestions are now reported in Outlook 2010. (#2816)

segment.source: New braille translation tables: English (U.K.) computer braille, Korean grade 2, Russian braille for computer code.
segment.target: New braille translation tables: English (U.K.) computer braille, Korean grade 2, Russian braille for computer code.

segment.source: New language: Farsi. (#1427)
segment.target: New language: Farsi. (#1427)

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: On a touch screen, performing a single finger flick left or right when in object mode now moves previous or next through all objects, not just those in the current container. Use 2-finger flick left or right to perform the original action of moving to the previous or next object in the current container.
segment.target: On a touch screen, performing a single finger flick left or right when in object mode now moves previous or next through all objects, not just those in the current container. Use 2-finger flick left or right to perform the original action of moving to the previous or next object in the current container.

segment.source: the Report layout tables checkbox found in the Browse Mode settings dialog has now been renamed to Include layout tables to reflect that quick navigation also will not locate them if the checkbox is unchecked. (#3140)
segment.target: the Report layout tables checkbox found in the Browse Mode settings dialog has now been renamed to Include layout tables to reflect that quick navigation also will not locate them if the checkbox is unchecked. (#3140)

segment.source: Flat review has been replaced with object, document and screen review modes. (#2996)
segment.target: Flat review has been replaced with object, document and screen review modes. (#2996)

segment.source: Object review reviews text just within the navigator object, document review reviews all text in a browse mode document (if any) and screen review reviews text on the screen for the current application.
segment.target: Object review reviews text just within the navigator object, document review reviews all text in a browse mode document (if any) and screen review reviews text on the screen for the current application.

segment.source: The commands that previously move to/from flat review now toggle between these new review modes.
segment.target: The commands that previously move to/from flat review now toggle between these new review modes.

segment.source: The navigator object automatically follows the review cursor such that it remains the deepest object at the position of the review cursor when in document or screen review modes.
segment.target: The navigator object automatically follows the review cursor such that it remains the deepest object at the position of the review cursor when in document or screen review modes.

segment.source: After switching to screen review mode, NVDA will stay in this mode until you explicitly switch back to document or object review mode.
segment.target: After switching to screen review mode, NVDA will stay in this mode until you explicitly switch back to document or object review mode.

segment.source: When in document or object review mode, NVDA may automatically switch between these two modes depending on whether you are moving around a browse mode document or not.
segment.target: When in document or object review mode, NVDA may automatically switch between these two modes depending on whether you are moving around a browse mode document or not.

segment.source: Updated liblouis braille translator to 2.5.3. (#3371)
segment.target: Updated liblouis braille translator to 2.5.3. (#3371)

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: Activating an object now announces the action before the activation, rather than the action after the activation (e.g. expand when expanding rather than collapse). (#2982)
segment.target: Activating an object now announces the action before the activation, rather than the action after the activation (e.g. expand when expanding rather than collapse). (#2982)

segment.source: More accurate reading and cursor tracking in various input fields for recent versions of Skype, such as chat and search fields. (#1601, #3036)
segment.target: More accurate reading and cursor tracking in various input fields for recent versions of Skype, such as chat and search fields. (#1601, #3036)

segment.source: In the Skype recent conversations list, the number of new events is now read for each conversation if relevant. (#1446)
segment.target: In the Skype recent conversations list, the number of new events is now read for each conversation if relevant. (#1446)

segment.source: Improvements to cursor tracking and reading order for right-to-left text written to the screen; e.g. editing Arabic text in Microsoft Excel. (#1601)
segment.target: Improvements to cursor tracking and reading order for right-to-left text written to the screen; e.g. editing Arabic text in Microsoft Excel. (#1601)

segment.source: Quick navigation to buttons and form fields will now locate links marked as buttons for accessibility purposes in Internet Explorer. (#2750)
segment.target: Quick navigation to buttons and form fields will now locate links marked as buttons for accessibility purposes in Internet Explorer. (#2750)

segment.source: In browse mode, the content inside tree views is no longer rendered, as a flattened representation isn't useful. You can press enter on a tree view to interact with it in focus mode. (#3023)
segment.target: In browse mode, the content inside tree views is no longer rendered, as a flattened representation isn't useful. You can press enter on a tree view to interact with it in focus mode. (#3023)

segment.source: Pressing alt+downArrow or alt+upArrow to expand a combo box while in focus mode no longer incorrectly switches to browse mode. (#2340)
segment.target: Pressing alt+downArrow or alt+upArrow to expand a combo box while in focus mode no longer incorrectly switches to browse mode. (#2340)

segment.source: In Internet Explorer 10, table cells no longer activate focus mode, unless they have been explicitly made focusable by the web author. (#3248)
segment.target: In Internet Explorer 10, table cells no longer activate focus mode, unless they have been explicitly made focusable by the web author. (#3248)

segment.source: NVDA no longer fails to start if the system time is earlier than the last check for an update. (#3260)
segment.target: NVDA no longer fails to start if the system time is earlier than the last check for an update. (#3260)

segment.source: If a progress bar is shown on a braille display, the braille display is updated when the progress bar changes. (#3258)
segment.target: If a progress bar is shown on a braille display, the braille display is updated when the progress bar changes. (#3258)

segment.source: In browse mode in Mozilla applications, table captions are no longer rendered twice. In addition, the summary is rendered when there is also a caption. (#3196)
segment.target: In browse mode in Mozilla applications, table captions are no longer rendered twice. In addition, the summary is rendered when there is also a caption. (#3196)

segment.source: When changing input languages in Windows 8, NVDA now speaks the correct language rather than the previous one.
segment.target: When changing input languages in Windows 8, NVDA now speaks the correct language rather than the previous one.

segment.source: NVDA now announces IME conversion mode changes in Windows 8.
segment.target: NVDA now announces IME conversion mode changes in Windows 8.

segment.source: NVDA no longer announces garbage on the Desktop when the Google Japanese or Atok IME input methods are in use. (#3234)
segment.target: NVDA no longer announces garbage on the Desktop when the Google Japanese or Atok IME input methods are in use. (#3234)

segment.source: In Windows 7 and above, NVDA no longer inappropriately announces speech recognition or touch input as a keyboard language change.
segment.target: In Windows 7 and above, NVDA no longer inappropriately announces speech recognition or touch input as a keyboard language change.

segment.source: NVDA no longer announces a particular special character (0x7f) when pressing control+backspace in some editors when speak typed characters is enabled. (#3315)
segment.target: NVDA no longer announces a particular special character (0x7f) when pressing control+backspace in some editors when speak typed characters is enabled. (#3315)

segment.source: eSpeak no longer inappropriately changes in pitch, volume, etc. when NVDA reads text containing certain control characters or XML. (#3334) (regression of #437)
segment.target: eSpeak no longer inappropriately changes in pitch, volume, etc. when NVDA reads text containing certain control characters or XML. (#3334) (regression of #437)

segment.source: In Java applications, changes to the label or value of the focused control are now announced automatically, and are reflected when subsequently querying the control. (#3119)
segment.target: In Java applications, changes to the label or value of the focused control are now announced automatically, and are reflected when subsequently querying the control. (#3119)

segment.source: In Scintilla controls, lines are now reported correctly when word wrap is enabled. (#885)
segment.target: In Scintilla controls, lines are now reported correctly when word wrap is enabled. (#885)

segment.source: In Mozilla applications, the name of read-only list items is now correctly reported; e.g. when navigating tweets in focus mode on twitter.com. (#3327)
segment.target: In Mozilla applications, the name of read-only list items is now correctly reported; e.g. when navigating tweets in focus mode on twitter.com. (#3327)

segment.source: Confirmation dialogs in Microsoft Office 2013 now have their content automatically read when they appear.
segment.target: Confirmation dialogs in Microsoft Office 2013 now have their content automatically read when they appear.

segment.source: Performance improvements when navigating certain tables in Microsoft Word. (#3326)
segment.target: Performance improvements when navigating certain tables in Microsoft Word. (#3326)

segment.source: NVDA's table navigation commands (control+alt+arrows) function better in certain Microsoft Word tables where a cell spans multiple rows.
segment.target: NVDA's table navigation commands (control+alt+arrows) function better in certain Microsoft Word tables where a cell spans multiple rows.

segment.source: If the Add-ons Manager is already open, activating it again (either from the Tools menu or by opening an add-on file) no longer fails or makes it impossible to close the Add-ons Manager. (#3351)
segment.target: If the Add-ons Manager is already open, activating it again (either from the Tools menu or by opening an add-on file) no longer fails or makes it impossible to close the Add-ons Manager. (#3351)

segment.source: NVDA no longer freezes in certain dialogs when Japanese or Chinese Office 2010 IME is in use. (#3064)
segment.target: NVDA no longer freezes in certain dialogs when Japanese or Chinese Office 2010 IME is in use. (#3064)

segment.source: Multiple spaces are no longer compressed to just one space on braille displays. (#1366)
segment.target: Multiple spaces are no longer compressed to just one space on braille displays. (#1366)

segment.source: Zend Eclipse PHP Developer Tools now functions the same as Eclipse. (#3353)
segment.target: Zend Eclipse PHP Developer Tools now functions the same as Eclipse. (#3353)

segment.source: In Internet Explorer, It is again not necessary to press tab to interact with an embedded object (such as Flash content) after pressing enter on it. (#3364)
segment.target: In Internet Explorer, It is again not necessary to press tab to interact with an embedded object (such as Flash content) after pressing enter on it. (#3364)

segment.source: When editing text in Microsoft PowerPoint, the last line is no longer reported as the line above, if the final line is blank. (#3403)
segment.target: When editing text in Microsoft PowerPoint, the last line is no longer reported as the line above, if the final line is blank. (#3403)

segment.source: In Microsoft PowerPoint, objects are no longer sometimes spoken twice when you select them or choose to edit them. (#3394)
segment.target: In Microsoft PowerPoint, objects are no longer sometimes spoken twice when you select them or choose to edit them. (#3394)

segment.source: NVDA no longer causes Adobe Reader to crash or freeze for certain badly formed PDF documents containing rows outside of tables. (#3399)
segment.target: NVDA no longer causes Adobe Reader to crash or freeze for certain badly formed PDF documents containing rows outside of tables. (#3399)

segment.source: NVDA now correctly detects the next slide with focus when deleting a slide in Microsoft PowerPoint's thumbnails view. (#3415)
segment.target: NVDA now correctly detects the next slide with focus when deleting a slide in Microsoft PowerPoint's thumbnails view. (#3415)

segment.source: Changes for Developers
segment.target: Promene za programere (engleski)

segment.source: windowUtils.findDescendantWindow has been added to search for a descendant window (HWND) matching the specified visibility, control ID and/or class name.
segment.target: windowUtils.findDescendantWindow has been added to search for a descendant window (HWND) matching the specified visibility, control ID and/or class name.

segment.source: The remote Python console no longer times out after 10 seconds while waiting for input. (#3126)
segment.target: The remote Python console no longer times out after 10 seconds while waiting for input. (#3126)

segment.source: Inclusion of the bisect module in binary builds is deprecated and may be removed in a future release. (#3368)
segment.target: Inclusion of the bisect module in binary builds is deprecated and may be removed in a future release. (#3368)

segment.source: Add-ons which depend on bisect (including the urllib2 module) should be updated to include this module.
segment.target: Add-ons which depend on bisect (including the urllib2 module) should be updated to include this module.

segment.source: This release fixes the problem where NVDA crashed when started if configured to use the Irish language, as well as including updates to translations and some other bug fixes.
segment.target: This release fixes the problem where NVDA crashed when started if configured to use the Irish language, as well as including updates to translations and some other bug fixes.

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: Correct characters are produced when typing in NVDA's own user interface while using a Korean or Japanese input method while it is the default method. (#2909)
segment.target: Correct characters are produced when typing in NVDA's own user interface while using a Korean or Japanese input method while it is the default method. (#2909)

segment.source: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, fields marked as containing an invalid entry are now handled correctly. (#3256)
segment.target: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, fields marked as containing an invalid entry are now handled correctly. (#3256)

segment.source: NVDA no longer crashes when started if it is configured to use the Irish language.
segment.target: NVDA no longer crashes when started if it is configured to use the Irish language.

segment.source: Highlights of this release include a more intuitive and consistent laptop keyboard layout; basic support for Microsoft PowerPoint; support for long descriptions in web browsers; and support for input of computer braille for braille displays which have a braille keyboard.
segment.target: Highlights of this release include a more intuitive and consistent laptop keyboard layout; basic support for Microsoft PowerPoint; support for long descriptions in web browsers; and support for input of computer braille for braille displays which have a braille keyboard.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: New Laptop Keyboard Layout
segment.target: New Laptop Keyboard Layout

segment.source: The laptop keyboard layout has been completely redesigned in order to make it more intuitive and consistent.
segment.target: The laptop keyboard layout has been completely redesigned in order to make it more intuitive and consistent.

segment.source: The new layout uses the arrow keys in combination with the NVDA key and other modifiers for review commands.
segment.target: The new layout uses the arrow keys in combination with the NVDA key and other modifiers for review commands.

segment.source: Please note the following changes to commonly used commands:
segment.target: Please note the following changes to commonly used commands:

segment.source: Name |Key
segment.target: Name |Key

segment.source: Say all |NVDA+a
segment.target: Say all |NVDA+a

segment.source: Read current line |NVDA+l
segment.target: Read current line |NVDA+l

segment.source: Read current text selection |NVDA+shift+s
segment.target: Read current text selection |NVDA+shift+s

segment.source: Report status bar |NVDA+shift+end
segment.target: Report status bar |NVDA+shift+end

segment.source: In addition, among other changes, all of the object navigation, text review, mouse click and synth settings ring commands have changed.
segment.target: In addition, among other changes, all of the object navigation, text review, mouse click and synth settings ring commands have changed.

segment.source: Please see the [Commands Quick Reference](keyCommands.html) document for the new keys.
segment.target: Please see the [Commands Quick Reference](keyCommands.html) document for the new keys.

segment.source: New Features
segment.target: New Features

segment.source: Basic support for editing and reading Microsoft PowerPoint presentations. (#501)
segment.target: Basic support for editing and reading Microsoft PowerPoint presentations. (#501)

segment.source: Basic support for reading and writing messages in Lotus Notes 8.5. (#543)
segment.target: Basic support for reading and writing messages in Lotus Notes 8.5. (#543)

segment.source: Support for automatic language switching when reading documents in Microsoft Word. (#2047)
segment.target: Support for automatic language switching when reading documents in Microsoft Word. (#2047)

segment.source: In Browse mode for MSHTML (e.g. Internet Explorer) and Gecko (e.g. Firefox), the existence of long descriptions are now announced. It's also possible to open the long description in a new window by pressing NVDA+d. (#809)
segment.target: In Browse mode for MSHTML (e.g. Internet Explorer) and Gecko (e.g. Firefox), the existence of long descriptions are now announced. It's also possible to open the long description in a new window by pressing NVDA+d. (#809)

segment.source: Notifications in Internet Explorer 9 and above are now spoken (such as content blocking or file downloads). (#2343)
segment.target: Notifications in Internet Explorer 9 and above are now spoken (such as content blocking or file downloads). (#2343)

segment.source: Automatic reporting of table row and column headers is now supported for browse mode documents in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls. (#778)
segment.target: Automatic reporting of table row and column headers is now supported for browse mode documents in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls. (#778)

segment.source: New language: Aragonese, Irish
segment.target: New language: Aragonese, Irish

segment.source: New braille translation tables: Danish grade 2, Korean grade 1. (#2737)
segment.target: New braille translation tables: Danish grade 2, Korean grade 1. (#2737)

segment.source: Support for braille displays connected via bluetooth on a computer running the Bluetooth Stack for Windows by Toshiba. (#2419)
segment.target: Support for braille displays connected via bluetooth on a computer running the Bluetooth Stack for Windows by Toshiba. (#2419)

segment.source: Support for port selection when using Freedom Scientific displays (Automatic, USB or Bluetooth).
segment.target: Support for port selection when using Freedom Scientific displays (Automatic, USB or Bluetooth).

segment.source: Support for the BrailleNote family of notetakers from HumanWare when acting as a braille terminal for a screen reader. (#2012)
segment.target: Support for the BrailleNote family of notetakers from HumanWare when acting as a braille terminal for a screen reader. (#2012)

segment.source: Support for older models of Papenmeier BRAILLEX braille displays. (#2679)
segment.target: Support for older models of Papenmeier BRAILLEX braille displays. (#2679)

segment.source: Support for input of computer braille for braille displays which have a braille keyboard. (#808)
segment.target: Support for input of computer braille for braille displays which have a braille keyboard. (#808)

segment.source: New keyboard settings that allow the choice for whether NVDA should interrupt speech for typed characters and/or the Enter key. (#698)
segment.target: New keyboard settings that allow the choice for whether NVDA should interrupt speech for typed characters and/or the Enter key. (#698)

segment.source: Support for several browsers based on Google Chrome: Rockmelt, BlackHawk, Comodo Dragon and SRWare Iron. (#2236, #2813, #2814, #2815)
segment.target: Support for several browsers based on Google Chrome: Rockmelt, BlackHawk, Comodo Dragon and SRWare Iron. (#2236, #2813, #2814, #2815)

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: Updated liblouis braille translator to 2.5.2. (#2737)
segment.target: Updated liblouis braille translator to 2.5.2. (#2737)

segment.source: The laptop keyboard layout has been completely redesigned in order to make it more intuitive and consistent. (#804)
segment.target: The laptop keyboard layout has been completely redesigned in order to make it more intuitive and consistent. (#804)

segment.source: Updated eSpeak speech synthesizer to 1.47.11. (#2680, #3124, #3132, #3141, #3143, #3172)
segment.target: Updated eSpeak speech synthesizer to 1.47.11. (#2680, #3124, #3132, #3141, #3143, #3172)

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: The quick navigation keys for jumping to the next or previous separator in Browse Mode now work in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls. (#2781)
segment.target: The quick navigation keys for jumping to the next or previous separator in Browse Mode now work in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls. (#2781)

segment.source: If NVDA falls back to eSpeak or no speech due to the configured speech synthesizer failing when NVDA starts, the configured choice is no longer automatically set to the fallback synthesizer. This means that now, the original synthesizer will be tried again next time NVDA starts. (#2589)
segment.target: If NVDA falls back to eSpeak or no speech due to the configured speech synthesizer failing when NVDA starts, the configured choice is no longer automatically set to the fallback synthesizer. This means that now, the original synthesizer will be tried again next time NVDA starts. (#2589)

segment.source: If NVDA falls back to no braille due to the configured braille display failing when NVDA starts, the configured display is no longer automatically set to no braille. This means that now, the original display will be tried again next time NVDA starts. (#2264)
segment.target: If NVDA falls back to no braille due to the configured braille display failing when NVDA starts, the configured display is no longer automatically set to no braille. This means that now, the original display will be tried again next time NVDA starts. (#2264)

segment.source: In browse mode in Mozilla applications, updates to tables are now rendered correctly. For example, in updated cells, row and column coordinates are reported and table navigation works as it should. (#2784)
segment.target: In browse mode in Mozilla applications, updates to tables are now rendered correctly. For example, in updated cells, row and column coordinates are reported and table navigation works as it should. (#2784)

segment.source: In browse mode in web browsers, certain clickable unlabelled graphics which weren't previously rendered are now rendered correctly. (#2838)
segment.target: In browse mode in web browsers, certain clickable unlabelled graphics which weren't previously rendered are now rendered correctly. (#2838)

segment.source: Earlier and newer versions of SecureCRT are now supported. (#2800)
segment.target: Earlier and newer versions of SecureCRT are now supported. (#2800)

segment.source: For input methods such as Easy Dots IME under XP, the reading string is now correctly reported.
segment.target: For input methods such as Easy Dots IME under XP, the reading string is now correctly reported.

segment.source: The candidate list in the Chinese Simplified Microsoft Pinyin input method under Windows 7 is now correctly read when changing pages with left and right arrow, and when first opening it with Home.
segment.target: The candidate list in the Chinese Simplified Microsoft Pinyin input method under Windows 7 is now correctly read when changing pages with left and right arrow, and when first opening it with Home.

segment.source: When custom symbol pronunciation information is saved, the advanced "preserve" field is no longer removed. (#2852)
segment.target: When custom symbol pronunciation information is saved, the advanced "preserve" field is no longer removed. (#2852)

segment.source: When disabling automatic checking for updates, NVDA no longer has to be restarted in order for the change to fully take effect.
segment.target: When disabling automatic checking for updates, NVDA no longer has to be restarted in order for the change to fully take effect.

segment.source: NVDA no longer fails to start if an add-on cannot be removed due to its directory currently being in use by another application. (#2860)
segment.target: NVDA no longer fails to start if an add-on cannot be removed due to its directory currently being in use by another application. (#2860)

segment.source: Tab labels in DropBox's preferences dialog can now be seen with Flat Review.
segment.target: Tab labels in DropBox's preferences dialog can now be seen with Flat Review.

segment.source: If the input language is changed to something other than the default, NVDA now detects keys correctly for commands and input help mode.
segment.target: If the input language is changed to something other than the default, NVDA now detects keys correctly for commands and input help mode.

segment.source: For languages such as German where the + (plus) sign is a single key on the keyboard, it is now possible to bind commands to it by using the word "plus". (#2898)
segment.target: For languages such as German where the + (plus) sign is a single key on the keyboard, it is now possible to bind commands to it by using the word "plus". (#2898)

segment.source: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, block quotes are now reported where appropriate. (#2888)
segment.target: In Internet Explorer and other MSHTML controls, block quotes are now reported where appropriate. (#2888)

segment.source: The HumanWare Brailliant BI/B series braille display driver can now be selected when the display is connected via Bluetooth but has never been connected via USB.
segment.target: The HumanWare Brailliant BI/B series braille display driver can now be selected when the display is connected via Bluetooth but has never been connected via USB.

segment.source: Filtering elements in the Browse Mode Elements list with uppercase filter text now returns case-insensitive results just like lowercase rather than nothing at all. (#2951)
segment.target: Filtering elements in the Browse Mode Elements list with uppercase filter text now returns case-insensitive results just like lowercase rather than nothing at all. (#2951)

segment.source: In Mozilla browsers, browse mode can again be used when Flash content is focused. (#2546)
segment.target: In Mozilla browsers, browse mode can again be used when Flash content is focused. (#2546)

segment.source: When using a contracted braille table and expand to computer braille for the word at the cursor is enabled, the braille cursor is now positioned correctly when located after a word wherein a character is represented by multiple braille cells (e.g. capital sign, letter sign, number sign, etc.). (#2947)
segment.target: When using a contracted braille table and expand to computer braille for the word at the cursor is enabled, the braille cursor is now positioned correctly when located after a word wherein a character is represented by multiple braille cells (e.g. capital sign, letter sign, number sign, etc.). (#2947)

segment.source: Text selection is now correctly shown on a braille display in applications such as Microsoft word 2003 and Internet Explorer edit controls.
segment.target: Text selection is now correctly shown on a braille display in applications such as Microsoft word 2003 and Internet Explorer edit controls.

segment.source: It is again possible to select text in a backward direction in Microsoft Word while Braille is enabled.
segment.target: It is again possible to select text in a backward direction in Microsoft Word while Braille is enabled.

segment.source: When reviewing, backspacing or deleting characters In Scintilla edit controls, NVDA correctly announces multibyte characters. (#2855)
segment.target: When reviewing, backspacing or deleting characters In Scintilla edit controls, NVDA correctly announces multibyte characters. (#2855)

segment.source: NVDA will no longer fail to install when the user's profile path contains certain multibyte characters. (#2729)
segment.target: NVDA will no longer fail to install when the user's profile path contains certain multibyte characters. (#2729)

segment.source: Reporting of groups for List View controls (SysListview32) in 64-bit applications no longer causes an error.
segment.target: Reporting of groups for List View controls (SysListview32) in 64-bit applications no longer causes an error.

segment.source: In browse mode in Mozilla applications, text content is no longer incorrectly treated as editable in some rare cases. (#2959)
segment.target: In browse mode in Mozilla applications, text content is no longer incorrectly treated as editable in some rare cases. (#2959)

segment.source: In IBM Lotus Symphony and OpenOffice, moving the caret now moves the review cursor if appropriate.
segment.target: In IBM Lotus Symphony and OpenOffice, moving the caret now moves the review cursor if appropriate.

segment.source: Adobe Flash content is now accessible in Internet Explorer in Windows 8. (#2454)
segment.target: Adobe Flash content is now accessible in Internet Explorer in Windows 8. (#2454)

segment.source: Fixed Bluetooth support for Papenmeier Braillex Trio. (#2995)
segment.target: Fixed Bluetooth support for Papenmeier Braillex Trio. (#2995)

segment.source: Fixed inability to use certain Microsoft Speech API version 5 voices such as Koba Speech 2 voices. (#2629)
segment.target: Fixed inability to use certain Microsoft Speech API version 5 voices such as Koba Speech 2 voices. (#2629)

segment.source: In applications using the Java Access Bridge, braille displays are now updated correctly when the caret moves in editable text fields . (#3107)
segment.target: In applications using the Java Access Bridge, braille displays are now updated correctly when the caret moves in editable text fields . (#3107)

segment.source: Support the form landmark in browse mode documents that support landmarks. (#2997)
segment.target: Support the form landmark in browse mode documents that support landmarks. (#2997)

segment.source: The eSpeak synthesizer driver now handles reading by character more appropriately (e.g. announcing a foreign letter's name or value rather than just its sound or generic name). (#3106)
segment.target: The eSpeak synthesizer driver now handles reading by character more appropriately (e.g. announcing a foreign letter's name or value rather than just its sound or generic name). (#3106)

segment.source: NVDA no longer fails to copy user settings for use on logon and other secure screens when the user's profile path contains non-ASCII characters. (#3092)
segment.target: NVDA no longer fails to copy user settings for use on logon and other secure screens when the user's profile path contains non-ASCII characters. (#3092)

segment.source: NVDA no longer freezes when using Asian character input in some .NET applications. (#3005)
segment.target: NVDA no longer freezes when using Asian character input in some .NET applications. (#3005)

segment.source: it is now possible to use browse mode for pages in Internet Explorer 10 when in standards mode; e.g. [www.gmail.com](http://www.gmail.com) login page. (#3151)
segment.target: it is now possible to use browse mode for pages in Internet Explorer 10 when in standards mode; e.g. [www.gmail.com](http://www.gmail.com) login page. (#3151)

segment.source: Changes for Developers
segment.target: Promene za programere (engleski)

segment.source: Braille display drivers can now support manual port selection. (#426)
segment.target: Braille display drivers can now support manual port selection. (#426)

segment.source: This is most useful for braille displays which support connection via a legacy serial port.
segment.target: This is most useful for braille displays which support connection via a legacy serial port.

segment.source: This is done using the getPossiblePorts class method on the BrailleDisplayDriver class.
segment.target: This is done using the getPossiblePorts class method on the BrailleDisplayDriver class.

segment.source: Braille input from braille keyboards is now supported. (#808)
segment.target: Braille input from braille keyboards is now supported. (#808)

segment.source: Braille input is encompassed by the brailleInput.BrailleInputGesture class or a subclass thereof.
segment.target: Braille input is encompassed by the brailleInput.BrailleInputGesture class or a subclass thereof.

segment.source: Subclasses of braille.BrailleDisplayGesture (as implemented in braille display drivers) can also inherit from brailleInput.BrailleInputGesture. This allows display commands and braille input to be handled by the same gesture class.
segment.target: Subclasses of braille.BrailleDisplayGesture (as implemented in braille display drivers) can also inherit from brailleInput.BrailleInputGesture. This allows display commands and braille input to be handled by the same gesture class.

segment.source: You can now use comHelper.getActiveObject to get an active COM object from a normal process when NVDA is running with the UIAccess privilege. (#2483)
segment.target: You can now use comHelper.getActiveObject to get an active COM object from a normal process when NVDA is running with the UIAccess privilege. (#2483)

segment.source: Highlights of this release include support for Asian character input; experimental support for touch screens on Windows 8; reporting of page numbers and improved support for tables in Adobe Reader; table navigation commands in focused table rows and Windows list-view controls; support for several more braille displays; and reporting of row and column headers in Microsoft Excel.
segment.target: Highlights of this release include support for Asian character input; experimental support for touch screens on Windows 8; reporting of page numbers and improved support for tables in Adobe Reader; table navigation commands in focused table rows and Windows list-view controls; support for several more braille displays; and reporting of row and column headers in Microsoft Excel.

segment.source: New Features
segment.target: New Features

segment.source: NVDA can now support Asian character input using IME and text service input methods in all applications, Including:
segment.target: NVDA can now support Asian character input using IME and text service input methods in all applications, Including:

segment.source: Reporting and navigation of candidate lists;
segment.target: Reporting and navigation of candidate lists;

segment.source: Reporting and navigation of composition strings; and
segment.target: Reporting and navigation of composition strings; and

segment.source: Reporting of reading strings.
segment.target: Reporting of reading strings.

segment.source: The presence of underline and strikethrough is now reported in Adobe Reader documents. (#2410)
segment.target: The presence of underline and strikethrough is now reported in Adobe Reader documents. (#2410)

segment.source: When the Windows Sticky Keys function is enabled, the NVDA modifier key will now behave like other modifier keys. This allows you to use the NVDA modifier key without needing to hold it down while you press other keys. (#230)
segment.target: When the Windows Sticky Keys function is enabled, the NVDA modifier key will now behave like other modifier keys. This allows you to use the NVDA modifier key without needing to hold it down while you press other keys. (#230)

segment.source: Automatic reporting of column and row headers is now supported in Microsoft Excel. Press NVDA+shift+c to set the row containing column headers and NVDA+shift+r to set the column containing row headers. Press either command twice in quick succession to clear the setting. (#1519)
segment.target: Automatic reporting of column and row headers is now supported in Microsoft Excel. Press NVDA+shift+c to set the row containing column headers and NVDA+shift+r to set the column containing row headers. Press either command twice in quick succession to clear the setting. (#1519)

segment.source: Support for HIMS Braille Sense, Braille EDGE and SyncBraille braille displays. (#1266, #1267)
segment.target: Support for HIMS Braille Sense, Braille EDGE and SyncBraille braille displays. (#1266, #1267)

segment.source: When Windows 8 Toast notifications appear, NVDA will report them if reporting of help balloons is enabled. (#2143)
segment.target: When Windows 8 Toast notifications appear, NVDA will report them if reporting of help balloons is enabled. (#2143)

segment.source: Experimental support for Touch screens on Windows 8, including:
segment.target: Experimental support for Touch screens on Windows 8, including:

segment.source: Reading text directly under your finger while moving it around
segment.target: Reading text directly under your finger while moving it around

segment.source: Many gestures for performing object navigation, text review, and other NVDA commands.
segment.target: Many gestures for performing object navigation, text review, and other NVDA commands.

segment.source: Support for VIP Mud. (#1728)
segment.target: Support for VIP Mud. (#1728)

segment.source: In Adobe Reader, if a table has a summary, it is now presented. (#2465)
segment.target: In Adobe Reader, if a table has a summary, it is now presented. (#2465)

segment.source: In Adobe Reader, table row and column headers can now be reported. (#2193, #2527, #2528)
segment.target: In Adobe Reader, table row and column headers can now be reported. (#2193, #2527, #2528)

segment.source: New languages: Amharic, Korean, Nepali, Slovenian.
segment.target: New languages: Amharic, Korean, Nepali, Slovenian.

segment.source: NVDA can now read auto complete suggestions when entering email addresses in Microsoft Outlook 2007. (#689)
segment.target: NVDA can now read auto complete suggestions when entering email addresses in Microsoft Outlook 2007. (#689)

segment.source: New eSpeak voice variants: Gene, Gene2. (#2512)
segment.target: New eSpeak voice variants: Gene, Gene2. (#2512)

segment.source: In Adobe Reader, page numbers can now be reported. (#2534)
segment.target: In Adobe Reader, page numbers can now be reported. (#2534)

segment.source: In Reader XI, page labels are reported where present, reflecting changes to page numbering in different sections, etc. In earlier versions, this is not possible and only sequential page numbers are reported.
segment.target: In Reader XI, page labels are reported where present, reflecting changes to page numbering in different sections, etc. In earlier versions, this is not possible and only sequential page numbers are reported.

segment.source: It is now possible to reset NVDA's configuration to factory defaults either by pressing NVDA+control+r three times quickly or by choosing Reset to Factory Defaults from the NVDA menu. (#2086)
segment.target: It is now possible to reset NVDA's configuration to factory defaults either by pressing NVDA+control+r three times quickly or by choosing Reset to Factory Defaults from the NVDA menu. (#2086)

segment.source: Support for the Seika Version 3, 4 and 5 and Seika80 braille displays from Nippon Telesoft. (#2452)
segment.target: Support for the Seika Version 3, 4 and 5 and Seika80 braille displays from Nippon Telesoft. (#2452)

segment.source: The first and last top routing buttons on Freedom Scientific PAC Mate and Focus Braille displays can now be used to scroll backward and forward. (#2556)
segment.target: The first and last top routing buttons on Freedom Scientific PAC Mate and Focus Braille displays can now be used to scroll backward and forward. (#2556)

segment.source: Many more features are supported on Freedom Scientific Focus Braille displays such as advance bars, rocker bars and certain dot combinations for common actions. (#2516)
segment.target: Many more features are supported on Freedom Scientific Focus Braille displays such as advance bars, rocker bars and certain dot combinations for common actions. (#2516)

segment.source: In applications using IAccessible2 such as Mozilla applications, table row and column headers can now be reported outside of browse mode. (#926)
segment.target: In applications using IAccessible2 such as Mozilla applications, table row and column headers can now be reported outside of browse mode. (#926)

segment.source: Preliminary support for the document control in Microsoft Word 2013. (#2543)
segment.target: Preliminary support for the document control in Microsoft Word 2013. (#2543)

segment.source: Text alignment can now be reported in applications using IAccessible2 such as Mozilla applications. (#2612)
segment.target: Text alignment can now be reported in applications using IAccessible2 such as Mozilla applications. (#2612)

segment.source: When a table row or standard Windows list-view control with multiple columns is focused, you can now use the table navigation commands to access individual cells. (#828)
segment.target: When a table row or standard Windows list-view control with multiple columns is focused, you can now use the table navigation commands to access individual cells. (#828)

segment.source: New braille translation tables: Estonian grade 0, Portuguese 8 dot computer braille, Italian 6 dot computer braille. (#2319, #2662)
segment.target: New braille translation tables: Estonian grade 0, Portuguese 8 dot computer braille, Italian 6 dot computer braille. (#2319, #2662)

segment.source: If NVDA is installed on the system, directly opening an NVDA add-on package (e.g. from Windows Explorer or after downloading in a web browser) will install it into NVDA. (#2306)
segment.target: If NVDA is installed on the system, directly opening an NVDA add-on package (e.g. from Windows Explorer or after downloading in a web browser) will install it into NVDA. (#2306)

segment.source: Support for newer models of Papenmeier BRAILLEX braille displays. (#1265)
segment.target: Support for newer models of Papenmeier BRAILLEX braille displays. (#1265)

segment.source: Position information (e.g. 1 of 4) is now reported for Windows Explorer list items on Windows 7 and above. This also includes any UIAutomation controls that support the itemIndex and itemCount custom properties. (#2643)
segment.target: Position information (e.g. 1 of 4) is now reported for Windows Explorer list items on Windows 7 and above. This also includes any UIAutomation controls that support the itemIndex and itemCount custom properties. (#2643)

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: In the NVDA Review Cursor preferences dialog, the Follow keyboard focus option has been renamed to Follow system focus for consistency with terminology used elsewhere in NVDA.
segment.target: In the NVDA Review Cursor preferences dialog, the Follow keyboard focus option has been renamed to Follow system focus for consistency with terminology used elsewhere in NVDA.

segment.source: When braille is tethered to review and the cursor is on an object which is not a text object (e.g. an editable text field), cursor routing keys will now activate the object. (#2386)
segment.target: When braille is tethered to review and the cursor is on an object which is not a text object (e.g. an editable text field), cursor routing keys will now activate the object. (#2386)

segment.source: The Save Settings On Exit option is now on by default for new configurations.
segment.target: The Save Settings On Exit option is now on by default for new configurations.

segment.source: When updating a previously installed copy of NVDA, the desktop shortcut key is no longer forced back to control+alt+n if it was manually changed to something different by the user. (#2572)
segment.target: When updating a previously installed copy of NVDA, the desktop shortcut key is no longer forced back to control+alt+n if it was manually changed to something different by the user. (#2572)

segment.source: The add-ons list in the Add-ons Manager now shows the package name before its status. (#2548)
segment.target: The add-ons list in the Add-ons Manager now shows the package name before its status. (#2548)

segment.source: If installing the same or another version of a currently installed add-on, NVDA will ask if you wish to update the add-on, rather than just showing an error and aborting installation. (#2501)
segment.target: If installing the same or another version of a currently installed add-on, NVDA will ask if you wish to update the add-on, rather than just showing an error and aborting installation. (#2501)

segment.source: Object navigation commands (except the report current object command) now report with less verbosity. You can still obtain the extra information by using the report current object command. (#2560)
segment.target: Object navigation commands (except the report current object command) now report with less verbosity. You can still obtain the extra information by using the report current object command. (#2560)

segment.source: Updated liblouis braille translator to 2.5.1. (#2319, #2480, #2662, #2672)
segment.target: Updated liblouis braille translator to 2.5.1. (#2319, #2480, #2662, #2672)

segment.source: The NVDA Key Commands Quick Reference document has been renamed to Commands Quick Reference, as it now includes touch commands as well as keyboard commands.
segment.target: The NVDA Key Commands Quick Reference document has been renamed to Commands Quick Reference, as it now includes touch commands as well as keyboard commands.

segment.source: The Elements list in Browse mode will now remember the last element type shown (e.g. links, headings or landmarks) each time the dialog is shown within the same session of NVDA. (#365)
segment.target: The Elements list in Browse mode will now remember the last element type shown (e.g. links, headings or landmarks) each time the dialog is shown within the same session of NVDA. (#365)

segment.source: Most Metro apps in Windows 8 (e.g. Mail, Calendar) no longer activate Browse Mode for the entire app.
segment.target: Most Metro apps in Windows 8 (e.g. Mail, Calendar) no longer activate Browse Mode for the entire app.

segment.source: Updated Handy Tech BrailleDriver COM-Server to 1.4.2.0.
segment.target: Updated Handy Tech BrailleDriver COM-Server to 1.4.2.0.

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: In Windows Vista and later, NVDA no longer incorrectly treats the Windows key as being held down when unlocking Windows after locking it by pressing Windows+l. (#1856)
segment.target: In Windows Vista and later, NVDA no longer incorrectly treats the Windows key as being held down when unlocking Windows after locking it by pressing Windows+l. (#1856)

segment.source: In Adobe Reader, row headers are now correctly recognised as table cells; i.e. coordinates are reported and they can be accessed using table navigation commands. (#2444)
segment.target: In Adobe Reader, row headers are now correctly recognised as table cells; i.e. coordinates are reported and they can be accessed using table navigation commands. (#2444)

segment.source: In Adobe Reader, table cells spanning more than one column and/or row are now handled correctly. (#2437, #2438, #2450)
segment.target: In Adobe Reader, table cells spanning more than one column and/or row are now handled correctly. (#2437, #2438, #2450)

segment.source: The NVDA distribution package now checks its integrity before executing. (#2475)
segment.target: The NVDA distribution package now checks its integrity before executing. (#2475)

segment.source: Temporary download files are now removed if downloading of an NVDA update fails. (#2477)
segment.target: Temporary download files are now removed if downloading of an NVDA update fails. (#2477)

segment.source: NVDA will no longer freeze when it is running as an administrator while copying the user configuration to the system configuration (for use on Windows logon and other secure screens). (#2485)
segment.target: NVDA will no longer freeze when it is running as an administrator while copying the user configuration to the system configuration (for use on Windows logon and other secure screens). (#2485)

segment.source: Tiles on the Windows 8 Start Screen are now presented better in speech and braille. The name is no longer repeated, unselected is no longer reported on all tiles, and live status information is presented as the description of the tile (e.g. current temperature for the Weather tile).
segment.target: Tiles on the Windows 8 Start Screen are now presented better in speech and braille. The name is no longer repeated, unselected is no longer reported on all tiles, and live status information is presented as the description of the tile (e.g. current temperature for the Weather tile).

segment.source: Passwords are no longer announced when reading password fields in Microsoft Outlook and other standard edit controls that are marked as protected. (#2021)
segment.target: Passwords are no longer announced when reading password fields in Microsoft Outlook and other standard edit controls that are marked as protected. (#2021)

segment.source: In Adobe Reader, changes to form fields are now correctly reflected in browse mode. (#2529)
segment.target: In Adobe Reader, changes to form fields are now correctly reflected in browse mode. (#2529)

segment.source: Improvements to support for the Microsoft Word Spell Checker, including more accurate reading of the current spelling error, and the ability to support the spell checker when running an Installed copy of NVDA on Windows Vista or higher.
segment.target: Improvements to support for the Microsoft Word Spell Checker, including more accurate reading of the current spelling error, and the ability to support the spell checker when running an Installed copy of NVDA on Windows Vista or higher.

segment.source: Add-ons which include files containing non-English characters can now be installed correctly in most cases. (#2505)
segment.target: Add-ons which include files containing non-English characters can now be installed correctly in most cases. (#2505)

segment.source: In Adobe Reader, the language of text is no longer lost when it is updated or scrolled to. (#2544)
segment.target: In Adobe Reader, the language of text is no longer lost when it is updated or scrolled to. (#2544)

segment.source: When installing an add-on, the confirmation dialog now correctly shows the localized name of the add-on if available. (#2422)
segment.target: When installing an add-on, the confirmation dialog now correctly shows the localized name of the add-on if available. (#2422)

segment.source: In applications using UI Automation (such as .net and Silverlight applications), the calculation of numeric values for controls such as sliders has been corrected. (#2417)
segment.target: In applications using UI Automation (such as .net and Silverlight applications), the calculation of numeric values for controls such as sliders has been corrected. (#2417)

segment.source: The configuration for reporting of progress bars is now honoured for the indeterminate progress bars displayed by NVDA when installing, creating a portable copy, etc. (#2574)
segment.target: The configuration for reporting of progress bars is now honoured for the indeterminate progress bars displayed by NVDA when installing, creating a portable copy, etc. (#2574)

segment.source: NVDA commands can no longer be executed from a braille display while a secure Windows screen (such as the Lock screen) is active. (#2449)
segment.target: NVDA commands can no longer be executed from a braille display while a secure Windows screen (such as the Lock screen) is active. (#2449)

segment.source: In browse mode, braille is now updated if the text being displayed changes. (#2074)
segment.target: In browse mode, braille is now updated if the text being displayed changes. (#2074)

segment.source: When on a secure Windows screen such as the Lock screen, messages from applications speaking or displaying braille directly via NVDA are now ignored.
segment.target: When on a secure Windows screen such as the Lock screen, messages from applications speaking or displaying braille directly via NVDA are now ignored.

segment.source: In Browse mode, it is no longer possible to fall off the bottom of the document with the right arrow key when on the final character, or by jumping to the end of a container when that container is the last item in the document. (#2463)
segment.target: In Browse mode, it is no longer possible to fall off the bottom of the document with the right arrow key when on the final character, or by jumping to the end of a container when that container is the last item in the document. (#2463)

segment.source: Extraneous content is no longer incorrectly included when reporting the text of dialogs in web applications (specifically, ARIA dialogs with no aria-describedby attribute). (#2390)
segment.target: Extraneous content is no longer incorrectly included when reporting the text of dialogs in web applications (specifically, ARIA dialogs with no aria-describedby attribute). (#2390)

segment.source: NVDA no longer incorrectly reports or locates certain edit fields in MSHTML documents (e.g. Internet Explorer), specifically where an explicit ARIA role has been used by the web page author. (#2435)
segment.target: NVDA no longer incorrectly reports or locates certain edit fields in MSHTML documents (e.g. Internet Explorer), specifically where an explicit ARIA role has been used by the web page author. (#2435)

segment.source: The backspace key is now handled correctly when speaking typed words in Windows command consoles. (#2586)
segment.target: The backspace key is now handled correctly when speaking typed words in Windows command consoles. (#2586)

segment.source: Cell coordinates in Microsoft Excel are now shown again in Braille.
segment.target: Cell coordinates in Microsoft Excel are now shown again in Braille.

segment.source: In Microsoft Word, NVDA no longer leaves you stuck on a paragraph with list formatting when trying to navigate out over a bullet or number with left arrow or control + left arrow. (#2402)
segment.target: In Microsoft Word, NVDA no longer leaves you stuck on a paragraph with list formatting when trying to navigate out over a bullet or number with left arrow or control + left arrow. (#2402)

segment.source: In browse mode in Mozilla applications, the items in certain list boxes (specifically, ARIA list boxes) are no longer incorrectly rendered.
segment.target: In browse mode in Mozilla applications, the items in certain list boxes (specifically, ARIA list boxes) are no longer incorrectly rendered.

segment.source: In browse mode in Mozilla applications, certain controls that were rendered with an incorrect label or just whitespace are now rendered with the correct label.
segment.target: In browse mode in Mozilla applications, certain controls that were rendered with an incorrect label or just whitespace are now rendered with the correct label.

segment.source: In browse mode in Mozilla applications, some extraneous whitespace has been eliminated.
segment.target: In browse mode in Mozilla applications, some extraneous whitespace has been eliminated.

segment.source: In browse mode in web browsers, certain graphics that are explicitly marked as presentational (specifically, with an alt="" attribute) are now correctly ignored.
segment.target: In browse mode in web browsers, certain graphics that are explicitly marked as presentational (specifically, with an alt="" attribute) are now correctly ignored.

segment.source: In web browsers, NVDA now hides content which is marked as hidden from screen readers (specifically, using the aria-hidden attribute). (#2117)
segment.target: In web browsers, NVDA now hides content which is marked as hidden from screen readers (specifically, using the aria-hidden attribute). (#2117)

segment.source: Negative currency amounts (e.g. -$123) are now correctly spoken as negative, regardless of symbol level. (#2625)
segment.target: Negative currency amounts (e.g. -$123) are now correctly spoken as negative, regardless of symbol level. (#2625)

segment.source: During say all, NVDA will no longer incorrectly revert to the default language where a line does not end a sentence. (#2630)
segment.target: During say all, NVDA will no longer incorrectly revert to the default language where a line does not end a sentence. (#2630)

segment.source: Font information is now correctly detected in Adobe Reader 10.1 and later. (#2175)
segment.target: Font information is now correctly detected in Adobe Reader 10.1 and later. (#2175)

segment.source: In Adobe Reader, if alternate text is provided, only that text will be rendered. Previously, extraneous text was sometimes included. (#2174)
segment.target: In Adobe Reader, if alternate text is provided, only that text will be rendered. Previously, extraneous text was sometimes included. (#2174)

segment.source: Where a document contains an application, the content of the application is no longer included in browse mode. This prevents unexpectedly moving inside the application when navigating. You can interact with the application in the same way as for embedded objects. (#990)
segment.target: Where a document contains an application, the content of the application is no longer included in browse mode. This prevents unexpectedly moving inside the application when navigating. You can interact with the application in the same way as for embedded objects. (#990)

segment.source: In Mozilla applications, the value of spin buttons is now correctly reported when it changes. (#2653)
segment.target: In Mozilla applications, the value of spin buttons is now correctly reported when it changes. (#2653)

segment.source: Updated support for Adobe Digital Editions so that it works in version 2.0. (#2688)
segment.target: Updated support for Adobe Digital Editions so that it works in version 2.0. (#2688)

segment.source: Pressing NVDA+upArrow while on a combo box in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML documents will no longer incorrectly read all items. Rather, just the active item will be read. (#2337)
segment.target: Pressing NVDA+upArrow while on a combo box in Internet Explorer and other MSHTML documents will no longer incorrectly read all items. Rather, just the active item will be read. (#2337)

segment.source: Speech dictionaries will now properly save when using a number (#) sign within the pattern or replacement fields. (#961)
segment.target: Speech dictionaries will now properly save when using a number (#) sign within the pattern or replacement fields. (#961)

segment.source: Browse mode for MSHTML documents (e.g. Internet Explorer) now correctly displays visible content contained within hidden content (specifically, elements with a style of visibility:visible inside an element with style visibility:hidden). (#2097)
segment.target: Browse mode for MSHTML documents (e.g. Internet Explorer) now correctly displays visible content contained within hidden content (specifically, elements with a style of visibility:visible inside an element with style visibility:hidden). (#2097)

segment.source: Links in Windows XP's Security Center no longer report random junk after their names. (#1331)
segment.target: Links in Windows XP's Security Center no longer report random junk after their names. (#1331)

segment.source: UI Automation text controls (e.g. the search field in the Windows 7 Start Menu) are now correctly announced when moving the mouse over them rather than staying silent.
segment.target: UI Automation text controls (e.g. the search field in the Windows 7 Start Menu) are now correctly announced when moving the mouse over them rather than staying silent.

segment.source: Keyboard layout changes are no longer reported during say all, which was particularly problematic for multilingual documents including Arabic text. (#1676)
segment.target: Keyboard layout changes are no longer reported during say all, which was particularly problematic for multilingual documents including Arabic text. (#1676)

segment.source: The entire content of some UI Automation editable text controls (e.g. the Search Box in the Windows 7/8 Start Menu) is no longer announced every time it changes.
segment.target: The entire content of some UI Automation editable text controls (e.g. the Search Box in the Windows 7/8 Start Menu) is no longer announced every time it changes.

segment.source: When moving between groups on the Windows 8 start screen, unlabeled groups no longer announce their first tile as the name of the group. (#2658)
segment.target: When moving between groups on the Windows 8 start screen, unlabeled groups no longer announce their first tile as the name of the group. (#2658)

segment.source: When opening the Windows 8 start screen, the focus is correctly placed on the first tile, rather than jumping to the root of the start screen which can confuse navigation. (#2720)
segment.target: When opening the Windows 8 start screen, the focus is correctly placed on the first tile, rather than jumping to the root of the start screen which can confuse navigation. (#2720)

segment.source: NVDA will no longer fail to start when the user's profile path contains certain multibyte characters. (#2729)
segment.target: NVDA will no longer fail to start when the user's profile path contains certain multibyte characters. (#2729)

segment.source: In browse mode in Google Chrome, the text of tabs is now rendered correctly.
segment.target: In browse mode in Google Chrome, the text of tabs is now rendered correctly.

segment.source: In browse mode, menu buttons are now reported correctly.
segment.target: In browse mode, menu buttons are now reported correctly.

segment.source: In OpenOffice.org/LibreOffice Calc, reading spreadsheet cells now works correctly. (#2765)
segment.target: In OpenOffice.org/LibreOffice Calc, reading spreadsheet cells now works correctly. (#2765)

segment.source: NVDA can again function in the Yahoo! Mail message list when used from Internet Explorer. (#2780)
segment.target: NVDA can again function in the Yahoo! Mail message list when used from Internet Explorer. (#2780)

segment.source: Changes for Developers
segment.target: Promene za programere (engleski)

segment.source: Previous log file is now copied to nvda-old.log on NVDA initialization. Therefore, if NVDA crashes or is restarted, logging information from that session is still accessible for inspection. (#916)
segment.target: Previous log file is now copied to nvda-old.log on NVDA initialization. Therefore, if NVDA crashes or is restarted, logging information from that session is still accessible for inspection. (#916)

segment.source: Fetching the role property in chooseNVDAObjectOverlayClasses no longer causes the role to be incorrect and thus not reported on focus for certain objects such as Windows command consoles and Scintilla controls. (#2569)
segment.target: Fetching the role property in chooseNVDAObjectOverlayClasses no longer causes the role to be incorrect and thus not reported on focus for certain objects such as Windows command consoles and Scintilla controls. (#2569)

segment.source: The NVDA Preferences, Tools and Help menus are now accessible as attributes on gui.mainFrame.sysTrayIcon named preferencesMenu, toolsMenu and helpMenu, respectively. This allows plugins to more easily add items to these menus.
segment.target: The NVDA Preferences, Tools and Help menus are now accessible as attributes on gui.mainFrame.sysTrayIcon named preferencesMenu, toolsMenu and helpMenu, respectively. This allows plugins to more easily add items to these menus.

segment.source: The navigatorObject_doDefaultAction script in globalCommands has been renamed to review_activate.
segment.target: The navigatorObject_doDefaultAction script in globalCommands has been renamed to review_activate.

segment.source: Gettext message contexts are now supported. This allows multiple translations to be defined for a single English message depending on the context. (#1524)
segment.target: Gettext message contexts are now supported. This allows multiple translations to be defined for a single English message depending on the context. (#1524)

segment.source: This is done using the pgettext(context, message) function.
segment.target: This is done using the pgettext(context, message) function.

segment.source: This is supported for both NVDA itself and add-ons.
segment.target: This is supported for both NVDA itself and add-ons.

segment.source: xgettext and msgfmt from GNU gettext must be used to create any PO and MO files. The Python tools do not support message contexts.
segment.target: xgettext and msgfmt from GNU gettext must be used to create any PO and MO files. The Python tools do not support message contexts.

segment.source: For xgettext, pass the --keyword=pgettext:1c,2 command line argument to enable inclusion of message contexts.
segment.target: For xgettext, pass the --keyword=pgettext:1c,2 command line argument to enable inclusion of message contexts.

segment.source: See http://www.gnu.org/software/gettext/manual/html_node/Contexts.html#Contexts for more information.
segment.target: See http://www.gnu.org/software/gettext/manual/html_node/Contexts.html#Contexts for more information.

segment.source: It is now possible to access built-in NVDA modules where they have been overridden by third party modules. See the nvdaBuiltin module for details.
segment.target: It is now possible to access built-in NVDA modules where they have been overridden by third party modules. See the nvdaBuiltin module for details.

segment.source: Add-on translation support can now be used within the add-on installTasks module. (#2715)
segment.target: Add-on translation support can now be used within the add-on installTasks module. (#2715)

segment.source: This release addresses several potential security issues (by upgrading Python to 2.7.3).
segment.target: This release addresses several potential security issues (by upgrading Python to 2.7.3).

segment.source: Highlights of this release include an in-built installer and portable creation feature, automatic updates, easy management of new NVDA add-ons, announcement of graphics in Microsoft Word, support for Windows 8 Metro style apps, and several important bug fixes.
segment.target: Highlights of this release include an in-built installer and portable creation feature, automatic updates, easy management of new NVDA add-ons, announcement of graphics in Microsoft Word, support for Windows 8 Metro style apps, and several important bug fixes.

segment.source: New Features
segment.target: New Features

segment.source: NVDA can now automatically check for, download and install updates. (#73)
segment.target: NVDA can now automatically check for, download and install updates. (#73)

segment.source: Extending NVDA's functionality has been made easier with the addition of an Add-ons Manager (found under Tools in the NVDA menu) allowing you to install and uninstall new NVDA add-on packages (.nvda-addon files) containing plugins and drivers. Note the Add-on manager does not show older custom plugins and drivers manually copied in to your configuration directory. (#213)
segment.target: Extending NVDA's functionality has been made easier with the addition of an Add-ons Manager (found under Tools in the NVDA menu) allowing you to install and uninstall new NVDA add-on packages (.nvda-addon files) containing plugins and drivers. Note the Add-on manager does not show older custom plugins and drivers manually copied in to your configuration directory. (#213)

segment.source: Many more common NVDA features now work in Windows 8 Metro style apps when using an installed release of NVDA, including speaking of typed characters, and browse mode for web documents (includes support for metro version of Internet Explorer 10). Portable copies of NVDA cannot access metro style apps. (#1801)
segment.target: Many more common NVDA features now work in Windows 8 Metro style apps when using an installed release of NVDA, including speaking of typed characters, and browse mode for web documents (includes support for metro version of Internet Explorer 10). Portable copies of NVDA cannot access metro style apps. (#1801)

segment.source: In browse mode documents (Internet Explorer, Firefox, etc.), you can now jump to the start and past the end of certain containing elements (such as lists and tables) with shift+, and , respectively. (#123)
segment.target: In browse mode documents (Internet Explorer, Firefox, etc.), you can now jump to the start and past the end of certain containing elements (such as lists and tables) with shift+, and , respectively. (#123)

segment.source: New language: Greek.
segment.target: New language: Greek.

segment.source: Graphics and alt text are now reported in Microsoft Word Documents. (#2282, #1541)
segment.target: Graphics and alt text are now reported in Microsoft Word Documents. (#2282, #1541)

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: Announcement of cell coordinates in Microsoft Excel is now after the content rather than before, and is now only included if the report tables and report table cell coordinates settings are enabled in the Document formatting settings dialog. (#320)
segment.target: Announcement of cell coordinates in Microsoft Excel is now after the content rather than before, and is now only included if the report tables and report table cell coordinates settings are enabled in the Document formatting settings dialog. (#320)

segment.source: NVDA is now distributed in one package. Rather than separate portable and installer versions, there is now just one file that, when run, will start a temporary copy of NVDA and will allow you to install or generate a portable distribution. (#1715)
segment.target: NVDA is now distributed in one package. Rather than separate portable and installer versions, there is now just one file that, when run, will start a temporary copy of NVDA and will allow you to install or generate a portable distribution. (#1715)

segment.source: NVDA is now always installed in to Program Files on all systems. Updating a previous install will also automatically move it if it was not previously installed there.
segment.target: NVDA is now always installed in to Program Files on all systems. Updating a previous install will also automatically move it if it was not previously installed there.

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: With auto language switching enabled, Content such as alt text for graphics and labels for other certain controls in Mozilla Gecko (e.g. Firefox) are now reported in the correct language if marked up appropriately.
