segment.target: Portable versions of NVDA now look in the 'userConfig' directory inside the NVDA directory, for the user's configuration. Like for the installer version, this keeps the user's configuration separate from NVDA itself.

segment.source: Custom app modules, braille display drivers and synth drivers can now be stored in the user's configuration directory. (#337)
segment.target: Custom app modules, braille display drivers and synth drivers can now be stored in the user's configuration directory. (#337)

segment.source: Virtual buffers are now rendered in the background, allowing the user to interact with the system to some extent during the rendering process. The user will be notified that the document is being rendered if it takes longer than a second.
segment.target: Virtual buffers are now rendered in the background, allowing the user to interact with the system to some extent during the rendering process. The user will be notified that the document is being rendered if it takes longer than a second.

segment.source: If NVDA detects that it has frozen for some reason, it will automatically pass all keystrokes through so that the user has a better chance of recovering the system.
segment.target: If NVDA detects that it has frozen for some reason, it will automatically pass all keystrokes through so that the user has a better chance of recovering the system.

segment.source: Support for ARIA drag and drop in Mozilla Gecko. (#239)
segment.target: Support for ARIA drag and drop in Mozilla Gecko. (#239)

segment.source: The document title and current line or selection is now spoken when you move focus inside a virtual buffer. This makes the behaviour when moving focus into virtual buffers consistent with that for normal document objects. (#210)
segment.target: The document title and current line or selection is now spoken when you move focus inside a virtual buffer. This makes the behaviour when moving focus into virtual buffers consistent with that for normal document objects. (#210)

segment.source: In virtual buffers, you can now interact with embedded objects (such as Adobe Flash and Sun Java content) by pressing enter on the object. If it is accessible, you can then tab around it like any other application. To return focus to the document, press NVDA+space. (#431)
segment.target: In virtual buffers, you can now interact with embedded objects (such as Adobe Flash and Sun Java content) by pressing enter on the object. If it is accessible, you can then tab around it like any other application. To return focus to the document, press NVDA+space. (#431)

segment.source: In virtual buffers, o and shift+o move to the next and previous embedded object, respectively.
segment.target: In virtual buffers, o and shift+o move to the next and previous embedded object, respectively.

segment.source: NVDA can now fully access applications running as administrator in Windows Vista and later. You must install an official release of NVDA for this to work. This does not work for portable versions and snapshots. (#397)
segment.target: NVDA can now fully access applications running as administrator in Windows Vista and later. You must install an official release of NVDA for this to work. This does not work for portable versions and snapshots. (#397)

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: NVDA no longer announces "NVDA started" when it starts.
segment.target: NVDA no longer announces "NVDA started" when it starts.

segment.source: The startup and exit sounds are now played using NVDA's configured audio output device instead of the Windows default audio output device. (#164)
segment.target: The startup and exit sounds are now played using NVDA's configured audio output device instead of the Windows default audio output device. (#164)

segment.source: Progress bar reporting has been improved. Most notably you can now configure NVDA to announce via both speech and beeps at the same time.
segment.target: Progress bar reporting has been improved. Most notably you can now configure NVDA to announce via both speech and beeps at the same time.

segment.source: Some generic roles, such as pane, application and frame, are no longer reported on focus unless the control is unnamed.
segment.target: Some generic roles, such as pane, application and frame, are no longer reported on focus unless the control is unnamed.

segment.source: The review copy command (NVDA+f10) copies the text from the start marker up to and including the current review position, rather than excluding the current position. This allows the last character of a line to be copied, which was not previously possible. (#430)
segment.target: The review copy command (NVDA+f10) copies the text from the start marker up to and including the current review position, rather than excluding the current position. This allows the last character of a line to be copied, which was not previously possible. (#430)

segment.source: the navigatorObject_where script (ctrl+NVDA+numpad5) has been removed. This key combination did not work on some keyboards, nore was the script found to be that useful.
segment.target: the navigatorObject_where script (ctrl+NVDA+numpad5) has been removed. This key combination did not work on some keyboards, nore was the script found to be that useful.

segment.source: the navigatorObject_currentDimentions script has been remapped to NVDA+numpadDelete. The old key combination did not work on some keyboards. This script also now reports the width and height of the object instead of the right/bottom coordinates.
segment.target: the navigatorObject_currentDimentions script has been remapped to NVDA+numpadDelete. The old key combination did not work on some keyboards. This script also now reports the width and height of the object instead of the right/bottom coordinates.

segment.source: Improved performance (especially on netbooks) when many beeps occur in quick succession; e.g. fast mouse movement with audio coordinates enabled. (#396)
segment.target: Improved performance (especially on netbooks) when many beeps occur in quick succession; e.g. fast mouse movement with audio coordinates enabled. (#396)

segment.source: The NVDA error sound is no longer played in release candidates and final releases. Note that errors are still logged.
segment.target: The NVDA error sound is no longer played in release candidates and final releases. Note that errors are still logged.

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: When NVDA is run from an 8.3 dos path, but it is installed in the related long path (e.g. progra~1 verses program files) NVDA will correctly identify that it is an installed copy and properly load the user's settings.
segment.target: When NVDA is run from an 8.3 dos path, but it is installed in the related long path (e.g. progra~1 verses program files) NVDA will correctly identify that it is an installed copy and properly load the user's settings.

segment.source: speaking the title of the current foreground window with nvda+t now works correctly when in menus.
segment.target: speaking the title of the current foreground window with nvda+t now works correctly when in menus.

segment.source: braille no longer shows useless information in its focus context such as unlabeled panes.
segment.target: braille no longer shows useless information in its focus context such as unlabeled panes.

segment.source: stop announcing some useless information when the focus changes such as root panes, layered panes and scroll panes in Java or Lotus applications.
segment.target: stop announcing some useless information when the focus changes such as root panes, layered panes and scroll panes in Java or Lotus applications.

segment.source: Make the keyword search field in Windows Help (CHM) viewer much more usable. Due to buggyness in that control, the current keyword could not be read as it would be continually changing.
segment.target: Make the keyword search field in Windows Help (CHM) viewer much more usable. Due to buggyness in that control, the current keyword could not be read as it would be continually changing.

segment.source: report correct page numbers in Microsoft Word if the page numbering has been specifically offset in the document.
segment.target: report correct page numbers in Microsoft Word if the page numbering has been specifically offset in the document.

segment.source: Better support for edit fields found in Microsoft Word dialogs (e.g. the Font dialog). It is now possible to navigate these controls with the arrow keys.
segment.target: Better support for edit fields found in Microsoft Word dialogs (e.g. the Font dialog). It is now possible to navigate these controls with the arrow keys.

segment.source: better support for Dos consoles. specifically: NVDA can now read the content of particular consoles it always used to think were blank. Pressing control+break no longer terminates NVDA.
segment.target: better support for Dos consoles. specifically: NVDA can now read the content of particular consoles it always used to think were blank. Pressing control+break no longer terminates NVDA.

segment.source: On Windows Vista and above, the NVDA installer now starts NVDA with normal user privileges when requested to run NVDA on the finish screen.
segment.target: On Windows Vista and above, the NVDA installer now starts NVDA with normal user privileges when requested to run NVDA on the finish screen.

segment.source: Backspace is now handled correctly when speaking typed words. (#306)
segment.target: Backspace is now handled correctly when speaking typed words. (#306)

segment.source: Don't incorrectly report "Start menu" for certain context menus in Windows Explorer/the Windows shell. (#257)
segment.target: Don't incorrectly report "Start menu" for certain context menus in Windows Explorer/the Windows shell. (#257)

segment.source: NVDA now correctly handles ARIA labels in Mozilla Gecko when there is no other useful content. (#156)
segment.target: NVDA now correctly handles ARIA labels in Mozilla Gecko when there is no other useful content. (#156)

segment.source: NVDA no longer incorrectly enables focus mode automatically for editable text fields which update their value when the focus changes; e.g. http://tigerdirect.com/. (#220)
segment.target: NVDA no longer incorrectly enables focus mode automatically for editable text fields which update their value when the focus changes; e.g. http://tigerdirect.com/. (#220)

segment.source: NVDA will now attempt to recover from some situations which would previously cause it to freeze completely. It may take up to 10 seconds for NVDA to detect and recover from such a freeze.
segment.target: NVDA will now attempt to recover from some situations which would previously cause it to freeze completely. It may take up to 10 seconds for NVDA to detect and recover from such a freeze.

segment.source: When the NVDA language is set to "User default", use the user's Windows display language setting instead of the Windows locale setting. (#353)
segment.target: When the NVDA language is set to "User default", use the user's Windows display language setting instead of the Windows locale setting. (#353)

segment.source: NVDA now recognises the existence of controls in AIM 7.
segment.target: NVDA now recognises the existence of controls in AIM 7.

segment.source: The pass key through command no longer gets stuck if a key is held down. Previously, NVDA stopped accepting commands if this occurred and had to be restarted. (#413)
segment.target: The pass key through command no longer gets stuck if a key is held down. Previously, NVDA stopped accepting commands if this occurred and had to be restarted. (#413)

segment.source: The taskbar is no longer ignored when it receives focus, which often occurs when exiting an application. Previously, NVDA behaved as if the focus had not changed at all.
segment.target: The taskbar is no longer ignored when it receives focus, which often occurs when exiting an application. Previously, NVDA behaved as if the focus had not changed at all.

segment.source: When reading text fields in applications which use the Java Access Bridge (including OpenOffice.org), NVDA now functions correctly when reporting of line numbers is enabled.
segment.target: When reading text fields in applications which use the Java Access Bridge (including OpenOffice.org), NVDA now functions correctly when reporting of line numbers is enabled.

segment.source: The review copy command (NVDA+f10) gracefully handles the case where it is used on a position before the start marker. Previously, this could cause problems such as crashes in Notepad++.
segment.target: The review copy command (NVDA+f10) gracefully handles the case where it is used on a position before the start marker. Previously, this could cause problems such as crashes in Notepad++.

segment.source: A certain control character (0x1) no longer causes strange eSpeak behaviour (such as changes in volume and pitch) when it is encountered in text. (#437)
segment.target: A certain control character (0x1) no longer causes strange eSpeak behaviour (such as changes in volume and pitch) when it is encountered in text. (#437)

segment.source: The report text selection command (NVDA+shift+upArrow) now gracefully reports that there is no selection in objects which do not support text selection.
segment.target: The report text selection command (NVDA+shift+upArrow) now gracefully reports that there is no selection in objects which do not support text selection.

segment.source: Fixed the issue where pressing the enter key on certain Miranda-IM buttons or links was causing NVDA to freeze. (#440)
segment.target: Fixed the issue where pressing the enter key on certain Miranda-IM buttons or links was causing NVDA to freeze. (#440)

segment.source: The current line or selection is now properly respected when spelling or copying the current navigator object.
segment.target: The current line or selection is now properly respected when spelling or copying the current navigator object.

segment.source: Worked around a Windows bug which was causing garbage to be spoken after the name of link controls in Windows Explorer and Internet Explorer dialogs. (#451)
segment.target: Worked around a Windows bug which was causing garbage to be spoken after the name of link controls in Windows Explorer and Internet Explorer dialogs. (#451)

segment.source: Fixed a problem with the report date and time command (NVDA+f12). Previously, date reporting was truncated on some systems. (#471)
segment.target: Fixed a problem with the report date and time command (NVDA+f12). Previously, date reporting was truncated on some systems. (#471)

segment.source: Fixed the issue where the system screen reader flag was sometimes inappropriately cleared after interacting with secure Windows screens. This could cause problems in applications which check the screen reader flag, including Skype, Adobe Reader and Jart. (#462)
segment.target: Fixed the issue where the system screen reader flag was sometimes inappropriately cleared after interacting with secure Windows screens. This could cause problems in applications which check the screen reader flag, including Skype, Adobe Reader and Jart. (#462)

segment.source: In an Internet Explorer 6 combo box, the active item is now reported when it is changed. (#342)
segment.target: In an Internet Explorer 6 combo box, the active item is now reported when it is changed. (#342)

segment.source: New Features
segment.target: New Features

segment.source: As Microsoft Excel's formula bar is inaccessible to NVDA, provide an NVDA specific dialog box for editing when the user presses f2 on a cell.
segment.target: As Microsoft Excel's formula bar is inaccessible to NVDA, provide an NVDA specific dialog box for editing when the user presses f2 on a cell.

segment.source: Support for formatting in IAccessible2 text controls, including Mozilla applications.
segment.target: Support for formatting in IAccessible2 text controls, including Mozilla applications.

segment.source: Spelling errors can now be reported where possible. This is configurable from the Document Formatting preferences dialog.
segment.target: Spelling errors can now be reported where possible. This is configurable from the Document Formatting preferences dialog.

segment.source: NVDA can be configured to beep for either all or only visible progress bars. Alternatively, it can be configured to speak progress bar values every 10%.
segment.target: NVDA can be configured to beep for either all or only visible progress bars. Alternatively, it can be configured to speak progress bar values every 10%.

segment.source: Links can now be identified in richedit controls.
segment.target: Links can now be identified in richedit controls.

segment.source: The mouse can now be moved to the character under the review cursor in most editable text controls. Previously, the mouse could only be moved to the center of the control.
segment.target: The mouse can now be moved to the character under the review cursor in most editable text controls. Previously, the mouse could only be moved to the center of the control.

segment.source: In virtual buffers, the review cursor now reviews the text of the buffer, rather than just the internal text of the navigator object (which is often not useful to the user). This means that you can navigate the virtual buffer hierarchically using object navigation and the review cursor will move to that point in the buffer.
segment.target: In virtual buffers, the review cursor now reviews the text of the buffer, rather than just the internal text of the navigator object (which is often not useful to the user). This means that you can navigate the virtual buffer hierarchically using object navigation and the review cursor will move to that point in the buffer.

segment.source: Handle some additional states on Java controls.
segment.target: Handle some additional states on Java controls.

segment.source: If the title command (NVDA+t) is pressed twice, it spells the title. If pressed thrice, it is copied to the clipboard.
segment.target: If the title command (NVDA+t) is pressed twice, it spells the title. If pressed thrice, it is copied to the clipboard.

segment.source: Keyboard help now reads the names of modifier keys when pressed alone.
segment.target: Keyboard help now reads the names of modifier keys when pressed alone.

segment.source: Key names announced by keyboard help are now translatable.
segment.target: Key names announced by keyboard help are now translatable.

segment.source: Added support for the recognized text field in SiRecognizer. (#198)
segment.target: Added support for the recognized text field in SiRecognizer. (#198)

segment.source: Support for braille displays!
segment.target: Support for braille displays!

segment.source: Added a command (NVDA+c) to report the text on the Windows clipboard. (#193)
segment.target: Added a command (NVDA+c) to report the text on the Windows clipboard. (#193)

segment.source: In virtualBuffers, if NVDA automatically switches to focus mode, you can use the escape key to switch back to browse mode. NVDA+space can still also be used.
segment.target: In virtualBuffers, if NVDA automatically switches to focus mode, you can use the escape key to switch back to browse mode. NVDA+space can still also be used.

segment.source: In virtual buffers, when the focus changes or the caret is moved, NVDA can automatically switch to focus mode or browse mode as appropriate for the control under the caret. This is configured from the Virtual Buffers dialog. (#157)
segment.target: In virtual buffers, when the focus changes or the caret is moved, NVDA can automatically switch to focus mode or browse mode as appropriate for the control under the caret. This is configured from the Virtual Buffers dialog. (#157)

segment.source: Rewritten SAPI4 synthesizer driver which replaces the sapi4serotek and sapi4activeVoice drivers and should fix the problems encountered with these drivers.
segment.target: Rewritten SAPI4 synthesizer driver which replaces the sapi4serotek and sapi4activeVoice drivers and should fix the problems encountered with these drivers.

segment.source: The NVDA application now includes a manifest, which means that it no longer runs in compatibility mode in Windows Vista.
segment.target: The NVDA application now includes a manifest, which means that it no longer runs in compatibility mode in Windows Vista.

segment.source: The configuration file and speech dictionaries are now saved in the user's application data directory if NVDA was installed using the installer. This is necessary for Windows Vista and also allows multiple users to have individual NVDA configurations.
segment.target: The configuration file and speech dictionaries are now saved in the user's application data directory if NVDA was installed using the installer. This is necessary for Windows Vista and also allows multiple users to have individual NVDA configurations.

segment.source: Added support for position information for IAccessible2 controls.
segment.target: Added support for position information for IAccessible2 controls.

segment.source: Added the ability to copy text to the clipboard using the review cursor. NVDA+f9 sets the start marker to the current position of the review cursor. NVDA+f10 retrieves the text between the start marker and the current position of the review cursor and copies it to the clipboard. (#240)
segment.target: Added the ability to copy text to the clipboard using the review cursor. NVDA+f9 sets the start marker to the current position of the review cursor. NVDA+f10 retrieves the text between the start marker and the current position of the review cursor and copies it to the clipboard. (#240)

segment.source: Added support for some edit controls in pinacle tv software.
segment.target: Added support for some edit controls in pinacle tv software.

segment.source: When announcing selected text for long selections (512 characters or more), NVDA now speaks the number of selected characters, rather than speaking the entire selection. (#249)
segment.target: When announcing selected text for long selections (512 characters or more), NVDA now speaks the number of selected characters, rather than speaking the entire selection. (#249)

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: If the audio output device is set to use the Windows default device (Microsoft Sound Mapper), NVDA will now switch to the new default device for eSpeak and tones when the default device changes. For example, NVDA will switch to a USB audio device if it automatically becomes the default device when it is connected.
segment.target: If the audio output device is set to use the Windows default device (Microsoft Sound Mapper), NVDA will now switch to the new default device for eSpeak and tones when the default device changes. For example, NVDA will switch to a USB audio device if it automatically becomes the default device when it is connected.

segment.source: Improve performance of eSpeak with some Windows Vista audio drivers.
segment.target: Improve performance of eSpeak with some Windows Vista audio drivers.

segment.source: reporting of links, headings, tables, lists and block quotes can now be configured from the Document Formatting settings dialog. Previously to configure these settings for virtual buffers, the virtual buffer settings dialog would have been used. Now all documents share this configuration.
segment.target: reporting of links, headings, tables, lists and block quotes can now be configured from the Document Formatting settings dialog. Previously to configure these settings for virtual buffers, the virtual buffer settings dialog would have been used. Now all documents share this configuration.

segment.source: Rate is now the default setting in the speech synthesizer settings ring.
segment.target: Rate is now the default setting in the speech synthesizer settings ring.

segment.source: Improve the loading and unloading of appModules.
segment.target: Improve the loading and unloading of appModules.

segment.source: The title command (NVDA+t) now only reports the title instead of the entire object. If the foreground object has no name, the application's process name is used.
segment.target: The title command (NVDA+t) now only reports the title instead of the entire object. If the foreground object has no name, the application's process name is used.

segment.source: Instead of virtual buffer pass through on and off, NVDA now reports focus mode (pass through on) and browse mode (pass through off).
segment.target: Instead of virtual buffer pass through on and off, NVDA now reports focus mode (pass through on) and browse mode (pass through off).

segment.source: Voices are now stored in the configuration file by ID instead of by index. This makes voice settings more reliable across systems and configuration changes. The voice setting will not be preserved in old configurations and an error may be logged the first time a synthesizer is used. (#19)
segment.target: Voices are now stored in the configuration file by ID instead of by index. This makes voice settings more reliable across systems and configuration changes. The voice setting will not be preserved in old configurations and an error may be logged the first time a synthesizer is used. (#19)

segment.source: The level of a tree view item is now announced first if it has changed from the previously focused item for all tree views. Previously, this was only occurring for native Windows (SysTreeView32) tree views.
segment.target: The level of a tree view item is now announced first if it has changed from the previously focused item for all tree views. Previously, this was only occurring for native Windows (SysTreeView32) tree views.

segment.source: Bug Fixes
segment.target: Bug Fixes

segment.source: The last chunk of audio is no longer cut off when using NVDA with eSpeak on a remote desktop server.
segment.target: The last chunk of audio is no longer cut off when using NVDA with eSpeak on a remote desktop server.

segment.source: Fix problems with saving speech dictionaries for certain voices.
segment.target: Fix problems with saving speech dictionaries for certain voices.

segment.source: Eliminate the lag when moving by units other than character (word, line, etc.) towards the bottom of large plain text documents in Mozilla Gecko virtual buffers. (#155)
segment.target: Eliminate the lag when moving by units other than character (word, line, etc.) towards the bottom of large plain text documents in Mozilla Gecko virtual buffers. (#155)

segment.source: If speak typed words is enabled, announce the word when enter is pressed.
segment.target: If speak typed words is enabled, announce the word when enter is pressed.

segment.source: Fix some character set issues in richedit documents.
segment.target: Fix some character set issues in richedit documents.

segment.source: The NVDA log viewer now uses richedit instead of just edit to display the log. This improves reading by word with NVDA.
segment.target: The NVDA log viewer now uses richedit instead of just edit to display the log. This improves reading by word with NVDA.

segment.source: Fix some issues related to embedded objects in richedit controls.
segment.target: Fix some issues related to embedded objects in richedit controls.

segment.source: NVDA now reads page numbers in Microsoft Word. (#120)
segment.target: NVDA now reads page numbers in Microsoft Word. (#120)

segment.source: Fix the issue where tabbing to a checked checkbox in a Mozilla Gecko virtual buffer and pressing space would not announce that the checkbox was being unchecked.
segment.target: Fix the issue where tabbing to a checked checkbox in a Mozilla Gecko virtual buffer and pressing space would not announce that the checkbox was being unchecked.

segment.source: Correctly report partially checked checkboxes in Mozilla applications.
segment.target: Correctly report partially checked checkboxes in Mozilla applications.

segment.source: If the text selection expands or shrinks in both directions, read the selection as one chunk instead of two.
segment.target: If the text selection expands or shrinks in both directions, read the selection as one chunk instead of two.

segment.source: When reading with the mouse, text in Mozilla Gecko edit fields should now be read.
segment.target: When reading with the mouse, text in Mozilla Gecko edit fields should now be read.

segment.source: Say all should no longer cause certain SAPI5 synthesizers to crash.
segment.target: Say all should no longer cause certain SAPI5 synthesizers to crash.

segment.source: Fixed an issue which meant that text selection changes were not being read in Windows standard edit controls before the first focus change after NVDA was started.
segment.target: Fixed an issue which meant that text selection changes were not being read in Windows standard edit controls before the first focus change after NVDA was started.

segment.source: Fix mouse tracking in Java objects. (#185)
segment.target: Fix mouse tracking in Java objects. (#185)

segment.source: NVDA no longer reports Java tree view items with no children as being collapsed.
segment.target: NVDA no longer reports Java tree view items with no children as being collapsed.

segment.source: Announce the object with focus when a Java window comes to the foreground. Previously, only the top-level Java object was announced.
segment.target: Announce the object with focus when a Java window comes to the foreground. Previously, only the top-level Java object was announced.

segment.source: The eSpeak synthesizer driver no longer stops speaking completely after a single error.
segment.target: The eSpeak synthesizer driver no longer stops speaking completely after a single error.

segment.source: Fix the issue whereby updated voice parameters (rate, pitch, etc.) were not saved when the voice was changed from the synthesizer settings ring.
segment.target: Fix the issue whereby updated voice parameters (rate, pitch, etc.) were not saved when the voice was changed from the synthesizer settings ring.

segment.source: Improved the speaking of typed characters and words.
segment.target: Improved the speaking of typed characters and words.

segment.source: Some new text that was previously not spoken in text console applications (such as some text adventure games) is now spoken.
segment.target: Some new text that was previously not spoken in text console applications (such as some text adventure games) is now spoken.

segment.source: NVDA now ignores focus changes in background windows. Previously, a background focus change could be treated as if the real focus changed.
segment.target: NVDA now ignores focus changes in background windows. Previously, a background focus change could be treated as if the real focus changed.

segment.source: Improved the detection of the focus when leaving context menus. Previously, NVDA often didn't react at all when leaving a context menu.
segment.target: Improved the detection of the focus when leaving context menus. Previously, NVDA often didn't react at all when leaving a context menu.

segment.source: NVDA now announces when the context menu is activated in the Start menu.
segment.target: NVDA now announces when the context menu is activated in the Start menu.

segment.source: The classic Start menu is now announced as Start menu instead of Application menu.
segment.target: The classic Start menu is now announced as Start menu instead of Application menu.

segment.source: Improved the reading of alerts such as those encountered in Mozilla Firefox. The text should no longer be read multiple times and other extraneous information will no longer be read. (#248)
segment.target: Improved the reading of alerts such as those encountered in Mozilla Firefox. The text should no longer be read multiple times and other extraneous information will no longer be read. (#248)

segment.source: The text of focusable, read-only edit fields will no longer be included when retrieving the text of dialogs. This fixes, for example, the automatic reading of the entire license agreement in installers.
segment.target: The text of focusable, read-only edit fields will no longer be included when retrieving the text of dialogs. This fixes, for example, the automatic reading of the entire license agreement in installers.

segment.source: NVDA no longer announces the unselection of text when leaving some edit controls (example: Internet Explorer address bar, Thunderbird 3 email address fields).
segment.target: NVDA no longer announces the unselection of text when leaving some edit controls (example: Internet Explorer address bar, Thunderbird 3 email address fields).

segment.source: When opening plain text emails in Outlook Express and Windows Mail, focus is correctly placed in the message ready for the user to read it. Previously the user had to press tab or click on the message in order to use cursor keys to read it.
segment.target: When opening plain text emails in Outlook Express and Windows Mail, focus is correctly placed in the message ready for the user to read it. Previously the user had to press tab or click on the message in order to use cursor keys to read it.

segment.source: Fixed several major issues with the "Speak command keys" functionality.
segment.target: Fixed several major issues with the "Speak command keys" functionality.

segment.source: NVDA can now read text past 65535 characters in standard edit controls (e.g. a large file in Notepad).
segment.target: NVDA can now read text past 65535 characters in standard edit controls (e.g. a large file in Notepad).

segment.source: Improved line reading in MSHTML edit fields (Outlook Express editable messages and Internet Explorer text input fields).
segment.target: Improved line reading in MSHTML edit fields (Outlook Express editable messages and Internet Explorer text input fields).

segment.source: NVDA no longer sometimes freezes completely when editing text in OpenOffice. (#148, #180)
segment.target: NVDA no longer sometimes freezes completely when editing text in OpenOffice. (#148, #180)

segment.source: Improved the default ESpeak voice in NVDA
segment.target: Improved the default ESpeak voice in NVDA

segment.source: Added a laptop keyboard layout. Keyboard layouts can be configured from NVDA's Keyboard settings dialog. (#60)
segment.target: Added a laptop keyboard layout. Keyboard layouts can be configured from NVDA's Keyboard settings dialog. (#60)

segment.source: Support for grouping items in SysListView32 controls, mainly found in Windows Vista. (#27)
segment.target: Support for grouping items in SysListView32 controls, mainly found in Windows Vista. (#27)

segment.source: Report the checked state of treeview items in SysTreeview32 controls.
segment.target: Report the checked state of treeview items in SysTreeview32 controls.

segment.source: Added shortcut keys for many of NVDA's configuration dialogs
segment.target: Added shortcut keys for many of NVDA's configuration dialogs

segment.source: Support for IAccessible2 enabled applications such as Mozilla Firefox when running NVDA from portable media, with out having to register any special Dll files
segment.target: Support for IAccessible2 enabled applications such as Mozilla Firefox when running NVDA from portable media, with out having to register any special Dll files

segment.source: Fix a crash with the virtualBuffers Links List in Gecko applications. (#48)
segment.target: Fix a crash with the virtualBuffers Links List in Gecko applications. (#48)

segment.source: NVDA should no longer crash Mozilla Gecko applications such as Firefox and Thunderbird if NVDA is running with higher privilages than the Mozilla Gecko application. E.g. NVDA is running as Administrator.
segment.target: NVDA should no longer crash Mozilla Gecko applications such as Firefox and Thunderbird if NVDA is running with higher privilages than the Mozilla Gecko application. E.g. NVDA is running as Administrator.

segment.source: Speech dictionaries (previously User dictionaries) now can be either case sensitive or insensitive, and the patterns can optionally be regular expressions. (#39)
segment.target: Speech dictionaries (previously User dictionaries) now can be either case sensitive or insensitive, and the patterns can optionally be regular expressions. (#39)

segment.source: Whether or not NVDA uses a 'screen layout' mode for virtual buffer documents can now be configured from a settings dialog
segment.target: Whether or not NVDA uses a 'screen layout' mode for virtual buffer documents can now be configured from a settings dialog

segment.source: No longer report anchor tags with no href in Gecko documents as links. (#47)
segment.target: No longer report anchor tags with no href in Gecko documents as links. (#47)

segment.source: The NVDA find command now remembers what you last searched for, across all applications. (#53)
segment.target: The NVDA find command now remembers what you last searched for, across all applications. (#53)

segment.source: Fix issues where the checked state would not be announced for some checkboxes and radio buttons in virtualBuffers
segment.target: Fix issues where the checked state would not be announced for some checkboxes and radio buttons in virtualBuffers

segment.source: VirtualBuffer pass-through mode is now specific to each document, rather than NVDA globally. (#33)
segment.target: VirtualBuffer pass-through mode is now specific to each document, rather than NVDA globally. (#33)

segment.source: Fixed some sluggishness with focus changes and incorrect speech interuption which sometimes occured when using NVDA on a system that had been on standby or was rather slow
segment.target: Fixed some sluggishness with focus changes and incorrect speech interuption which sometimes occured when using NVDA on a system that had been on standby or was rather slow

segment.source: Improve support for combo boxes in Mozilla Firefox. Specifically when arrowing around them text isn't repeated, and when jumping out of them, ancestor controls are not announced unnecessarily. Also virtualBuffer commands now work when focused on one when you are in a virtualBuffer.
segment.target: Improve support for combo boxes in Mozilla Firefox. Specifically when arrowing around them text isn't repeated, and when jumping out of them, ancestor controls are not announced unnecessarily. Also virtualBuffer commands now work when focused on one when you are in a virtualBuffer.

segment.source: Improve accuracy of finding the statusbar in many applications. (#8)
segment.target: Improve accuracy of finding the statusbar in many applications. (#8)

segment.source: Added the NVDA interactive Python console tool, to enable developers to look at and manipulate NVDA's internals as it is running
segment.target: Added the NVDA interactive Python console tool, to enable developers to look at and manipulate NVDA's internals as it is running

segment.source: sayAll, reportSelection and reportCurrentLine scripts now work properly when in virtualBuffer pass-through mode. (#52)
segment.target: sayAll, reportSelection and reportCurrentLine scripts now work properly when in virtualBuffer pass-through mode. (#52)

segment.source: The increase rate and decrease rate scripts have been removed. Users should use the synth settings ring scripts (control+nvda+arrows) or the Voice settings dialog
segment.target: The increase rate and decrease rate scripts have been removed. Users should use the synth settings ring scripts (control+nvda+arrows) or the Voice settings dialog

segment.source: Improve the range and scale of the progress bar beeps
segment.target: Improve the range and scale of the progress bar beeps

segment.source: Added more quick keys to the new virtualBuffers: l for list, i for list item, e for edit field, b for button, x for checkbox, r for radio button, g for graphic, q for blockquote, c for combo box, 1 through 6 for respective heading levels, s for separator, m for frame. (#67, #102, #108)
segment.target: Added more quick keys to the new virtualBuffers: l for list, i for list item, e for edit field, b for button, x for checkbox, r for radio button, g for graphic, q for blockquote, c for combo box, 1 through 6 for respective heading levels, s for separator, m for frame. (#67, #102, #108)

segment.source: Canceling the loading of a new document in Mozilla Firefox now allows the user to keep using the old document's virtualBuffer if the old document hadn't yet really been destroyed. (#63)
segment.target: Canceling the loading of a new document in Mozilla Firefox now allows the user to keep using the old document's virtualBuffer if the old document hadn't yet really been destroyed. (#63)

segment.source: Navigating by words in virtualBuffers is now more accurate as words do not accidentally contain text from more than one field. (#70)
segment.target: Navigating by words in virtualBuffers is now more accurate as words do not accidentally contain text from more than one field. (#70)

segment.source: Improved accuracy of focus tracking and focus updating when navigating in Mozilla Gecko virtualBuffers.
segment.target: Improved accuracy of focus tracking and focus updating when navigating in Mozilla Gecko virtualBuffers.

segment.source: Added a findPrevious script (shift+NVDA+f3) for use in new virtualBuffers
segment.target: Added a findPrevious script (shift+NVDA+f3) for use in new virtualBuffers

segment.source: Improved sluggishness in Mozilla Gecko dialogs (in Firefox and Thunderbird). (#66)
segment.target: Improved sluggishness in Mozilla Gecko dialogs (in Firefox and Thunderbird). (#66)

segment.source: Add the ability to view the current log file for NVDA. it can be found in the NVDA menu -> Tools
segment.target: Add the ability to view the current log file for NVDA. it can be found in the NVDA menu -> Tools

segment.source: Scripts such as say time and date now take the current language in to account; punctuation and ordering of words now reflects the language
segment.target: Scripts such as say time and date now take the current language in to account; punctuation and ordering of words now reflects the language

segment.source: The language combo box in NVDA's General settings dialog now shows full language names for ease of use
segment.target: The language combo box in NVDA's General settings dialog now shows full language names for ease of use

segment.source: When reviewing text in the current navigator object, the text is always up to date if it changes dynamically. E.g. reviewing the text of a list item in Task Manager. (#15)
segment.target: When reviewing text in the current navigator object, the text is always up to date if it changes dynamically. E.g. reviewing the text of a list item in Task Manager. (#15)

segment.source: When moving with the mouse, the current paragraph of text under the mouse is now announced, rather than either all the text in that particular object or just the current word. Also audio coordinates, and announcement of object roles is optional, they are turned off by default
segment.target: When moving with the mouse, the current paragraph of text under the mouse is now announced, rather than either all the text in that particular object or just the current word. Also audio coordinates, and announcement of object roles is optional, they are turned off by default

segment.source: Support for reading text with the mouse in Microsoft Word
segment.target: Support for reading text with the mouse in Microsoft Word

segment.source: Fixed bug where leaving the menu bar in applications such as Wordpad would cause text selection to not be announced anymore
segment.target: Fixed bug where leaving the menu bar in applications such as Wordpad would cause text selection to not be announced anymore

segment.source: In Winamp, the title of the track is no longer announced again and again when switching tracks, or pausing/resuming/stopping playback.
segment.target: In Winamp, the title of the track is no longer announced again and again when switching tracks, or pausing/resuming/stopping playback.

segment.source: In Winamp, Added ability to announce state of the shuffle and repeat controls as they are switched. Works in the main window and in the playlist editor
segment.target: In Winamp, Added ability to announce state of the shuffle and repeat controls as they are switched. Works in the main window and in the playlist editor

segment.source: Improve the ability to activate particular fields in Mozilla Gecko virtualBuffers. May include clickable graphics, links containing paragraphs, and other weird structures
segment.target: Improve the ability to activate particular fields in Mozilla Gecko virtualBuffers. May include clickable graphics, links containing paragraphs, and other weird structures

segment.source: Fixed an initial lag when opening NVDA dialogs on some systems. (#65)
segment.target: Fixed an initial lag when opening NVDA dialogs on some systems. (#65)

segment.source: Add specific support for the Total Commander application
segment.target: Add specific support for the Total Commander application

segment.source: Fix bug in the sapi4serotek driver where the pitch could get locked at a particular value, i.e. stays high after reading a capital letter. (#89)
segment.target: Fix bug in the sapi4serotek driver where the pitch could get locked at a particular value, i.e. stays high after reading a capital letter. (#89)

segment.source: Announce clickable text and other fields as clickable in Mozilla Gecko VirtualBuffers. e.g. a field which has an onclick HTML attribute. (#91)
segment.target: Announce clickable text and other fields as clickable in Mozilla Gecko VirtualBuffers. e.g. a field which has an onclick HTML attribute. (#91)

segment.source: When moving around Mozilla Gecko virtualBuffers, scroll the current field in to view -- useful so sighted peers have an idea of where the user is up to in the document. (#57)
segment.target: When moving around Mozilla Gecko virtualBuffers, scroll the current field in to view -- useful so sighted peers have an idea of where the user is up to in the document. (#57)

segment.source: Add basic support for ARIA live region show events in IAccessible2 enabled applications. Useful in the Chatzilla IRC application, new messages will now be read automatically
segment.target: Add basic support for ARIA live region show events in IAccessible2 enabled applications. Useful in the Chatzilla IRC application, new messages will now be read automatically

segment.source: Some slight improvements to help use ARIA enabled web applications, e.g. Google Docs
segment.target: Some slight improvements to help use ARIA enabled web applications, e.g. Google Docs

segment.source: Stop adding extra blank lines to text when copying it from a virtualBuffer
segment.target: Stop adding extra blank lines to text when copying it from a virtualBuffer

segment.source: Stop the space key from activating a link in the Links List. Now it can be used like other letters in order to start typing the name of a particular link you wish to go to
segment.target: Stop the space key from activating a link in the Links List. Now it can be used like other letters in order to start typing the name of a particular link you wish to go to

segment.source: The moveMouseToNavigator script (NVDA+numpadSlash) now moves the mouse to the centre of the navigator object, rather than the top left
segment.target: The moveMouseToNavigator script (NVDA+numpadSlash) now moves the mouse to the centre of the navigator object, rather than the top left

segment.source: Added scripts to click the left and right mouse buttons (numpadSlash and numpadStar respectively)
segment.target: Added scripts to click the left and right mouse buttons (numpadSlash and numpadStar respectively)

segment.source: Improve access to the Windows System Tray. Focus hopefully should no longer seem to keep jumping back to one particular item. Reminder: to get to the System Tray use the Windows command WindowsKey+b. (#10)
segment.target: Improve access to the Windows System Tray. Focus hopefully should no longer seem to keep jumping back to one particular item. Reminder: to get to the System Tray use the Windows command WindowsKey+b. (#10)

segment.source: Improve performance and stop announcing extra text when holding down a cursor key in an edit field and it hits the end
segment.target: Improve performance and stop announcing extra text when holding down a cursor key in an edit field and it hits the end

segment.source: Stop the ability for NVDA to make the user wait while particular messages are spoken. Fixes some crashes/freezes with particular speech synthesizers. (#117)
segment.target: Stop the ability for NVDA to make the user wait while particular messages are spoken. Fixes some crashes/freezes with particular speech synthesizers. (#117)

segment.source: Added support for the Audiologic Tts3 speech synthesizer, contribution by Gianluca Casalino. (#105)
segment.target: Added support for the Audiologic Tts3 speech synthesizer, contribution by Gianluca Casalino. (#105)

segment.source: Possibly improve performance when navigating around documents in Microsoft Word
segment.target: Possibly improve performance when navigating around documents in Microsoft Word

segment.source: Improved accuracy when reading text of alerts in Mozilla Gecko applications
segment.target: Improved accuracy when reading text of alerts in Mozilla Gecko applications

segment.source: Stop possible crashes when trying to save configuration on non-English versions of Windows. (#114)
segment.target: Stop possible crashes when trying to save configuration on non-English versions of Windows. (#114)

segment.source: Add an NVDA welcome dialog. This dialog is designed to provide essential information for new users and allows CapsLock to be configured as an NVDA modifier key. This dialog will be displayed when NVDA is started by default until it is disabled.
segment.target: Add an NVDA welcome dialog. This dialog is designed to provide essential information for new users and allows CapsLock to be configured as an NVDA modifier key. This dialog will be displayed when NVDA is started by default until it is disabled.

segment.source: Fix basic support for Adobe Reader so it is possible to read documents in versions 8 and 9
segment.target: Fix basic support for Adobe Reader so it is possible to read documents in versions 8 and 9

segment.source: Fix some errors that may have occured when holding down keys before NVDA is properly initialized
segment.target: Fix some errors that may have occured when holding down keys before NVDA is properly initialized

segment.source: If the user has configured NVDA to save configuration on exit, make sure the configuration is properly saved when shutting down or logging out of Windows.
segment.target: If the user has configured NVDA to save configuration on exit, make sure the configuration is properly saved when shutting down or logging out of Windows.

segment.source: Added an NVDA logo sound to the beginning of the installer, contributed by Victer Tsaran
segment.target: Added an NVDA logo sound to the beginning of the installer, contributed by Victer Tsaran

segment.source: NVDA, both running in the installer and otherwise, should properly clean up its system tray icon when it exits
segment.target: NVDA, both running in the installer and otherwise, should properly clean up its system tray icon when it exits

segment.source: Labels for standard controls in NVDA's dialogs (such as Ok and cancel buttons) should now show in the language NVDA is set to, rather than just staying in English.
segment.target: Labels for standard controls in NVDA's dialogs (such as Ok and cancel buttons) should now show in the language NVDA is set to, rather than just staying in English.

segment.source: NVDA's icon should now be used for the NVDA shortcuts in the start menu and on the Desktop, rather than a default application icon.
segment.target: NVDA's icon should now be used for the NVDA shortcuts in the start menu and on the Desktop, rather than a default application icon.

segment.source: Read cells in MS Excel when moving with tab and shift+tab. (#146)
segment.target: Read cells in MS Excel when moving with tab and shift+tab. (#146)

segment.source: Fix some double speaking in particular lists in Skype.
segment.target: Fix some double speaking in particular lists in Skype.

segment.source: Improved caret tracking in IAccessible2 and Java applications; e.g. in Open Office and Lotus Symphony, NVDA properly waits for the caret to move in documents rather than accidentally reading the wrong word or line at the end of some paragraphs. (#119)
segment.target: Improved caret tracking in IAccessible2 and Java applications; e.g. in Open Office and Lotus Symphony, NVDA properly waits for the caret to move in documents rather than accidentally reading the wrong word or line at the end of some paragraphs. (#119)

segment.source: Support for AkelEdit controls found in Akelpad 4.0
segment.target: Support for AkelEdit controls found in Akelpad 4.0

segment.source: NVDA no longer locks up in Lotus Synphony when moving from the document to the menu bar.
segment.target: NVDA no longer locks up in Lotus Synphony when moving from the document to the menu bar.

segment.source: NVDA no longer freezes in the Windows XP Add/Remove programs applet when launching an uninstaller. (#30)
segment.target: NVDA no longer freezes in the Windows XP Add/Remove programs applet when launching an uninstaller. (#30)

segment.source: NVDA no longer freezes when opening Spybot Search and Destroy
segment.target: NVDA no longer freezes when opening Spybot Search and Destroy

segment.source: Access to web content with new in-process virtualBuffers (so far for Mozilla Gecko applications including Firefox3 and Thunderbird3)
segment.target: Access to web content with new in-process virtualBuffers (so far for Mozilla Gecko applications including Firefox3 and Thunderbird3)

segment.source: Load times have been improved almost by a factor of thirty (you no longer have to wait at all for most web pages to load in to the buffer)
segment.target: Load times have been improved almost by a factor of thirty (you no longer have to wait at all for most web pages to load in to the buffer)

segment.source: Added a links list (NVDA+f7)
segment.target: Added a links list (NVDA+f7)

segment.source: Improved the find dialog (control+nvda+f) so that it performs a case-insencitive search, plus fixed a few focus issues with that dialog box.
segment.target: Improved the find dialog (control+nvda+f) so that it performs a case-insencitive search, plus fixed a few focus issues with that dialog box.

segment.source: It is now possible to select and copy text in the new virtualBuffers
segment.target: It is now possible to select and copy text in the new virtualBuffers

segment.source: By default the new virtualBuffers represent the document in a screen layout (links and controls are not on separate lines unless they really are visually). You can toggle this feature with NVDA+v.
segment.target: By default the new virtualBuffers represent the document in a screen layout (links and controls are not on separate lines unless they really are visually). You can toggle this feature with NVDA+v.

segment.source: It is possible to move by paragraph with control+upArrow and control+downArrow.
segment.target: It is possible to move by paragraph with control+upArrow and control+downArrow.

segment.source: Improved support for dynamic content
segment.target: Improved support for dynamic content

segment.source: Improved over all accuracy of reading lines and fields when arrowing up and down.
segment.target: Improved over all accuracy of reading lines and fields when arrowing up and down.

segment.source: Internationalization
segment.target: Internationalization

segment.source: It is now possible to type accented characters that rely on a "dead character", while NVDA is running.
segment.target: It is now possible to type accented characters that rely on a "dead character", while NVDA is running.

segment.source: NVDA now announces when the keyboard layout is changed (when pressing alt+shift).
segment.target: NVDA now announces when the keyboard layout is changed (when pressing alt+shift).

segment.source: The announce date and time feature now takes the system's current regional and language options in to account.
segment.target: The announce date and time feature now takes the system's current regional and language options in to account.

segment.source: added czech translation (by Tomas Valusek with help from Jaromir Vit)
segment.target: added czech translation (by Tomas Valusek with help from Jaromir Vit)

segment.source: added vietnamese translation by Dang Hoai Phuc
segment.target: added vietnamese translation by Dang Hoai Phuc

segment.source: Added Africaans (af_ZA) translation, by Willem van der Walt.
segment.target: Added Africaans (af_ZA) translation, by Willem van der Walt.

segment.source: Added russian translation by Dmitry Kaslin
segment.target: Added russian translation by Dmitry Kaslin

segment.source: Added polish translation by DOROTA CZAJKA and friends.
segment.target: Added polish translation by DOROTA CZAJKA and friends.

segment.source: Added Japanese translation by Katsutoshi Tsuji.
segment.target: Added Japanese translation by Katsutoshi Tsuji.

segment.source: added Thai translation by Amorn Kiattikhunrat
segment.target: added Thai translation by Amorn Kiattikhunrat

segment.source: added croatian translation by Mario Percinic and Hrvoje Katic
segment.target: added croatian translation by Mario Percinic and Hrvoje Katic

segment.source: Added galician translation by Juan C. buno
segment.target: Added galician translation by Juan C. buno

segment.source: added ukrainian translation by Aleksey Sadovoy
segment.target: added ukrainian translation by Aleksey Sadovoy

segment.source: Speech
segment.target: Speech

segment.source: NVDA now comes packaged with eSpeak 1.33 which contains many improvements, among those are improved languages, named variants, ability to speak faster.
segment.target: NVDA now comes packaged with eSpeak 1.33 which contains many improvements, among those are improved languages, named variants, ability to speak faster.

segment.source: The voice settings dialog now allows you to change the variant of a synthesizer if it supports one. Variant is usually a slight variation on the current voice. (eSpeak supports variants).
segment.target: The voice settings dialog now allows you to change the variant of a synthesizer if it supports one. Variant is usually a slight variation on the current voice. (eSpeak supports variants).

segment.source: Added the ability to change the inflection of a voice in the voice settings dialog if the current synthesizer supports this. (eSpeak supports inflection).
segment.target: Added the ability to change the inflection of a voice in the voice settings dialog if the current synthesizer supports this. (eSpeak supports inflection).

segment.source: Added the ability to turn off speaking of object position information(e.g. 1 of 4). This option can be found in the Object presentation settings dialog.
segment.target: Added the ability to turn off speaking of object position information(e.g. 1 of 4). This option can be found in the Object presentation settings dialog.

segment.source: NVDA can now beep when speaking a capital letter. This can be turned on and off with a check box in the voice settings dialog. Also added a raise pitch for capitals check box to configure whether NVDA should actually do its normal pitch raise for capitals. So now you can have either raise pitch, say cap, or beep, for capitals.
segment.target: NVDA can now beep when speaking a capital letter. This can be turned on and off with a check box in the voice settings dialog. Also added a raise pitch for capitals check box to configure whether NVDA should actually do its normal pitch raise for capitals. So now you can have either raise pitch, say cap, or beep, for capitals.

segment.source: Added the ability to pause speech in NVDA (like found in Voice Over for the Mac). When NVDA is speaking something, you can press the control or shift keys to silence speech just like normal, but if you then tap the shift key again (as long as you havn't pressed any other keys) speech will continue from exactly where it left off.
segment.target: Added the ability to pause speech in NVDA (like found in Voice Over for the Mac). When NVDA is speaking something, you can press the control or shift keys to silence speech just like normal, but if you then tap the shift key again (as long as you havn't pressed any other keys) speech will continue from exactly where it left off.

segment.source: Added a virtual synthDriver which outputs text to a window instead of speaking via a speech synthesiser. This should be more pleasant for sighted developers who are not used to speech synthesis but want to know what is spoken by NVDA. There are probably still some bugs, so feedback is most definitely welcome.
segment.target: Added a virtual synthDriver which outputs text to a window instead of speaking via a speech synthesiser. This should be more pleasant for sighted developers who are not used to speech synthesis but want to know what is spoken by NVDA. There are probably still some bugs, so feedback is most definitely welcome.

segment.source: NVDA no longer by default speaks punctuation, you can enable speaking of punctuation with NVDA+p.
segment.target: NVDA no longer by default speaks punctuation, you can enable speaking of punctuation with NVDA+p.

segment.source: eSpeak by default now speaks quite a bit slower, which should make it easier for people who are using eSpeak for the first time, when installing or starting to use NVDA.
segment.target: eSpeak by default now speaks quite a bit slower, which should make it easier for people who are using eSpeak for the first time, when installing or starting to use NVDA.

segment.source: Added user dictionaries to NVDA. These allow you to make NVDA speak certain text differently. There are three dictionaries: default, voice, and temporary. Entries you add to the default dictionary will happen all the time in NVDA. Voice dictionaries are specific to the current synthesizer and voice you currently have set. And temporary dictionary is for those times you quickly want to set a rule while you are doing a particular task, but you don't want it to be perminant (it will disappear if you close NVDA). For now the rules are regular expressions, not just normal text.
segment.target: Added user dictionaries to NVDA. These allow you to make NVDA speak certain text differently. There are three dictionaries: default, voice, and temporary. Entries you add to the default dictionary will happen all the time in NVDA. Voice dictionaries are specific to the current synthesizer and voice you currently have set. And temporary dictionary is for those times you quickly want to set a rule while you are doing a particular task, but you don't want it to be perminant (it will disappear if you close NVDA). For now the rules are regular expressions, not just normal text.

segment.source: Synthesizers can now use any audio output device on your system, by setting the output device combo box in the Synthesizer dialog before selecting the synthesizer you want.
segment.target: Synthesizers can now use any audio output device on your system, by setting the output device combo box in the Synthesizer dialog before selecting the synthesizer you want.

segment.source: Performance
segment.target: Performance

segment.source: NVDA no longer takes up a huge amount of system memory , when editing messages in mshtml edit controls
segment.target: NVDA no longer takes up a huge amount of system memory , when editing messages in mshtml edit controls

segment.source: Improved performance when reviewing text inside many controls that do not actually have a real cursor. e.g. MSN Messenger history window, treeview items, listview items etc.
segment.target: Improved performance when reviewing text inside many controls that do not actually have a real cursor. e.g. MSN Messenger history window, treeview items, listview items etc.

segment.source: Improved performance in rich edit documents.
segment.target: Improved performance in rich edit documents.

segment.source: NVDA should no longer slowly creep up in system memory size for no reason
segment.target: NVDA should no longer slowly creep up in system memory size for no reason

segment.source: Fixed bugs when trying to focus on a dos console window more than three or so times. NVDA did have a tendency to completely crash.
segment.target: Fixed bugs when trying to focus on a dos console window more than three or so times. NVDA did have a tendency to completely crash.

segment.source: Key commands
segment.target: Key commands

segment.source: NVDA+shift+numpad6 and NVDA+shift+numpad4 allow you to navigate to the next or previous object in flow respectively. This means that you can navigate in an application by only using these two keys with out having to worry about going up by parent, or down to first child as you move around the object hyerarchy. For instance in a web browser such as firefox, you could navigate the document by object, by just using these two keys. If next in flow or previous in flow takes you up and out of an object, or down in to an object, ordered beeps indicate the direction.
segment.target: NVDA+shift+numpad6 and NVDA+shift+numpad4 allow you to navigate to the next or previous object in flow respectively. This means that you can navigate in an application by only using these two keys with out having to worry about going up by parent, or down to first child as you move around the object hyerarchy. For instance in a web browser such as firefox, you could navigate the document by object, by just using these two keys. If next in flow or previous in flow takes you up and out of an object, or down in to an object, ordered beeps indicate the direction.

segment.source: You can now configure voice settings with out opening the voice settings dialog, by using the Synth Settings Ring. The synth settings ring is a group of voice settings you can toggle through by pressing control+NVDA+right and control+NVDA+left. To change a setting use control+NVDA+up and control+NVDA+down.
segment.target: You can now configure voice settings with out opening the voice settings dialog, by using the Synth Settings Ring. The synth settings ring is a group of voice settings you can toggle through by pressing control+NVDA+right and control+NVDA+left. To change a setting use control+NVDA+up and control+NVDA+down.

segment.source: Added a command to report the current selection in edit fields (NVDA+shift+upArrow).
segment.target: Added a command to report the current selection in edit fields (NVDA+shift+upArrow).

segment.source: Quite a few NVDA commands that speak text (such as report current line etc) now can spell the text if pressed twice quickly.
segment.target: Quite a few NVDA commands that speak text (such as report current line etc) now can spell the text if pressed twice quickly.

segment.source: the capslock, numpad insert and extended insert can all be used as the NVDA modifier key. Also if one of these keys is used, pressing the key twice with out pressing any other keys will send the key through to the operating system, just like you'd pressed the key with out NVDA running. To make one of these keys be the NVDA modifier key, check its checkbox in the Keyboard settings dialog (used to be called the keyboard echo dialog).
segment.target: the capslock, numpad insert and extended insert can all be used as the NVDA modifier key. Also if one of these keys is used, pressing the key twice with out pressing any other keys will send the key through to the operating system, just like you'd pressed the key with out NVDA running. To make one of these keys be the NVDA modifier key, check its checkbox in the Keyboard settings dialog (used to be called the keyboard echo dialog).

segment.source: Application support
segment.target: Application support

segment.source: Improved support for Firefox3 and Thunderbird3 documents. Load times have been improved by almost a factor of thirty, a screen layout is used by default (press nvda+v to toggle between this and no screen layout), a links list (nvda+f7 has been added), the find dialog (control+nvda+f) is now case-insensitive, much better support for dynamic content, selecting and copying text is now possible.
segment.target: Improved support for Firefox3 and Thunderbird3 documents. Load times have been improved by almost a factor of thirty, a screen layout is used by default (press nvda+v to toggle between this and no screen layout), a links list (nvda+f7 has been added), the find dialog (control+nvda+f) is now case-insensitive, much better support for dynamic content, selecting and copying text is now possible.

segment.source: In the MSN Messenger and Windows Live Messenger history windows, it is now possible to select and copy text.
segment.target: In the MSN Messenger and Windows Live Messenger history windows, it is now possible to select and copy text.

segment.source: Improved support for the audacity application
segment.target: Improved support for the audacity application

segment.source: Added support for a few edit/text controls in Skype
segment.target: Added support for a few edit/text controls in Skype

segment.source: Improved support for Miranda instant messenger application
segment.target: Improved support for Miranda instant messenger application

segment.source: Fixed some focus issues when opening html and plain text messages in Outlook Express.
segment.target: Fixed some focus issues when opening html and plain text messages in Outlook Express.

segment.source: Outlook express newsgroup message fields are now labeled correctly
segment.target: Outlook express newsgroup message fields are now labeled correctly

segment.source: NVDA can now read the addresses in the Outlook Express message fields (to/from/cc etc)
segment.target: NVDA can now read the addresses in the Outlook Express message fields (to/from/cc etc)

segment.source: NVDA should be now more accurate at announcing the next message in out look express when deleting a message from the message list.
segment.target: NVDA should be now more accurate at announcing the next message in out look express when deleting a message from the message list.

segment.source: APIs and toolkits
segment.target: APIs and toolkits

segment.source: Improved object navigation for MSAA objects. If a window has a system menu, title bar, or scroll bars, you can now navigate to them.
segment.target: Improved object navigation for MSAA objects. If a window has a system menu, title bar, or scroll bars, you can now navigate to them.

segment.source: Added support for the IAccessible2 accessibility API. A part from the ability to announce more control types, this also allows NVDA to access the cursor in applications such as Firefox 3 and Thunderbird 3, allowing you to navigate, select or edit text.
segment.target: Added support for the IAccessible2 accessibility API. A part from the ability to announce more control types, this also allows NVDA to access the cursor in applications such as Firefox 3 and Thunderbird 3, allowing you to navigate, select or edit text.

segment.source: Added support for Scintilla edit controls (such controls can be found in Notepad++ or Tortoise SVN).
segment.target: Added support for Scintilla edit controls (such controls can be found in Notepad++ or Tortoise SVN).

segment.source: Added support for Java applications (via the Java Access Bridge). This can provide basic support for Open Office (if Java is enabled), and any other stand-alone Java application. Note that java applets with in a web browser may not work yet.
segment.target: Added support for Java applications (via the Java Access Bridge). This can provide basic support for Open Office (if Java is enabled), and any other stand-alone Java application. Note that java applets with in a web browser may not work yet.

segment.source: Mouse
segment.target: Mouse

segment.source: Improved support for reading what is under the mouse pointer as it moves. It is now much faster, and it also now has the ability in some controls such as standard edit fields, Java and IAccessible2 controls, to read the current word, not just the current object. This may be of some used to vision impared people who just want to read a specific bit of text with the mouse.
segment.target: Improved support for reading what is under the mouse pointer as it moves. It is now much faster, and it also now has the ability in some controls such as standard edit fields, Java and IAccessible2 controls, to read the current word, not just the current object. This may be of some used to vision impared people who just want to read a specific bit of text with the mouse.

segment.source: Added a new config option, found in the mouse settings dialog. Play audio when mouse moves, when checked, plays a 40 ms beep each time the mouse moves, with its pitch (between 220 and 1760 hz) representing the y axis, and left/right volume, representing the x axis. This enables a blind person to get a rough idea of where the mouse is on the screen as its being moved. This feature also depends on reportObjectUnderMouse also being turned on. So this means that if you quickly need to disable both beeps and announcing of objects, then just press NVDA+m. The beeps are also louder or softer depending on how bright the screen is at that point.
segment.target: Added a new config option, found in the mouse settings dialog. Play audio when mouse moves, when checked, plays a 40 ms beep each time the mouse moves, with its pitch (between 220 and 1760 hz) representing the y axis, and left/right volume, representing the x axis. This enables a blind person to get a rough idea of where the mouse is on the screen as its being moved. This feature also depends on reportObjectUnderMouse also being turned on. So this means that if you quickly need to disable both beeps and announcing of objects, then just press NVDA+m. The beeps are also louder or softer depending on how bright the screen is at that point.

segment.source: Object presentation and interaction
segment.target: Object presentation and interaction

segment.source: Improved support for most common treeview controls. NVDA now tells you how many items are in the branch when you expand it. It also announces the level when moving in and out of branches. And, it announces the current item number and number of items, according to the current branch, not the entire treeview.
segment.target: Improved support for most common treeview controls. NVDA now tells you how many items are in the branch when you expand it. It also announces the level when moving in and out of branches. And, it announces the current item number and number of items, according to the current branch, not the entire treeview.

segment.source: Improved what is announced when focus changes as you move around applications or the operating system. Now instead of just hearing the control you land on, you hear information about any controls this control is positioned inside of. For instance if you tab and land on a button inside a groupbox, the groupbox will also get announced.
segment.target: Improved what is announced when focus changes as you move around applications or the operating system. Now instead of just hearing the control you land on, you hear information about any controls this control is positioned inside of. For instance if you tab and land on a button inside a groupbox, the groupbox will also get announced.

segment.source: NVDA now tries to speak the message inside many dialog boxes as they appear. This is accurate most of the time, though there are still many dialogs that arn't as good as they could be.
segment.target: NVDA now tries to speak the message inside many dialog boxes as they appear. This is accurate most of the time, though there are still many dialogs that arn't as good as they could be.

segment.source: Added a report object descriptions checkbox to the object presentation settings dialog. Power users may wish to sometimes uncheck this to stop NVDA announcing a lot of extra descriptions on particular controls, such as in Java applications.
segment.target: Added a report object descriptions checkbox to the object presentation settings dialog. Power users may wish to sometimes uncheck this to stop NVDA announcing a lot of extra descriptions on particular controls, such as in Java applications.

segment.source: NVDA automatically announces selected text in edit controls when focus moves to them. If there isn't any selected text, then it just announces the current line like usual.
segment.target: NVDA automatically announces selected text in edit controls when focus moves to them. If there isn't any selected text, then it just announces the current line like usual.

segment.source: NVDA is a lot more careful now when it plays beeps to indicate progress bar changes in applications. It no longer goes crazy in Eclipse applications such as Lotus Notes/Symphony, and Accessibility Probe.
segment.target: NVDA is a lot more careful now when it plays beeps to indicate progress bar changes in applications. It no longer goes crazy in Eclipse applications such as Lotus Notes/Symphony, and Accessibility Probe.

segment.source: User Interface
segment.target: User Interface

segment.source: Removed the NVDA interface window, and replaced it with a simple NVDA popup menu.
segment.target: Removed the NVDA interface window, and replaced it with a simple NVDA popup menu.

segment.source: NVDA's user interface settings dialog is now called General Settings. It also contains an extra setting: a combo box to set the log level, for what messages should go to NVDA's log file. Note that NVDA's log file is now called nvda.log not debug.log.
segment.target: NVDA's user interface settings dialog is now called General Settings. It also contains an extra setting: a combo box to set the log level, for what messages should go to NVDA's log file. Note that NVDA's log file is now called nvda.log not debug.log.

segment.source: Removed the report object group names checkBox from the object presentation settings dialog, reporting of group names now is handled differently.
segment.target: Removed the report object group names checkBox from the object presentation settings dialog, reporting of group names now is handled differently.

segment.source: NVDA now has a built-in synthesizer called eSpeak, developed by Jonathan Duddington.It is very responsive and lite-weight, and has support for many different languages. Sapi synthesizers can still be used, but eSpeak will be used by default.
segment.target: NVDA now has a built-in synthesizer called eSpeak, developed by Jonathan Duddington.It is very responsive and lite-weight, and has support for many different languages. Sapi synthesizers can still be used, but eSpeak will be used by default.

segment.source: eSpeak does not depend on any special software to be installed, so it can be used with NVDA on any computer, on a USB thumb drive, or anywhere.
segment.target: eSpeak does not depend on any special software to be installed, so it can be used with NVDA on any computer, on a USB thumb drive, or anywhere.
